A loan will help her expand her business and to be able to take proper care of her children. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the acquisition of a shop.

loans.use: To buy materials to sew

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is a 31-year-old member of Faulu Kenya. She sells cereal and vegetables for a living. She also works as a secretary. She has been running her business for two years and employs one person. She is thankful to Faulu Kenya for helping her improve her business through access to loans. She hopes to expand her business premises in the future. With 58,000 Kes, she will add to her stock of cereal.

loans.use: to add to her stock of cereals

loans.name: Orfilia De La Paz

texts.es:
Orfilia, resiD. en San Miguel, vive junto a un hijo, administra una tienda, la cual fue fundada por iniciativa propia hace 15 años, la atienD. todos los días D. 6:00am a 7:00pm, hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultad en la atención a los clientes y por lo mismo desea invertir un préstamo en mercadería.
Su compra específicamente será en arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles y detergentes, estos materiales son necesarios para ofrecer a los clientes ya que a diario frecuentan la tienda y los solicitan, el préstamo ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y a mejorar las ventas.
Para Orfilia la buena administración D. la tienda es su objetivo, ya que D. ella recibe las ganancias necesarias para cubrir las demandas D. su familia.
texts.en:
Orfilia lives in San Miguel together with her son.  She runs a store which she set up on her own initiative 15 years ago.  She serves in her store every day from 6.00am to 7.00pm.  She hasn't had any problems serving her customers and would like to invest a loan in buying merchandise.

In particular, Orfilia will buy rice, sugar, oil, beans and detergents.  She needs these products to offer her customers as they come to her store every day and request them.  This loan will help her to strengthen her business and improve her sales.

Orfilia's goal is to run her store well since it makes her the money she needs to cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans and detergents

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de pupusas, licuados y también comercializa cerdos, es una persona de familia, vive con su esposo; lleva cinco años de dedicarse a la pupuseria y crianza de cerdos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales y ampliar la granja de los cerdos, para lo cual necesita, madera, maya, clavos, también aprovechara para comprar materia prima para las pupusas, chicharrón, quesillo, pollo, maíz y aceite, este préstamo sin duda será una gran fortaleza para María, pues sus dos negocios se verán beneficiados.
Su aspiración es aumentar el chalet ofreciendo más alimentos a los clientes, también que su granja de cerdos crezca y generar más ingresos para la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Maria lives in Jiquilisco, located in the department of Uslután. She sells pupusas--a traditional Salvadoran dish made of handmade corn flat bread stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, and/or refried beans--and shakes, and she sells pigs. She has a family and lives with her husband. She has been selling pupusas and raising pigs for five years.

She is currently requesting a loan in order to purchase materials and expand her pig farm, so she needs lumber, agricultural fencing, and nails. She will also take this opportunity to purchase ingredients to make pupusas like pork rinds, cheese, chicken, cornmeal, and cooking oil. This loan will without a doubt give strength to Maria since her businesses will benefit.

Her aspiration is to expand her food business, offering more meals to her customers. She also hopes that her pig farm grows so that she can generate a bigger income for the household.

loans.use: to purchase pork rinds, cheese, chicken, cornmeal, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married and has a daughter, Darya. She lives in Zaporozhye. 

Svetlana sells women’s lingerie in a local market called "Krytyi" ("Covered"). She offers her merchandise at reasonable prices, which attracts customers to her vending location. Svetlana has been in the market for 11 years. She has invested about 65,000 UAH in merchandise. Her net profit amounts to 8,000 UAH a month. 

Svetlana is requesting a loan of 13,000 UAH to purchase seasonal merchandise for her kiosk. She is planning to stock seasonal tank tops, tube tops and underwear. Svetlana is hoping to expand her business and open a new vending location in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase women’s lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 28 years old. She is married and has one child who is 3 years old. Her husband works as a lawyer. She sells African cloths. Her business is well-organized. She has one year's experience in her business and she works from 8am to 8pm every day, except on Saturday.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via vision finance company in order to purchase more African cloths to sell. With any profit, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more African cloths to sell.

loans.name: Missira Samba Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Missira Samba  a été créé le 06 Décembre lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Il compte 28 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles  font toutes le petit commerce.

Madame Adama (au milieux du groupe, légèrement à droite et mise en médaillon) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 27 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants, elle prend aussi en charge aussi sa coépouse.

Elle gère une boutique et vend des légumes activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de deux ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de s’approvisionner en légume.

Les bénéfices de cette activité lui permettront d’acheter des légumes pour la revente et divers marchandises pour la boutique.
texts.en:
Missira Samba is a group that was created on December 6 when the Banc Villageois was inaugurated. The group is comprised of 28 women who all live in the same village. They all have small-scale businesses. Ms. Adama (in the middle-right of the group in the photo and appearing in the cameo) is the group’s official. She is 27 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She also supports her co-wife. 

Ms. Adama runs a shop and sells vegetables. This is a business she has operated for two years. Her new loan will enable her to stock up on vegetables. The profit from this business will allow her to buy vegetables for resale and various merchandise for her shop.

loans.use: to enable her to stock up on vegetables

loans.name: Cristilita

texts.en:
Cristilita is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Cristilita has a retail shop that sells candies, beverages & breads. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more candies, biscuits & beverages to sell.

Cristilita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy candies, biscuits & beverages

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en: Jesca is 25 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are attending school. She is a businesswoman. She sells shakes, sugar, beans, etc. She took loan through BRAC South Sudan to buy sugar and beans with the hopes of expanding her business. She wants to buy goats and chickens to develop her family income.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar and beans to sale.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn, 32, lives in the Philippines and is married with one child. She has a retail shop where she sells fish-like sardines and milkfish. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Carolyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future,Carolyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Damaris Del Rosario

texts.es:
Damaris del Rosario tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres e hija de 7 años en el Cantón Chillanes, Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVE DE ABRIL, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao.

Damaris se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio de prendas de vestir. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo.

Solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar su actividad comercial. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es tener una casa propia.

Le gusta jugar escuchar música y realizar labores domésticas.
texts.en:
Damaris del Rosario, 23, is single and lives with her parents and 7-year old daughter in the Chillanes canton, Bolivar province.

The Nueve de Abril V.R.C. (communal bank) is located in the  San José del Tambo parrish, in Chillanes canton where the members of this chapter work in agriculture, principally growing corn and cacao.

Damaris farms and also sells clothing.  She buys and sells her products in the San José del Tambo market.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise.  It will help her cover her expenses and improve her business.  She, as do the middlemen, faces challenges such as the drop in prices of the products that she sells.  Her dream is to have her own house.

She likes to listen to music and work in her home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a hardworking and self-motivated 27 year old business lady. She is married and blessed with a six-year-old child who is going to school. For the last 10 years, she has been selling auto spare parts so as to make a living. She makes an extra shillings by operating a mobile-phone money transfer business.

She wants in the next five years to be importing spare parts and selling locally. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy wipers, alternators, brake pads, and headlights. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she is now able to access finances to inject into her business.

loans.use: To buy wipers, alternators, brake pads, and headlights

loans.name: Natou

texts.fr: Madame  Natou  est une femme mariée de 50 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce depuis 30 ans. Elle s’adonne à la vente de vaisselle et de jus locaux.  C’est en aidant sa maman dans ses  activités de commerce qu’elle a eu la passion de cette activité. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mai 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 qui sera destiné a  l’achat de vaisselle et de jus locaux en vue de renforcer son stock de produits et répondre a la demande croissante de la clientèle en cette période de ramadan. Ce financement lui permettra de développer son activité et d’accroitre ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Ms. Natou is a 50-year-old married woman who lives in Senegal. She has been active in the commercial sector for 30 years. She devotes herself to selling plates, bowls, etc. and local juices. By helping her mom in this work, she gained a passion for it. 

Ms. Natou has been an associate of a branch of the micro-finance institution U-IMCEC since May 2011. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for buying kitchen ware and local juices with the aim of bolstering her stock of products and responding to the growing demands of her customers during this period of Ramadan. This financing will enable her to develop her business and to grow her profits.

loans.use: to buy kitchen ware and local juices

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has no children. 

Hussein has been an owner of a barber shop since 2005. He has more than 10 years experience and he has a deep understanding of local consumer and he has a good reputation and he is well known in his area. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.


He decided to apply for a $1500 loan to make digital ads and to buy a split air conditioner. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make digital ads and to buy a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business. Cyrus dreams of expanding his existing business to a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase rice, beans and sugar for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Yoeurn and his wife, Chanthy, have been married since 1995 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Three are in school and another one is still young. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Yoeurn and his wife are rice farmers. He also drives a motor taxi when he is not at the farm. He is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm. 

Photo: Yoeurn and his wife at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.name: Imara Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Imara SHG Group in Western Kenya! Alice is the facilitator of the Imara SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alice takes care of 10 children at home with her husband. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 23 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Alice will educate her children and ensure that her family can afford day-to-day necessities.

In 2012, the members of Imara SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture: Alice is pictured in the photograph with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Hadbaatar

texts.en: Hadbaatar is taking a loan to purchase some bricks and other insulation materials to make adjustments to his house.

loans.use: To purchase some bricks and other insulation materials to make adjustments to his house.

loans.name: Sau

texts.en:
Sau is 44 years old and is a married mother of two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her and her husband run a small food stall in front of the door of her house. They sell foods like pork soup and noodles to people in their local community. They have been in this business for 8 years. The income from their business covers their children's education fees and basic family expenses.

Sau is seeking a loan to purchase foodstuffs to increase the variety of foods that she sells from her stall and also to buy new furniture for her food stall. This will allow her to increase her monthly profit and improve her family's life.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs to increase the variety of food she sells and new furniture for her food stall

loans.name: Leni

texts.en:
Leni is married and has four children. She is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines.

She is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 25 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional pigs to raise.
 
Leni has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is 31 years old and single. 

She sells foodstuffs such as potatoes and peanuts in a store she has run for more than 8 years.  

The loan will be used to buy more potatoes to sell in her store. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more Irish potatoes, green bananas and other food stuffs .

loans.name: Sanu Maiya

texts.en:
Sanu Maiya is 50 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 20. In 1998, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Sanu Maiya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase their profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods

loans.name: Albeiro Antonio

texts.es: A sus 51 años, el señor Albeiro luego de quedarse sin empleo hace tres años, inicio a trabajar como reciclador en el municipio de el Carmen de Viboral localizado al oriente de Antioquia, desde entonces almacena en una bodega ubicada en la parte trasera de su casa los materiales que recoge y cada que tiene una cantidad bastante grande la vende a chatarrerías del Carmen de Viboral y Rionegro. Debido a un accidente que sufrió el señor Albeiro meses atrás se encuentra con poco capital de trabajo y aún sufre algunas molestias físicas, es por esto que tiene la esperanza de comprar material reciclado para recuperar un poco su negocio, el cual le brinda los ingresos mínimos para el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
At 51 years old, after being unemployed for three years, Albeiro began working as a recycler in the town of El Carmen de Viboral, located to the east of Antioquia.  He stores the materials that he collects in a small storage facility behind his house, and every time he has enough materials, he sells them to junkyards in El Carmen de Viboral and Rionegro.

Due to an accident that Albeiro suffered some months back, he finds himself with little working capital and still suffers from some physical problems.  As a result, he hopes to buy some recycled materials to allow his business to recover, which will provide the minimum income to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase material to recycle.

loans.name: John Patrick

texts.en: John Patrick is a 46-year-old married man living in a semi-permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. He practices agriculture, mainly growing bananas and coffee, which he started 20 years ago. His challenges are price fluctuations, inflation and the rampant banana bacterial wilt disease. His dream is educating his children, building a permanent home and hiring employees to help expand his business. John Patrick needs the loan to build a commercial house.

loans.use: to build a commercial house

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.en: Day by day increasing expenditures compelled Fazilat to initiate her own business selling animals. She is 44 years old, married woman doing business  with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 6 children. She is working very hard for providing her family with the basic necessities of life. She has requested a loan of 50000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his farming business

loans.name: Mammadova

texts.en: V. is a resident of Beylagan town. She has three children. Together with her husband she built a small shop in 2005 and started the business of selling products for daily use. When she started the business she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed three loans, in the amounts of $400 and $500. For these loans she bought inventories to be sold in the shop. Now she needs $500 to buy a new counter stand.

loans.use: To buy a new counter

loans.name: Lenkaran

texts.en: Lenkaran is an IDP from Fizuli district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. He is married and has two children. He started his business in 1998, and borrowed four Normicro loans from Baku branch  totaling $1900. He would like to borrow an addtional $900 for his butcher shop.

loans.use: To increase volume of the business

loans.name: Ntonifor  Micheal

texts.en:
N. Ntonifor was born in 1942, is married and is a father of three children. After spending almost all of his hard earned savings during the sickness and death of his two children, providing food and other basic needs for his family became a hard rock to crack. He therefore sought the help of GHAPE in 2004 and was trained in business management, marketing techniques, and credit discipline. Since then he successfully invested, managed and repaid loans amounting to $160. With these loans, he was able to buy food and pay school fees for his children.

Given a loan of $500, he plans to sell palm oil and firewood which is the main source of energy in his locality and to use the money raised to expand his business and provide for his family.

He plans to pay off the loan in 18 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase firewood, palm oil,

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh, 21-years old, is a daily worker in a bakery. She lives with her parents in Abbassieh in South Lebanon. They live in an economically vulnerable situation and Fatmeh's status as a daily worker offers her limited revenues.
She is requesting a loan of  $300 to repay debts that she and her family owe four different persons, including money owed for food and plumbing. Fatmeh prefers to come to Al Majmoua to resolve her credit issues, because she wants to preserve her family's pride. She does not want the people of her community to look at her parents as if they are asking for charity. Fatmeh is part of a group loan with other women from the same village. They named their group "Fatmeh" because she was the one who had the idea of contacting our Institution. A group is usually constituted of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rural areas. The group lending is based on incremental increase of loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages the collaboration approach in the borrowing community. It is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment of women.

loans.use: To repay personal and family debts

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta’s family has been engaged plantation work for some time now. As centre chief for Satapuala, a newly set-up centre, she hopes to utilise this money to help out with the family plantation. Funds from the sale of crops from the plantation will be used to repay the loan, and Elisapeta will continue to ensure that the family plantation is sustained. This is because the plantation is their major source of income, and she wants to ensure that she plays a role in the process of sustaining the family plantation.

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Vineta Fetuanai

texts.en: Vineta is a mother of 52 years of age with 9 children. Her husband also works on their plantation -- their only source of income. Through the years, they have worked hard cleaning and clearing the area and through her loans Vineta has been able to buy most of the equipment needed in her plantation. Vineta has taken 5 loans and through her loans she has managed to improve many things in her family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Ati

texts.en: Ati is 31 years old. Her husband, U., does not work anymore. She makes crispy chips, then sells them door-to-door around the villages. This earns $9 in income. She is asking for a loan of $125 to add to her business capital. As a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Titilope

texts.en: Titilope O. is 32 years old, married and has two kids, and hails from Igbolerin, Lagos State. She sells provisions and drinks and learned her trading skills for three years. She needs a loan of $450 to enable her buy more drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim N., 43, is the mother of three children and works as a farmer growing rice; she earns $3 a day. Her husband fishes for a living. After catching fish, he sells his catch in the market to earn approximately $5 a day of revenue.

One of her children works in a factory, the other two are students.

She will use this loan to purchase good rice seeds and fertilizers. She will use the remaining money to buy another plot of farmland to grow more rice.

loans.use: To purchase good rice seeds, fertilizers and a plot of farmland

loans.name: Shiek Ibrahim

texts.en: Mr. K. is 50 years old and married, with 10 children, 8 of whom are still in school. He owns a small grocery stall in the Makup Bana village of Makeni in Sierra Leone. With some business skills and the previous loans from SMT, Mr. K. was able to diversify his business. Now he would like to expand further and secure appropriate shelter for the business. A loan of approximately $700 US will help him meet this goal.

loans.use: To rent an appropriate location for a grocery store

loans.name: Aissatou Aymadi

texts.fr:
Aissatou Aymadi Baldé, age 48, is married and has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Coundara, inVélingara, for five years. She wants to bolster her catering business by buying rice, oil, meat, and other ingredients for her restaurant. Her income enables her to improve her family's living conditions and to help her parents in difficulty. Aissatou is applying for a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months. Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Aissatou Aymadi Baldé, 48 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara à Vélingara depuis 5 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de restauration en achetant du riz, de l’huile, de la viande et autres ingrédients pour son restaurant . Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. et d'aider ses parents en difficulté Aissatou sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy provisions for her restaurant

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi N., 40 years old, has joined TYM FUND (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) since 2006. She has 3 children who are still living with her. Two of them still go to school, and the oldest one helps Mrs. N. with her business. Mrs. N. is very diligent. Besides farming, she also enjoyes doing business. With her husband's encouragement, she took a loan from TYM Fund to invest in her variety store. Because of her good nature and her talent in selling, her store becomes very popular. Mrs. N.'s income has increased significantly. Now she wants to borrow 10 000 000 VND (625 USD) to invest in her store. Her average monthly income is 3 500 000 VND (218 USD)

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Tham gia Quỹ năm 2006, chị Trần Thị N. 40 tuổi có 3 người con hiện đang sống cùng chị, 2 con đang đi học, 1 con lớn chị đã trợ giúp chị trong công việc kinh doanh, là người phụ nữ hiền lành chịu thương chịu khó mặc dù làm nông nghiệp nhưng chị lại rất thích kinh doanh, được chồng động viên chị đã mạnh giạn vay vốn lớn để đầu tư vào cửa hàng tạp hóa tại gia đình, thật thà lại khéo nói nên chị đã thu hút được lương khách rất đông tại địa phương, từ lúc kinh tế gia đình khó khăn mạnh gian vay vốn làm kinh tế nay gia đình chị đã thuộc diện khá. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng tạp hóa. Thu nhập bình quân. 3.500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: variety store

loans.name: Ilhomiddin

texts.ru:
Ilhomiddin B. lives in the town Tursun-zoda. He is 44 years old, married, and has 4 children. He has a bachelor's degree. He is in the business of cattle breeding. He purchases calves for resale. He would like to obtain a credit so he could purchase a calf. After feeding it for a period of time, he sells it at a better price. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобоев Илхомджон житель города Турсун- заде. Возраст 44 года ,женат и имеет четверых детей.имеет высшее образование. В данный момент пенсионер. Занимается животноводством. Покупает молодых бычков для перепродажи. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить бычка. После откормки он продает их на базаре по более прибыльной цене. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Preab

texts.en:
Preab S., age 60, is a widow and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been earning a living as a wedding chef and is able to earn around $2 to support her family. She has seven children, four of whom are married and live away from home. Two others are employed doing different work.

To make more profit to support the family, Mrs. Preab S. would like to loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, an amount of $600 to purchase a motorbike for her son to operate a motor-taxi business.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort K. is married and has 3 children. She has never received schooling. Comfort sells food items like beans, peppers and other things at Duakor, which is a small town near Elmina. She also prepares gari, which is a product of cassava, for sale, and she has been doing this since 1998. Comfort uses her income to help in the payment of the children's school fees and other utility bills. Comfort will use the loan to purchase more food items for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to support with her children's schooling.

loans.use: to purchase more food items and cassava, the major ingredient for the preparation of Gari

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, D. 45 años, es viuda y madre D. 5 hijos, los mismos que son solteros y trabajan para apoyarla en lo posible.  Ella se dedica a la venta D. postres y bebidas heladas (cerveza, gaseosa, gelatinas, entre otras variedades) en su domicilio, venD. estos productos por las tardes, desD. hace 2 años, por las mañanas trabaja  como empleada domestica.  Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es conocer mucha  gente con quien comparte cocimientos D. negocio.  Lo difícil es no contar con un local apropiado para dar una mejor acogida y atención a sus clientes.  Se motiva trabajando para sus gastos diarios y para mantener activo su negocio.  El motivo D. su solicitud D. es mandar a construir una “ramada”, que es una estructura que tiene 4 maderas como columnas a los 4 extremos y un techo cuadrado D. ramas, en este espacio y bajo su sombra, ambientar adecuadamente para la venta D. sus bebidas, y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norma is 45 years old, she is a widow, and the mother of 5 children. Her children are all single and they work hard to support her as much as they can. She sells desserts and cold drinks (beer, soft drinks, gelatins, among other things) from her home. She sells her products in the evenings and she has been doing so for the past 2 yeasrs. In the mornings she provides home maintenance services in private homes. She loves her work because she gets to meet so many people and she likes to share business knowledge and practices. The hardest part about the job is trying to find a store to rent to proviD. her customers with better service. She is motivated to keep working to cover the daily expenses and to keep her business active. She requests a loan so that she can build a gazebo maD. from wood and palm tree branches as the roof covering. Under this shaded area she wants to model it appropriately so that she can sell her drinks from it and to proviD. her customers with better service.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To model an adequate space where she can sell her desserts and drinks.

loans.name: Soutoura (Confidentialité) Group

texts.fr:
Les sept (7) femmes du groupe Soutoura sont toutes mariées et ont en moyenne 34 ans et  04 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies à Sanoubougou I de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens d’amitié et de voisinage.  Leurs principales activités sont entre autres l’achat, la transformation des dechets des raffineries d’huile en savons,  et l’achat  vente des  pagnes wax (tissus très prisés en Afrique) ,d’arachide,  de mil et  de gomme.
Les savons traditionnels sont fabriqués à base des déchets d’huile de coton de potasses. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, ce groupe décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son 2ème prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe) et il s’est bien comporté dans les remboursements du prêt précédent.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, les membres du groupe comptent acheter, 2 bariques de dechet de cotons, 2 sacs de potasse, 22 pièces pagne wax, des habits pour d’enfants, 5 sacs de mil, 1 sac de sucre et 3 sacs de gomme henis. La ville de Bobo Dioulasso(du Burkina Faso), et les villes de Bamako et Sikasso sont leurs principales sources d’approvisionnement  de ce groupe de femmes.
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Sikasso, à domicile et de façon ambulante en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 40.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven women of the group Soutoura are all married and average 34 years of age and four children. They live in large extended traditional families in Sanoubougou I of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of friendship and community. Their principal work includes buying and transforming the waste oil from refineries into soaps, and it also includes buying and selling Wax pagnes (highly prized cloth in Africa), peanuts, millet, and gum. Traditional soaps are made with waste cotton oil and potash.

In order to satisfy a customer base that continues to grow, this group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which it is on its second solidarity loan (group loan). And the group performed well in repaying the preceding loan.

With this new loan, the members of the group intend to buy: 2 barrels of cotton waste, 2 sacks of potash, 22 lengths of Wax pagnes, clothing for children, 5 sacks of millet, 1 sack of sugar, and 3 sacks of 'henis' gum. The city of Bobo Dioulasso (of Burkina Faso) and the cities of Bamako et Sikasso are their principal sources of supplies. The merchandise is sold at the Sikasso marketplace, out of homes, and door-to-door at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed general of women.

With this loan, they each envision realizing an average profit of 40,000 francs CFA per month that will be use to cover the loan interest and to support their families.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different goods (waste cotton oil, Wax pagnes, peanuts, millet, sugar, children's clothing, and gum)

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a hair stylist who also sells hair extensions, hair cream and other products. She has been in this business for a long time, and now lives with her husband and four children in Igbelerin, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a LAPO client, and has applied for a new loan to buy more items such as hair extensions and hair cream to sell. She wishes to express her profound gratitude to Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more hair extensions, hair cream and other items to sell

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Agustina es socia del Banco Comunal “Dulce Amanecer” del distrito, provincia y departamento D. Puno. Tiene 61 años D. edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos. 
Con su primer préstamo D. S/. 300 compró lana para realizar sus tejidos y venderlos en su puesto D. artesanías. Nos cuenta que tiene un segundo puesto D. ventas el cual está alquilado y que recibe en pago mensual D. ese alquiler. Tiene casi 8 años trabajando con el banco comunal. 
Con este préstamo D. S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más lana e insumos para confeccionar artesanías y venderlas en su puesto. 
Agustina desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Agustina is a member of the 'Dulce Amanecer' Community Bank in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 61 years old, married and the mother of two children. With her first loan of S/. 300 she bought wool for her weavings, which she sells in her handicraft stall. She tells us that she has a second stall which she rents out for a monthly payment. She has worked with the community bank for almost 8 years. With this loan of S/. 3,000 to be repaid in 4 instalments she will buy more wool and craft supplies in order to make handicrafts and sell them in her stall. Agustina hopes to continue working in order to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool and craft supplies to make handicrafts

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda K. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2002. She is a reliable client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure and has continued working together with MicroInvest for a long time. She started her business practically from scratch but thanks to the previous loans she was able to open a specialized outlet selling women's and children's wear. She brings her assortment from Istaravshan and Uzbekistan twice per month. She has a good assortment and repeat customers.

Mavluda has 10 years experience in this business so she has the special skills and market knowledge necessary to do well in it. Mavluda is bringing up 2 children by herself; she is not married. Mavluda is asking KIVA to support her exisitng business with a business support loan of 3500 STJ for 6 months for importing seasonal wear. She thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all her supporters all the best.

loans.use: importing seasonal wear

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La señorita Elvira es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, centro poblado de 02 de mayo, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 24 años de edad, no tiene hijos y posee estudios de secundaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01 año, ella dedica su negocio a la venta de frutas y ropa (chompas, mandiles, blusas, etc.); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio (frutas). 

Con este préstamo de S/ 800.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales; con el préstamo podrá adquirir mercadería variada, de preferencia ropa (chompas según la época) y fruta (uvas, sandia, etc.), todo ello lo comercializará en las ferias locales de Ilave, su anhelo es tener también una tienda propia con mercadería surtida (ropa frutas, artefactos, etc.), con lo cual podría ayudar a su familia (a sus padres) y ayudarse asimismo en sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Elvira is a member of the Communal Bank "03 de Mayo," in the El Collao province of Puno. She is 24 years old, has no children, and has completed her secondary level education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos (a Kiva partner) for a year, and her business sells fruit and clothes (sweaters, aprons, blouses, etc.). Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian Soles, with which she purchased merchandise for her business (fruit).

With this loan of 800 Peruvian Soles, which she promises to pay back in 5 monthly installments, she will acquire a variety of merchandise, preferably clothing items (seasonal sweaters) and fruit (grapes, watermelon, etc.), all of which she will sell in the local fairs in Ilave. Her wish is to have her own store with stocked merchandise (clothes, fruits, artifacts, etc.), with which she can support her family (her parents) and help herself in her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as clothing and fruit

loans.name: Anitha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 37 year old Anitha S. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, between the ages of 5 and 9 years old. Anitha has been running a poultry business since 2002. Our client’s business is Poultry/kuku business. 
Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. 
She works at the business for 8 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by two employees. Anitha currently earns about 360USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy chicks and continue with poultry business. 
In the future, she plans to expand her poultry business. 
Anitha thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy chicks and continue with poultry business

loans.name: Ahrorchon

texts.ru: Ахрорчону 28 лет, женат, имеет 2 детей. Дети маленькие и поэтому жена сидит дома и смотрит за ними. Ахрорчон не имеет высшего образования, так как сразу после окончания средней общеобразовательной школы начал работать. Живет со своими родителями и на его долю выпадает часть семейных расходов. Сейчас очень нестабильные времена и приходится много работать, чтобы прокормить семью. Кроме этого по выходным дням занимается мелким предпринимательством – куплей продажей сухофруктов. Ахрорчон пришел в МикроИнвест и подал заявку на займ. Собирается расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Ahrorchon is 28 years old and is married with two children. His children are small and his wife is a stay-at-home mother. Ahrorchon has no higher education because he had to start working after high school. He lives with his parents and he needs to cover part of family's expenses. We are living through unstable times, and one needs to work hard in order to provide for one's family. In addition, Ahrorchon has a small business - he sells dried fruit. Ahrorchon is applying for a loan that would allow him to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Omosheke

texts.en: Omosheke is 50 years old and married with 4 children. She sells cooked foods, such as beans. She also sells bread to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies to cook and sell.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Tungalag B. lives with her husband and one of her two sons in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. One of Tungalag's sons is married and does construction work in South Korea. It is common in Mongolia to go to South Korea and work in the construction sector. This kind of work does not usually require any language or advanced skills and pays more than other alternatives in Mongolia. Tungalag has a small retail business selling women's and men's apparel. She travels to Ereen, a Chinese border town where many products are imported, to buy cheap high quality women's and men's clothing. She sells clothes at the stall that she rents in the Narantuul market, the largest open market in Ulaanbaatar. For the last three years, she has been running her business successfully. When she is away at Ereen, her husband sits at the stall to sell the clothes. In the future, she hopes to afford to purchase a microbus, which her husband can use to contribute to the family's income. She requests a loan to purchase more clothing from Ereen, China.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Alberta Teodora

texts.es:
Alberta es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Alberta es casada, tiene 50 años y 6 hijos, Alberta tiene un puesto en un centro comercial ubicado en una avenida céntrica en donde vende CDs y mochilas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hijo.
Alberta necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de CDs, mochilas.
Los sueños de Alberta son ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Alberta is a member of the Ollantay community bank. Alberta, 50, is married and has six children. Alberta has a stand in the commercial center, which is located on a central avenue, where she sells CDs and backpacks. She does this every day with her son’s help. Alberta needs a loan for 750 PEN to buy CDs and backpacks. Alberta’s dream is to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy CDs and backpacks

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en:
Elkhan B. is 37 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Elkhan has been a cattle breeder since 1999. He tells us that he comes from a farming family and that he does very well, financially, because he takes good care of his animals. At the same time, he works as a fireman. 
His wife is his biggest supporter. She helps him in anything she can and takes good care of him and the house. With this loan, he would like to expand his herd of cattle. This is fundamental as summer season is coming and wedding parties are starting, the demand for meat is very high. The loan will greatly improve Elkhan’s income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase three baby calves.

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
Sarita S. and her husband own a small plot of land that they use to grow maize and a variety of vegetables, including cauliflower, broccoli and carrots. They also raise animals, including one buffalo, one cow and several goats.

Sarita's husband  works with her on the farm. They have two sons, one who is in grade one at school and one who is a toddler.

Sarita is applying for a loan of Rs. 10, 000 to buy more animals and food for her animals. She hopes to be able to sell the milk produced by the animals and, if she buys young animals, she can sell them when they reach adulthood.

Usually this time of year, typically referred to as ‘monsoon season’ in Nepal, there is a lot of rain and it is the best time for planting and growing crops. Unfortunately there has been very little rain so far and people working in agriculture are becoming increasingly concerned.

Sarita hopes that with the help of a Kiva loan, she will have a bit more financial security and even if her crops do not grow as well as they do most years, she will have been able to invest in her livestock as an alternative.

loans.use: new animals and food to feed the animals

loans.name: Ngô Thị

texts.en:
V. Ngô Thị (1818081391) is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, V. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising water buffalo for sale. V. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, V. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. V. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. V. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. V. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebeca is 24 years old. She is married with two children. She owns and operates a grocery shop, where she sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc., to increase her inventory. 

She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for her children's education. She loves her work so much, making her an admired trader in her community. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is a 30 year married with four children aged between 1 month and 13 years. Two of her children go to school. She resides and owns a six roomed house where she is staying with five people.Cissy takes care of three additional family members aged 3,15,16 years  There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area.   She uses public transport to and from work and works in Kampala city where she sells new ladies clothes, and on average she sells to 15 customers a day.  Cissy sells to all categories of people and works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent and medication. She has been in this business for the one and half years  Besides  this clothing business she also owns a retail shop selling home product goods Cissy has been with MCDT for five years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to  buy more clothing a materials and merchandise for her retail shop. Cissy is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger ,and also owning  a permanent  business premise and home.
 

.

loans.use: To buy ladies  clothes

loans.name: Mele

texts.en:
Sophie Fotu is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Auala.  She is married and has eight grown children.  To make a living, Sophie owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables to sell.  Sophie has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately $78 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Sophie joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities.  Sophie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD.  That loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  Sophie is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used again to purchase manure.  This will be her second loan from SPBD.  Sophie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Confidence Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the group called “Confidence”. They are small-scale businesspeople in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 each for the very first time to enable them improve on the quality and sizes of their businesses. With a lot of goods in their stalls, they will be able to attract a lot of customers to their businesses, make more sales and increase their profit. Consequently, they will be able to better look after themselves and their children.

Marie F. (left) is the leader of this group. Marie was born in Magburaka town. She is age thirty-four and is a widow with three children – one in class VI, another in class V and the last in class II.

Marie sells shoes, cigarettes, milk, sardines, biscuits (cookies), mints, etc., and has been a businesswoman for over eight years now. With this loan, she will be able to expand her business, make more sales and better profit. In this way, she can better look after her children as a single parent.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 28 years of age and she is married to Melanio, who works as a tricycle driver in their village. Her family are happily living within the village of San Fabian Echague. The couple is blessed with three children. The eldest is Christian-9 years old who is elementary pupil; Melanie-8 years old, elementary pupil and the youngest is Melody-7 years old.
	Jenalyn's husband is a tricycle operator within their village. She would like to change those old sprockets of her tricycle to avoid any unnecessary things to happen during the daily routine of her husband. For this reason, she would like to request a loan to the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5,000. This could really helpful in their family needs most especially to her three children who are studying now.

loans.use: additional capital for the maintenance of motorcycle

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma R. is from the village of San Juan, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Gemma is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. 

Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to reinvest in her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: San Juan, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mery Giovana

texts.es: La Sra. Mery Giovanna, es hija de una antigua cliente la Sra Elsa , ella es casada y tiene 1 hija de 5 años y otro bebe por llegar, el esposo se dedica a la carpinteria, es empleado de una Empresa que fabrica muebles, ella invirtió su capital en  compra de un punto entel(llamadas) y venta de tarjetas de teléfono, al margen de ello se dedica a trabajo administrativo en una Empresa de limpieza a medio tiempo, es una pareja joven, quienes tienen buenas referencias por la zona.
texts.en:
Mery Giovanna is the daughter of Elsa, a long time client. She is married, has a five year old daughter, and has a baby on the way. Her husband, a carpenter, works for a business that makes furniture. She invested her money in an Entel (telephone company) shop and sells telephone calling cards. Besides this, she does administrative work part time for a cleaning business. They are a young couple with good references in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy telephone calling cards

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita A. is from the village of Mangidkid Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Carmelita is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a business buying and selling bananas in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Carmelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell for the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Carmelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Jee

texts.en: Jee M. is currently in the business of selling local alcohol in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase sugar and powdered milk to make tea for sale. Jee is 35 years old and is widowed. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To puchase sugar and powdered milk to make tea for sale

loans.name: Gracel

texts.en:
Gracel C. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 22 years old, married and has two infant-aged children.  To make a living, Gracel owns and runs a "sari-sari" general store.  She sells a lot of daily use products like shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her local community. Gracel has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gracel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell.  This loan will be her first loan from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 
--------------------------------
About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Suleyva

texts.es: La sra. Suleyva M. M. vende ropa usada ambulante en el municipio de san Rafael va a utilizar el financiamiento para comprar mas ropa variada y asi tener que ofrecerles a sus clientes, ella pasaba todo el dia haciendo los quehaceres de su casa porque la mama trabaja entonces pasaba aburrida y le dijo a la mama que le ayudara para poder ella tener su negocio y asi distraerse un poco vendiendo su mercadería, ella espera tener más ingreso ahora con este nuevo crédito por que así va a tener que ofrecerles a su clientela, Suleyva es casada no tiene hijo vive en la casa de su mama por que aun no han podido construir su casa, ya es el segundo crédito con nosotros y le han ayuda mucho.espera cada día trabajar más duro y que estos crédito le van a seguir ayudando para asi un dia cumplir sus sueños de poder tener su propia casa su esposo trabaja en la cementera como obrero
texts.en:
Senora Suleyva M. M. sells used clothing as a street vendor in the municipality of San Rafael. She will use this financing to buy additional pieces of clothing to offer to her clients. She used to spend all day doing the chores at her house because her mother works, then she got bored and her mother told her that she would help her to have her own business, so she could entertain herself selling her merchandise. With this new loan she hopes to have a greater income by offering a greater selection to her clientele. Suleyva is married without children. She lives in her mother's home because she has not yet been able to build her own house. This is the second loan through us, the loans are very helpful to her. Every day she hopes to work harder, and that these loans help her to get ahead so that one day she may fulfill her dream of having her own home. Her husband is a worker in the cement plant.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used clothing

loans.name: Rula

texts.en:
This is not the first loan that Rula has borrowed from FATEN. Our borrower is a housewife and the mother of 4 children. Her husband owns a shop in Beit Sahour, a small town in the Beth Lehem district, where he sells plastic items such as chairs, plates, cups, and small plastic cupboards. He also works in a small shop across from his own for a small salary.

The shop that Rula and her husband own, beside the salary he receives, comprise the family's entire income. Therefore, she applied for a loan to purchase more plastic items to sell in their small shop.

Rula says that she and her husband expect to improve their financial situation if the shop works as they are planning. This is not her first loan from FATEN and Rula is known for her commitment to repay on time.

In the picture, Rula is standing in her shop.

loans.use: To buy plastic items to sell

loans.name: Luzvisminda

texts.en:
Luzvisminda S. is from the village of Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 63 years old. Luzvisminda is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Luzvisminda operates a piggery. Luzvisminda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Luzvisminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzvisminda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional sacks of feed for her piggery. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Luzvisminda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy sacks of feed

loans.name: Martha Jacoba

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha Jacoba E. Martínez  vende piñatas por encargo y en su casa y vende repostería y bisutería ambulante y en las escuelas.

Ella Va a utilizar el crédito para comprar papel para hacer  piñatas, productos de repostería y comprar productos de bisutería.
Ella vive sola con su marido y el le ayuda a movilizarse en un triciclo que es donde caminan vendiendo para llevar el pan diario de la comida.

La Sra. Martha ha tenido 15 créditos con la Institución y todos los ha pagado muy bien en tiempo y forma y dice estar muy agradecida con CEPRODEL, por la confianza que le han otorgado y la ayuda que siempre ha tenido por parte de nosotros para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Martha Jacoba E. Martínez sells piñatas to order out of her home, and also sells pastries and costume jewelry as a street vendor and in schools. Martha is going to use this loan to purchase paper for making piñatas, products for making pastries, and products for making costume jewelry. She lives with her husband, who helps her to get around on a tricycle—that is how they go to sell her products so that they can support themselves. Martha has had 15 loans with Kiva partner CEPRODEL, and she has paid all of them properly and on time. She says that she is very grateful to CEPRODEL for giving her confidence and for the help that she and her husband have always received, which has allowed them to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling piñatas, pastries, and costume jewelry

loans.name: Vaomau

texts.en:
Vaomau L. is 25 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, selling ice-cakes (flavored ice in styrofoam cups).  Vaomau has 2 years of experience in this business.  Vaomau needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring).  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 180 talas or US $75 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Vaomau joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Vaomau's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring)

loans.name: 6 De Enero Group

texts.es:
El comite 6 DE ENERO se encuentra en pleno desarrollo  dentro del tercer ciclio, cada integrante se encuentra realizando una actvidad independiente ademas de las actividades en común que las mismas realizan como comite, y de esta manera trabajan en forma solidaria y se ayudan mutuamente.
Una de la integrantes es la Sra.Rucci R. con 38 años de edad , es  modista trabaja en la costura con una prima, esta por montar su propio taller de costura en su casa.
Desea incrementar sus ingresos, mediante la adquisición de telas de temporada otoño-invierno como para confección de camperas, blusas, pantalones, remeras mangas largas y todo tipo de abrigo que sea de buena calidad y facil comercialización. Además quiere adquirir más máquinas para el taller, así como todo tipo de accesorios que mejoren la calidad de sus productos.
Además, una vez el taller en su casa ya no tendría gastos de alquiler de local y viáticos.
El crédito solicitado fue para la compra de telas y accesorios para confeccion de ropas.
texts.en:
The 6 de Enero committee is a well-developed group, and in their third loan cycle. Each member is working independently besides the activities done together as a committee. In this way they work as a group and all help each other out. One of the members is Mrs. Rucci R., 38. She is a dressmaker and works in this field with her cousin. They are ready to open their own dressmaking shop in her house. She wishes to increase her earnings by buying fall-winter seasonal fabrics to make: jackets, blouses, pants, long-sleeved t-shirts, and all types of coats that are of good quality and easy to put together. They also want to add more sewing machines to the workshop, as well as different types of accessories to improve the quality of their products. And also once the workshop is in her house, she will have no more rent and traveling expenses. The loan that she is asking for is to buy fabric and accessories to make clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal fall/winter fabric to mkae jackets, blouses, pants

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto D., 58 years old, is a rice farmer. He started his business in 2002 and owns the 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm that he tills. He works so hard to be able to help his family.

Norberto joined CEVI’s micro-credit program in 2006. He would like to obtain a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). He will use the loan to buy additional farm supplies to increase his harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Saida Del Carmen

texts.es: Saida Del Carmen tiene 31años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que dio inicio pues no tenia los recursos suficientes para mantener a sus 2 hijos, es así que ella busca el medio de mejorar sus ingresos, pues necesitaba proporcionarles comida. Ella ha sido una mujer responsable y luchadora. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de ropa variada. Su deseo es tener su propia tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Saida Del Carmen is 31 years old. She sells general merchandise. She started over six years ago. She did not have sufficient resources to support her two children. That is why she looked for a way to improve her earnings. She needed to feed the children. She has been a responsible and tenacious woman. The loan is to buy a variety of clothing. Her wish is to have her own clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cristales Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Cristales” esta representado por la señora Marlene y conformado por 11 miembros 1 varón y 10 mujeres, todos son muy trabajadores y unidos y van cursando juntos ya un tercer ciclo demostrando puntualidad y honestidad en sus pagos. La señora Marlene se dedica a al venta D. pollo crudo en un frial instalado en sus domicilio, ella tiene mucha clientela que le demanda mas producto es por esta razón que requiere del préstamo para poder obtener mayor cantidad D. pollo para su venta; La señora Marlene es madre D. dos hijos, ella es casada y vive en su propia casa pero su domicilio es viejo y requiere D. muchos arreglos por lo que ella se encuentra en este momento ahorrando para poder refaccionar su domicilio. El resto D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, venta D. ropa, venta D. empanadas, otras venden comida, servicio D. rock-ola y la atención en pensiones D. comida. Los socios afirman que existe mucha competencia en el M. pero las socias cuentan con clientes que confían en sus productos y que demandan sus servicios. El crédito será destinado a la compra D. insumos, mercadería y la adquisición D. herramientas y materiales para agrandar sus negocios generando mejores ganancias para el mejoramiento D. la calidad D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Cristales” (Crystals) is represented by Sra. Marlene and consists of eleven members, one man and ten women. All of them are hardworking and close-knit. Together they are starting their third loan cycle and have demonstrated promptness and honesty with their payments.

Sra. Marlene sells raw chickens from a food store she operates out of her home. She has many customers who demand her product. For this reason, she needs a loan to obtain a large quantity of chickens to sell. Sra. Marlene is the mother of two children. She is married and lives in her own house, but her home is old and in need of many repairs. At the moment, she is saving money so that she can repair her home.

The other members sell cosmetics, clothing, turnovers, and other types of food. Others proviD. jukebox services and manage a boarding house. The members claim that much competition exists in the marketplace, but they have customers who rely on their products and demand their services. This loan will be used to buy supplies, merchandise, equipment, and materials to expand their businesses and generate more revenue so that they can improve the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens to sell

loans.name: 03.04.07 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Thanh Luong T. (15) is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Hoa-Thanh Hoa.  Thanh is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 07.Hoang Thanh-Hoang Hoa (03.04.07.Hoang Hoa).

Thanh is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, Thanh owns & operates a business a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling dried goods in the local community.  Thanh has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thanh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Luong T. Tuyen (25) is a 38-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

2.  N. T. Hoan (13) is a 45-year-old woman who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thanh Luong T. (15) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa- Thanh Hoa.  Thanh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 07.Hoang Thanh-Hoang Hoa (03.04.07.Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm sấy khô trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thanh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thanh kiếm được khoảng 4,500,000 VND.  Vào 2005, Thanh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thanh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Luong T. Tuyen (25) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. T. Hoan (13) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
