loans.use: To purchase speakers and other equipment

loans.name: Dorotea Del Carmen

texts.es: Dorotea del Carmen Gómez tiene 60 años. Su negocio es la venta de furtas y verduras, tiene 4 hijos pero actualmente solo vive con una hija de 22 anos. Hace más de 32 anos que se dedica a este negocio.es una mujer emprendedora que tomo ese negocio, como el medio para salir adelante siendo madre soltera de 4 niños. Ella necesita el financiamiento para poder comprar mercadería  porque todos los días tiene que levantarse muy temprano en busca de sus productos, lo que más le  gusta de trabajo es ofrecerles a sus clientes las frutas más frescas y obtener la satisfacción de sus clientes. El mayor sueño es poder terminar  de reparar su vivienda ya que será lo único que dejara a sus  hijos y nietos.
texts.en:
Dorotea del Carmen Gómez is 60. She sells fruits and vegetables. She has four children, but she currently only lives with her 22 year old daughter. She has been is this business for over 32 years. She is an enterprising woman, who took this business as a means for a single mother of four children to get ahead. She needs the loan to be able to buy merchandise. Every day she has to get up very early to search for her products. What she likes most about her work is offering her customers the freshest fruit and obtaining customer satisfaction. Her biggest dream is to be able to finish repairs on her house. It is the only thing she can leave her children and grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena A. sells palm oil, 'kenkey', and other foodstuffs at Bronyinima near Elmina. Philomena has no educational background. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a public servant.

Philomena has been selling palm oil, 'kenkey', foodstuffs and so on since 1998. She is responsible for the upkeep of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more of her foodstuffs to sell at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more of her  foodstuffs to sell at the market

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es: La señora Nimia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 54 años, 02 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella.Su fuerza  y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, se encuentra ubicada en un local muy bien acondicionado, en su misma casa, para atender a sus clientes.Las ganancias que genera ayuda al ingreso económico de su familia, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su puesto a comprar porque ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza.Con este préstamo de S/ 1,800.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Nimia, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y prepararse día a día a lo que la vida se le presenta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Nimia is a member of the Communal Bank “Nuestra Señora de la Paz” (Our Lady of Peace), which is located in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 54 years old, married, and has 2 children (1 is still a dependent). Her strength and desire for her children to succeed are what motivated her to start her own grocery store. She manages her business out of her home, which is well equipped for attending to her customers. The revenues generated from her business have enabled her to support her family. She has been gaining customers since she started her business and now she has a regular clientele who come to her store to shop because it has all the products a housewife would need. Nimia personally welcomes her customers with her charismatic personality.

With her loan of 1800 soles she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packaged noodles, milk, various brands of canned fish, crates of eggs, and personal hygiene products. This will help her continue providing good service to her customers.

Nimia has the strength to continue working and she prepares herself every day for what life presents. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping women like her and providing them with opportunities to develop in the communities where they operate.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to restock her store

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: A. Alice est née vers 1948 à Abomey. Alice est mère de quatre  enfants.  Alice vit à Fridjrossè  à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Alice survient à ses besoins.  C’est du charbon de bois que Alice vend chez elle à domicile. Alice achète ses produits auprès des camionneurs. Alice est une cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Alice a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu’elle n’en possède pour augmenter la quantité de son stock de charbon de bois. C’est la raison pour laquelle Alice demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Alice A. was born around 1948 in Abomey. Alice is the mother of four children. Alice lives in Fridjrossè in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Thanks to the income from her business, Alice is able to provide for herself. Alice sells charcoal at her house. Alice buys her products from haulers. Alice is a client of ALIDE (one of Kiva's field partners) who has always repaid her loans without incident. Alice needs greater financial means than what she possesses in order to increase her stock of charcoal. It is for this reason that Alice is seeking a loan to strengthen her working capital.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov P., 37, is married and lives with her husband and two of her children in Takeo Province. She and her husband sell palm sugar to earn a living and are able to make US $10 each day in profits. To earn more money, this couple is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase a stock of palm sugar.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of palm sugar.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria W. is from the village of  Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 46 years old and married, with 11 adult-aged children. To make a living, Maria owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, her main source of income comes from selling fruits like mangoes. Maria has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Maria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maria from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grocery items

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie B. is from the village of Tru-cut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Tessie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Tessie owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling bananas. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Tessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Tessie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa is a 39-year-old single mother of four children between the ages of 11 and 17. All her children go to school. She rents a one-room house where she lives with five people. Kasifa takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and gets three meals a day, but has no piped water. She incurs transportation costs to and from shopping in Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Kampala city.

Kasifa has a retail shop in Natete and sells all types of goods like salt, sugar, flour and soap. She pays rent of about $27 a month for her business premises and about $16 a month for her residence. She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of twenty customers a day and sells to all categories of people.

Her largest monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees for her children and monthly rent for her business and her residence. Her major business challenges are seasonality and the rainy season which hinders her customers from reaching her.

Kasifa has been in this business for four years and with MCDT for five years, now servicing her 10th loan and working with the same group mates. Kasifa joined MCDT because it was near her home and it was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise, like bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap. She wants to see her business grow bigger and would like to start selling on a wholesale basis only.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of salt, bags of sugar and boxes of soap

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly L. is from the village of Membuli, Salay, Misamis Oriental. Beverly is 29 years old and married with 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Beverly owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling bananas in her local community. Beverly has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Beverly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beverly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Beverly is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Beverly from HSPFI and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is fifty-two years old. She is widowed and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial community.

Abena works very hard to provide for her children. She is a baker, procuring bags of flour from nearby communities. She bakes bread and supplies to retailers in her community. She also deals in pastries.

Abena has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour in bulk

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.fr: Née en 1975, T. Marie Claire est mariée à YOVO G. Raoufou un cuisinier. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés, dont quatre sont à sa charge. La famille vit ensemble depuis trois ans à Djèrègbé Gbokpa, sur la route de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. N'ayant jamais fréquenté l'école, Marie Claire mène comme activité la vente de nourriture (riz, accompagné de poissons frits et de sauce) à l'école primaire publique d'Agonkanmè à Porto-Novo. Marie Claire s'approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. Marie Claire mène cette activité depuis 5 ans, mais n'a encore jamais bénéficié d'un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de ses élèves, Marie Claire ambitionne agrandir son activité et mieux satisfaire ses clients. C'est la raison pour laquelle Marie Claire sollicite un premier prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1975, Marie Claire T. is married to G. Raoufou YOVO, a cook. The couple have six children, all educated, of which four are under her care. The whole family has been living for the past three years in Djèrègbé Gbokpa, on the road to Porto-Novo, administrative capital of Benin. The couple share household expenses. As she never attended school, Marie Claire’s activity is selling food (rice, accompanied by fried fish and sauce) at the public primary school of Agonkanmé in Porto-Novo. Marie Claire has been doing this for five years, but has never requested a loan from ALIDé before. Facing an escalating demand from the pupils, Marie Claire wishes to expand her activity and improve the satisfaction of her customers. For this reason she is requesting a first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sauce condiments (tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Brigid

texts.en: Brigid K. K. is 48 years old and married with two children, 27 and 30 years old. His business is located at Makongeni, a busy market in Thika, the region in Kenya known for pineapple production. He has been selling watermelon for the last two years to the local people. He says that this business is profitable and his major challenge is an unsteady supply. However, he works very hard to keep his business going well. He is using his loan of KES 50,000 to buy more watermelon to expand his business. He hopes to have many business outlets and supply his cereals to different parts of the country in future. He is very innovative and wants to be a market leader in this business.

loans.use: to buy watermelon

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Mr. Phorn P., 38, is a hardworking man who resides in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Phorn P. was married many years ago and has three kids who attend school and depend on his income. To earn a daily income, Phorn P. always leaves home to go to rural areas where he buys oxen at reasonable prices from farmers so that he can fatten them for a while and then resell them. He is able to earn around $5 each day to manage his family’s daily requirements. He has a life partner in his wife, who sells a few vegetables in the market. Phorn P. desires to improve his business and is requesting a loan of $500 from Kiva’s field partner, HKL. He will buy more animals to sell for extra income.

loans.use: To buy more animals.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Julia M. se dedica a la venta de frutas en el mercado Mayoreo donde a diario vende las frutas como mandarinas, naranjas, limones y otros.

Ella está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de las frutas para llenar sus canastos y así ofrecer dichos perecederos a los clientes que a diario le visitan y así lograr su satisfacción. Espera que el crédito le será otorgado satisfactoriamente por la institución.
texts.en:
Ana sells fruit, such as mandarin oranges, oranges, limes, etc at the Mayoreo market daily. She is asking for this loan in order to buy fruit to fill her baskets and be able to offer perishables to satisfy her customers who visit her daily. She hopes that the institution will be able to grant this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit for resale

loans.name: Alexander Rojas Molina

texts.es:
Alexander R. M. es  un señor  de 33 años de edad quien vive con su madre  en una pequeña comunidad llamada La Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.

Don Alexander se dedica a la agricultura, en estos momentos el se dedica a la siembra de yuca, un tubérculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Costa Rica como en otros países.

Actualmente Don Alexander está solicitando un préstamo de ¢400000 (cuatrocientos mil colones), para ampliar su siembra y así ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del ñame. 
Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha, con un producto de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto. Con esto desea iniciar un proyecto exitoso que le permita ayudar a su madre la cual depende solo de el y se encuentra muy enferma. 


El es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Alexander R. M. is a 33 year old gentleman who lives with his mother in the small community of La Trinchera de Pital in Alajuela Province. The main activities of the region are livestock production and agriculture, with an emphasis on the cultivation of pineapples that are sold primarily to international markets. For this reason, community development has increased in recent years and has generated more demand for goods and services by providing more job opportunities.

Don Alexander is a farmer. At the moment he is devoted to growing cassava, a tuber that has a pleasant flavor and is rich in nutrients. Agro-industrial processing of this crop has increased because demand is great in Costa Rica and in other countries.

Don Alexander is currently requesting a loan of 400,000 CRC to increase his harvest. This will help with preparing the land for planting by purchasing seeds, fertilizers, composts, and other supplies that are necessary to ensure an optimum output. With this investment, he hopes for a good harvest that produces a product with the appropriate features that will command a higher sales price. The start of a successful project will allow him to help his mother because she is solely dependent on him and very ill.

Don Alexander is a member of the Communal Enterprise of the Successful Women of La Trinchera de Pital, one of 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he hopes to continue growing personally and financially. He also actively participates in his local credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of his farmland for growing cassava

loans.name: La Florida Group

texts.es: El grupo “La Florida” esta representado por la señora Luisa y conformado por 11miuembros, D. las cuales 7 son mujeres y 4 son varones,  este grupo se caracteriza ya que ser gente muy trabajadora y dinámica, todos se conocen entre si gracias a que la mayoría resiD. ene la misma zona. La señora Maria Luisa tiene un hijo y actualmente es propietaria D. su propia vivienda ella tiene su concubino con el que vive ya 2 años, ella se dedica a la venta D. golosinas en la puerta D. un colegio y desea poder ampliar su negocio y poder tener un kiosco en la cual pueda vender comida a demás D. golosinas para poder generar un mayor ingreso para poder darle una mejor calidad D. vida a su hijo y poder formar una familia con su compañero. El resto del grupo tiene diferentes actividades ya que la mayoría venden golosinas y emparedados en las puertas D. los colegios y otros son porteros D. los colegios donD. viven junto a sus familias, otros se dedican a la albañilea, zapatería, y como empleadas domesticas y el servicio D. lavado D. ropa a domicilio. La competencia en los negocios es bastante amplia pero ellos siguen adelante ya que cuentan con bastante experiencia en sus negocios. El crédito actual es para capital D. operaciones, las cuales las socias invierten en compra D. mercadería o herramientas para sus trabajos. El banco tiene bastante experiencia ya que se encuentran cumpliendo un ciclo mas dentro D. la institución siempre demostrando unidad, honestidad y ganas D. trabajar para sacar adelante a sus familias dándoles una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The group "La Florida" is represented by Luisa and is comprised of 11 members, including 7 women and 4 men. This group is characterized as having very dynamic and hardworking people. They all know each other since they live in the same neighborhood. Maria Luisa has a son and now owns her own home. She has a partner who she has lived with for 2 years. She sells snacks at the entrance gate of a school, and she wants to be able to expand her business. She wants to have a kiosk where she can sell food in addition to snacks in order to generate a better income so that she can proviD. a better quality of life for her son and can form a family with her partner. The rest of the group has a variety of activities: the majority sell snacks and sandwiches at the gates of schools, others are caretakers of the schools where they live with their families, others are bricklayers, shoemakers and domestic employees, and others proviD. laundry services from their home. The competition in these businesses is strong, but they continue to forge ahead, since they all have quite a bit of experience in their businesses. This loan will be used for working capital; it will be invested in the purchase of merchandise and tools for their work. This communal bank has experience, as they are carrying out another loan cycle with the institution, always demonstrating unity, honesty and the desire to work hard to get ahead and proviD. their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy merchandise and tools

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia P. is a devoted mother to her two children. She lives in the beautiful province of Binangonan, Rizal with her family. She owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) store in their village. Despite many challenges in their life, they never gave up fighting against poverty.

She plans to utilize this loan of Php 19,000 to expand and support the maintenance of her general store,  the primary source of daily income. This loan will be used for additional capital to buy groceries for her general store.

During her 2 years at ASHI, she has shown very good performance as a member, and she is trusted by ASHI for her solid record. Aside from maintaining an excellent performance in her credit rating (basis of loans) in ASHI, Letecia has also cared for the needs of her family at home.

This loan will enable her to finally reach her dreams in life: to have a growing business,a  good life, and a happy family as well. 

Letecia believes that her business will help her family to rise up and fight against poverty, as well as provide for the needs of her family. She is very grateful to ASHI and KIVA for the continuous love and support of her dreams.

loans.use: To buy groceries of her store.

loans.name: Chok

texts.en: Chok L., 52, is married and resides with her husband and eight children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat temples. She stays at home to raise piglets while her husband is a skillful fisherman, earning an income of US $5 per day to help cover the family expenses.  L. is requesting a loan of US $1000 to buy a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa P. es socia del bankito Santa Ana, vive en la parroquia que lleva el mismo nombre, esta parroquia se caracteriza por su gente ya que se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, y muchos de su habitantes sale a la ciudad para realizar varias actividades, su iglesia es el principal centro turístico de la parroquia.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica a lo quehaceres de su hogar y también a la cría de chanchos, pollos, vacas vendiendo su leche y también lo utiliza para su consumo.

Doña Rosa tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esa unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos que se encuentran de 17, 15, 11 y 6 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio, su segundo hijo no le gusta el estudio y trabaja en la construcción, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad, nos comenta que era socia hace tiempo en el banco comunal y se alejo por cuestiones ajenas a su voluntad pero ahora de nuevo regresa, con su crédito lo va  a invertir para la compra de chanchos y así mantener su negocio, su meta es de llegar a criar mas ganado.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa P. is a member of the Santa Ana bank. She lives in the parish which bears the same name. The community is known for its farmers who work in both agriculture and cattle-raising. Many of the local people work in the city too; its church is the parish’s main tourist attraction. As well as her household chores, Rosa also raises pigs, chickens, and cows. She first sells the milk from the cows, and then eats the meat. Rosa is 37 years old, married, and has four children aged 17, 15, 11, and 6. Her oldest son is a high school student, her second son doesn’t like studying and works in construction. The youngest two attend the local school. Rosa notes that she was a member of the community bank a number of years ago, then withdraw for reasons beyond her control, but is now back again. She is going to use her loan to buy pigs and keep up her business. Her goal is increase the amount of livestock she raises.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Maria Annie

texts.en:
Maria Annie M. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 34 years old. Maria Annie is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Annie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maria Annie has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maria Annie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Annie is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Maria Annie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Lang Huot Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has fifteen people who live in Sdau Kanleng village, located in Kandal province. Mrs. Lang H. is 30 years old and was selected as the village bank president. Each of the group members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Lang H. owns a general store at her home where she can earn some money to support her famiL. along with her husband, Mr. Chhit Khley, who is a fisherman. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it.  To improve her business, Mrs. Lang H. is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell. She is a mother of four children; three of whom are attending the local public school, while the other is too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resale

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana Y. is a widow taking care of seven dependants. Nana smokes fish to sell in Elmina. She has been in this business for 30 years. She has not received any formal education. She is able to manage her home with the income she makes from her sales. Nana will use this loan to purchase more fish to smoke for sale. She plans to reinvest her new profits in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban vive en la casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de el alto zona villa yunguyo de la ciudad de El Alto. El trabaja en el sindicato de transporte como chofer asalariado y esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El no tiene hijos, su familia esta compuesta por su mamá y Esteban. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de material de construcción como cemento, estuco y ladrillo. Esto le servirá para refaccionar su cocina.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Esteban lives with his parents and their home is located in the city of El Atlo, in the Villa Yunguyo district. He works for the department of transport as a driver. This is his primary source of income. He does not have any children. His family is his Mom. This loan will be destined to purchase construction material, such as: cement, stucco, and bricks. He will be able to remodel his kitchen with these materials. This is his first loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner).

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials to remodel a kitchen.

loans.name: Denis Julian

texts.es: Denis Julián, tiene 44 años de edad, el se dedica a brindar el servicio de joyería, pues siempre está pensando como un padre responsable y hacer ce cargo de sus hijos y esposa, cuando el inicio era un aprendiz ahora con el paso del tiempo fue que logro tener su propio establecimiento y ofertar la variedad de productos que sabe realizar. Este no es el primer crédito que tiene con Fundación pues ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable con su cuotas. Este financiamiento es para la compra de oro, plata y otras herramientas que son necesarias en su negocio.
texts.en:
Denis Julián is 44 years old. He services jewelry for a living. He is always thinking like a responsible father and takes care of his wife and children. He started as an apprentice and now, after some time, he has established his own business. He offers a variety of products that he knows how to service. This is not his first loan with Fundación. He has shown that he is very responsible with his payments. With this loan he will buy gold, silver and tools that he needs for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gold, silver and tools for his business

loans.name: Uulkan

texts.en: Uulkan T. is a resident of Balykchi, a nice city in the Isykul region. Uulkan is 50 and married. She has raised two sons and two daughters. The first daughter is married and lives separately with her family, and the second works as a bookkeeper. The first son works in a computer store, and the second son is a student. Uulkan works as a dentist and her husband makes money by transporting coal. Six years ago, with an initial investment of 20,000 soms, Uulkan purchased equipment and began to provide dental services. In this way, she earns 25,000 soms per month. She applied for this loan because her husband needs money to purchase coal in order to resell it at a higher price in winter. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase coal

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda  D. C. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Bagacay, Sibonga, Cebu. She earns her living through her sari-sari (general) store  business.  Her husband Lito D. C., who is 33 years old, works as a conductor for the bus company to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 3 and 10 years old. Three of the children currently go to school. 

Brenda  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Brenda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save for the future and for her children's education. Brenda D. C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Donmurod

texts.ru: Шерматов Донмурод проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 73 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Образование высшее, инженер. По профессии проработал 9 лет. Сейчас он предоставляет услугу, такси. Занимается перевозкой людей. В этой области более 5 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения шин. Клиент готовит свою машину на зиму.
texts.en: Donmurod S. lives in the J. Rumy district.  He is 73 years old, married and has 5 children.  He has a higher education, as an engineer.  He worked in his field for 9 years.  Currently, Donmurod provides taxi service.  He is involved in passenger transportation.  He has been in this business for over 5 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of tires.  Client is preparing his car for the winter.

loans.use: Purchase of tires

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 57-year-old married man and the father of four children. He has more than 43 years of experience running a small car repair shop in his town. He is the main income provider for his family to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. With his loan requested of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will increase the capital of his business and purchase new tools.  In the future, he is looking to diversify his business and open a new shop where he can buy and sell car spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase new tools

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es: Eulalia, de 32 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Félix de 38 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los verdes campos del poblado de Santa Rosa, ubicado en la selva Ayacuchana, han sido en la vida de Eulalia un lugar muy agradable para trabajar, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio, sembrando cacao, café y hoja de coca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que su arduo trabajo tuvo sus frutos, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, que es el lugar donde los vende. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Dentro su banco comunal siempre esta al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas, con lo cual desea asegurar sus futuras cosechas.
texts.en:
Eulalia is 32 years old and is a very happy and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her 38-year-old husband, Félix, and her four children who are the reason for all of her efforts.

The green countryside of the village of Santa Rosa, located in the jungle of Ayacucho, has been a nice place to work for Eulalia. Her parents taught her this trade since she was very young and now she has her own lands where she works with sacrifice and a lot of care planting cacao, coffee and coca leaves. What she likes most about her work is harvesting her crops because she feels as though her hard work has paid off. She has been in this business for 12 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her crops to the city of San Francisco (located in the department of Ayacucho) where she sells them. Over time, she hopes to gather enough money to buy new lands.

This is Eulalia’s second loan with MFP and she knows that she is responsible for making her loan payments on time and she is prepared to do so. Within her communal bank, she is always aware of the agreements that they make. With the 2,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) requested, she will purchase seeds to ensure her future harvests.

loans.use: To buy cacao and coffee seeds.

loans.name: Sinthia Paola

texts.es:
Sinthia tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. El negocio ya cuenta con una antigüedad de un año y gracias a el puede solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres a sostener la economía de su familia. Su clientela se encuentra fidelizada debido a que siempre les ofrece productos de buena calidad y un trato amable.

Sinthia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda aumentar su nivel de ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. 

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que siempre vela por el bienestar de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para ayudarlos a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sinthia is 22 years old, is single, and lives with her parents in the Olmos district, an agricultural area in the Lambayeque province located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells staple items and groceries in a store located in her house.  The business is already a year old, and thanks to it she can pay for her personal expenses and help her parents with the family finances.  Her customers are loyal because she always offers them quality products and friendly service.

Sinthia wants to expand her business by purchasing more products so she can increase her sales and earn more.  To achieve her goal she decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles.

She is a very hardworking woman and is always looking out for the well-being of her family.  Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman in order to help her family move forward.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to expand her grocery store

loans.name: Adalicia

texts.es: Adalicia  para final de año va a necesitar su segundo credikiva, pues quiere comprar telas y materias primas e insumos de confección  porque va a fabricar uniformes  de colegio. Con sus créditos su negocio ha cambiado, lo ha capitalizado logrando hacer mejoramiento de viviendas como su enchape en baldosas de cerámica y el cielo raso en la terraza que no tenia. Continúa con el sueño de tener un gran almacén y por eso se esfuerza para que cada día su desempeño en el trabajo se vea  reflejado  en bienestar. Hoy preparada para recibir su segundo credikiva   planea con él una   utilidad de 50%,  que proyecta ser una inversión exitosa, porque tiene ya encargados los uniformes del colegio. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Adalicia puede ingresar al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/179922
texts.en: Adalicia will need her second Kiva loan at the end of this year because she would like to buy fabric, materials and dressmaking supplies so that she can make school uniforms.  The loans she has had have changed her business.  She has capitalized on her loans, managing to improve her home with ceramic tiling and adding a ceiling to her terrace which she didn't have before.  She continues with her dream of having a large store and she works hard so that her daily commitment to her work is reflected in her well-being.  She is now ready to receive her second Kiva loan.  She plans to use it to make a profit of 50% which she believes will be a successful investment because she already has orders for the school uniforms.  If you would like to know Adalicia's story, you can follow this link: http://kiva.org/lend/179922

loans.use: To buy fabric, materials and dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo 41 de edad, casado con la señora Isidora de 40 años, tienen 2 hijos, uno de 16 años y otro de 8 años ambos son  estudiantes.
 El señor R. es herrero de profesión que aprendió de su padre, cuenta con taller propio en su casa, ahí realiza todo tipo de trabajo sobre hierro, como verjas, portones, sillas, rejas, tinglados y otros. Su cónyuge se encarga del cuidado de los hijos. 
 Recurrió a Fundación Paraguaya para ayuda crediticia, y gracias a su esfuerzo está logrando todos sus sueños el de poder brindar todas las comodidades a su familia y acceso a la educación. 
     En la ocasión solicita dicha ayuda para la compra de hierros en  cantidad ya que tiene pedidos de 80 sillas para un restaurant.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 41 years old and is married to Isidora, age 40. They have two children who are 16 and 8 years old. Both children are in school. Mr. R. is a blacksmith and learned this trade from his father. He has his own workshop in his house where he works on a wide variety of iron metalworking projects, such as railings, gates, chairs, grilles, and sheds, among other things. His spouse takes care of their children.

He has turned to Fundación Paraguaya for financial assistance. Thanks to them, he is able to realize all his dreams, including his dream of providing his family with a comfortable life and access to education.

He has requested the above-mentioned loan in order to purchase a large quantity of iron as he already has a request from a restaurant for eighty chairs.

loans.use: Purchase of a large quantity of iron

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANDENES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yessica; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como docente del nivel secundario en una ONG, la socia quiere seguir estudiando para enseñar a los niños, la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yessica is a member of the "LOS ANDENES" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Yessica is 34 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her work as a high school teacher for an NGO.  She would like to continue studying so that she can teach her children.  She would also like to own a grocery store.

Yessica is requesting this loan for personal use.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: For personal use

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Inicio con fondos propios a pesar que no tenía mucho capital para aumentar su inventario pero con el paso del tiempo es que ha podido sacar adelante su medio de vida. Hace más de 15 años que tiene este medio de vida, por lo que ha sido importante para mantener 2 hijos a su cargo. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de ropa, calzado, cosméticos, sabanas y toallas. Sueña con aumentar su negocio y mejorar cada día más el servicio de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Elena sells general merchandise.  She began by investing her own money, even though she didn't have much to start with, but over time she's managed to increase her inventory and improve her livelihood.  She's been doing this for more than 15 years, and it's been important in her support of her two children.

She will use the money from this loan to invest in clothing, shoes, cosmetics, sheets, and towels.  She hopes to be able to grow her business and improve her customer service daily.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Percilinda

texts.en:
Percilinda A. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Lagtang, Talisay, Cebu. Her husband, Melquisedech, who is 50 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are between 16 and 27 years old. 

Percilinda earns her living by operating two business ventures: accessories making and ready- to-wear clothes. 

Percilinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Percilinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000, with which she intends to buy materials for accessories making so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. 

Percilinda A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.	

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase materials for accessories making

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa F. M. tienen la edad de 56 años, no estudio y esta casa con el señor ......... con el cual tuvo seis hijos los cuales ya estan casados, actualmente vie soo con su esposo en la comunidad de  Mata Naranjo a treinta y cinco minutos del municipio de Tierra Blanca en el estado de Veracruz.

Doña Tere(como la llaman en su comuidad) nos platica que hace un poco mas de diez años tubo la inquietud de trabajar para ayudar un poco a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, asi que con la ayuda de su esposo compraron un molino de maiz con el cual inicio a trabajar moliendole su nistamal(maiz) a las señoras de su comunidad, ella se leventa todos los dias a las cinco de la mañana para iniciar a moler, su molino lo tiene en su casa que se encuentra a la orilla de la carretera la granja- temazcal, tiempo despues inicio a vender tarjetas telefonicas y recargas electronicas para celulares, actualmente atiende ambos negocios pero sin descuidar su hogar.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de algunas piezas para su molino, tarjetas y recargas electronicas para su posterior venta. 

Doña Tere espera en un futuro con sus ganancias poder comprar un molino nuevo un poco mas grande para seguir trabajando.

Ella se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion por este credito que le dara la oportunidad de seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en: Ms. Teresa F. M. is 56 years old. She did not attend school and she is married to a gentleman with whom she has six children, all of whom are married. Now she lives just with her husband, in the community of Mata Naranjo, 35 minutes from the municipality of Tierra Blanca in Veracruz state. Ms. Tere (as she is called in her community) tells Fundación Realidad A.C. that a little over ten years ago, she felt the urge to start working to help her husband a little with their household expenses. So, with the help of her husband, she bought a corn mill that she used to start grinding nistamal (corn) for the women in her community. She gets up at five every morning to start grinding. She has her mill in her house, which is located on the edge of the La Granja-Temazcal highway. Some time later, she also started selling calling cards and electronic credits for cell phones. Now she tends to both businesses, but still does not neglect her housework. She needs this loan to purchase some parts for her mill, as well as calling cards and cell phone credits to resell. Ms. Tere hopes that in the future she will be able to use her earnings to buy a new mill a bit larger than her current one, so that she can keep working. She is very grateful to the organization for his loan, which will give her the opportunity to continue investing in her business.

loans.use: to purchase some parts for her mill, as well as calling cards and cell phone credits to resell

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es:
Maria de 42 años, tiene una tienda en su casa, es una mujer trabajadora que hace muchos años pudo tener su negocio. 
Comenzó con la tienda para poder mantener a su familia y ayudar a su esposo que es albañil, vendiendo en una carretilla recorriendo Duran completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña tienda en su casa. Vende caramelos, cachitos, etc. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días.  

Para poder seguir con su negocio quiere comprar arroz, azucar, lacteos, en el futuro quiere tener dinero para una tienda para su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and runs a store out of her home.  She is a hard worker who has had her business for many years.

Originally, she set up the store to support her family and help her husband who is a bricklayer.  She began selling out of a cart throughout the streets in Duran and once she had enough money saved she established the store in her home.  She sells sweets, snacks, etc.  

She works from 7:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. every day.  In order to continue in her business she needs to buy rice, sugar and dairy products.  One of her goals for the future is to make enough money to set up a store for her son.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and dairy products

loans.name: Hilda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Hilda D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en Puerto el Triunfo departamento D. Usulután, ella vive con sus dos hijos D. 15 y 11 años D. edad, este negocio lo tiene hace 8 años, lo atienD. todos los días y sus hijos le ayudan en el servicio a los clientes.
Ella actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería y mariscos, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar su inventario en la tienda y ofrecer a los clientes mayor producto, teniendo también oportunidad D. vender más.
Para ella su objetivo es mejorar cada día la condición económica D. su familia y sacar a sus adelante con los estudios.
texts.en:
Hilda, 34, lives in Puerto Triunfo, Usulután Department with her two children who are 15 and 11 years of age.  She’s had the business for 8 years and is open every day; her children help her take care of customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise and seafood.  This purchase will help her improve her inventory in the store and offer customers more products leading to more sales.

Her objective is to improve her family’s economic situation every day and to have her children finish their education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and seafood

loans.name: Aldama Group

texts.es: Este grupos solidario se llama Aldama se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Jantetelco, en el estado de Morelos, México, está conformado por 5 mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas ellas son la señora Maricela va a comprar con su crédito blusas, pantalones, camisas etc. Para su venta, las señoras Ana María, Irma y Francisca van a comprar productos de belleza por catalogo para vender, la señora Lucia va a comprar tortillas, chicharrones, cueritos, queso, crema y verduras para la elaboración de la comida para vender sus antojitos, La señora Lucia es integrante del grupo, ella tiene 46 años de edad, estudio la primaria hasta el 6º. Año  y la secundaria la estudio en el INEA obteniendo su certificado, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo que trabaja en el campo tienen 2 hijos Miguel Ángel tiene 22 años de edad y trabaja, Ana Miriam tiene 16 años de edad está estudiando Bachilleres, la señora lucia tiene su negocio de venta de comida, ella solicito su crédito para comprar carnes, tortilla, teleras, chicharrones, cueritos, queso, crema y verduras para elaborar la comida y preparar los antojitos, su negocio esta frente al Balnearia Acuario en Jantetelco en su casa, ella ofrece a sus clientes tortas, chicharrones preparados, tostadas, dobladas, dulces, coctel de frutas. La señora Lucia inicio su negocio hace 20 años con un préstamo que le proporcionaron y lo invirtió en mercancía, ella aprendió de su mama vendía comida y le ayudaba a su mama a preparar los alimentos de ahí aprendió, su negocio es importante porque de ahí saca para pagar el préstamo, para comer y para su hija para lo que necesite en la escuela, ella está orgullosa de su negocio porque le gusta preparar los alimentos que su mama le enseño y cuando hay buenas ventas, las ganancias la va ahorrando en banco azteca para algún imprevisto o alguna enfermedad, ella está planeando comprar dulces para que su negocio crezca y lo piensa lograr con el préstamo que le van a dar, sus planes y esperanzas son salir adelante trabajando, que su hija siga estudiando. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por apoyarnos con el préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio, pagando bien para que nos presten otro, les agradecemos de antemano su ayuda. Jantetelco es un pueblo bonito donde elaboran el dulce cristalizado como es el jamoncillo, camote, chilacayote, camote, higo, biznaga, también siembran el camote, maíz, frijol, sorgo, pepino y jitomate de vivero.
texts.en: This group is called Aldama and is located in the community of Jantetelco, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. It has 5 women members who are neighbours and know each other. Maricela is going to buy blouses, trousers, shirts etc. with her loan. For their business, Ana María, Irma and Francisca are going to buy catalogue beauty products to sell, and Lucía will buy tortillas, chicharrones (pork scratchings), cueritos (marinated pork rind), cheese, cream and vegetables for preparing food and selling snacks. Lucía is a member of the group and is 46 years old. She attended primary school until the 6th year and achieved her secondary education certificate in the INEA. She lives with her common law husband who works in the fields, and they have 2 children: Miguel Ángel is 22 years old and works, while Ana Miriam is 16 years old and is studying for her Bachilleres (high school qualification). Lucía runs a food business, and requested her loan in order to buy meat, tortillas, teleras (crusty bread rolls), pork scratchings, marinated pork skins, cheese, cream and vegetables with which to prepare snacks. Her business is opposite the 'Acuario' spa in Jantetelco and from her home she offers her customers tortas (crusty sandwich rolls), prepared pork scratchings, tostadas (topped crispy tortillas), dobladas (folded and stuffed tortillas), sweets and fruit cocktail. LucÍa started her business 20 years ago with a loan provided to her, which she invested in stock. She learnt from her mother who used to sell food, and she used to help her prepare it. Her business is important because it allows her to pay the loan back, eat and provide what her daughter needs for school. She is proud of her business and enjoys preparing the food her mother taught her. When her sales are up, she saves the profits in Banco Azteca for emergencies or illness. She is planning to buy sweets to expand her business and she is hoping to do so with this loan. Her plans and hopes are to move forward through her work, and that her daughter continues studying. Group members would like to give Kiva and the Fundación Realidad the following message: "thank you for supporting us with this loan to invest in our business. We will pay it back so that we can receive another, and we thank you in advance for your help". Jantetelco is a pretty town where they make crystallized sweets like jamoncillo, sweet potato, chilacayote squash, fig and bishop's weed. They also grow sweet potato, maize, beans, sorghum, cucumber and nursery tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy meat, tortillas, chicharrones (pork scratchings), cueritos (marinated pork rind), cheese, cream and vegetables for preparing food to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Mrs. Gina O. is from the village of Triunfo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Gina is married to Elmer O. who’s working as a security guard and they are blessed with one school-aged child. To make a living, she is presently engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business. She is also receiving regular support from her husband as a guard. She has been engaged in this kind of business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Just this year, Gina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting her 1rst loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used for the registration of their new motorcycle. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from that business to improve the general living conditions of her family especially for her basic needs, saving, insurance and possible business expansion.

 About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for the registration of their new motorcycle.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica tiene   26 años de edad. Ella es joven y vive con su esposo y su menor hijo todos  en la casa de sus suegros. Ellos residen en la ciudad de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura al norte del Perú. Su casa esta ubicada cerca de la plaza de armas del distrito.

Su esposo se dedica a realizar  trabajos en el campo como agricultor, el también se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de  mototaxi (vehiculo de transporte público, con  moto y una cabina para el transporte de personas).

Verónica se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y obsequios para varios eventos. Para poder desarrollar su actividad, Verónica ha instalado su negocio  en la sala de sus suegros. Ellos la apoyan brindándole ese espacio de su casa para su negocio.

Verónica tiene muchos  clientes  y cuenta con la fidelidad de muchos de ellos, su negocio es muy conocido  a solo un año de su creación .ella cuenta con una muy buena ubicación estratégica para la venta   ya que se encuentra ubicada en el centro de la cuidad.

Verónica es cliente conocida y bancarizada  de Edpyme Alternativa ya que recibió su primer crédito y lo pagó con responsabilidad. Ahora ella esta solicitando un préstamo de  S/.1400.00  para que de esta manera Verónica pueda comprar y surtir con mas mercadería, implementar e innovar su negocio con novedades en prendas de vestir y obsequios  según la estación.

Verónica tiene un espíritu emprendedor, ella quiere que sus inventarios y su  negocio crezcan. Pues ella desea  ser una empresaria de éxito pues cuenta  con  muchas cualidades de las que resaltan su puntualidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Verónica is 26 years old. This young woman lives with her husband and young son in the house of her in-laws. Their home is located near the town square of their district in the city of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura in northern Peru.

Her husband works in the field as a farmer. He also offers transportation services using his motorcycle taxi (a public transportation vehicle that consists of a motorcycle with an attached cabin for transporting people).

Verónica sells clothing and gifts for different events. In order to operate her business, she set up a store in the living room of her in-laws. They have supported her by providing space in their home for her business.

Verónica has many customers and enjoys the fact that many of them have remained loyal. Her business is well-known even though it has been in existence for only one year. She has a very good strategic location for making sales since her business is in the central part of town.

Verónica is a recognized client who has banked with Edpyme Alternativa, having repaid her first loan in a responsible manner. Now she is requesting a loan of 1400 PEN so that she can purchase more merchandise to restock her store. This will refresh her business and keep it in operation since she will have novelty gifts and clothes for the new season.

Verónica has an entrepreneurial spirit, so she wants to expand her inventory and grow her business. She wants to become a successful businesswoman and has many qualities that highlight her promptness and responsibility.

loans.use: to restock her business with clothes and seasonal gifts.

loans.name: Semassa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEMASSA est formé de treize personnes qui habitent toutes dans la même agglomération. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Marie est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Marie est mariée à Norbert un cultivateur. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés dont trois sont encore à leur charge. Marie assure seule les différentes charges de la maison. Pour y arriver, Marie vend des graines de soja à Agbamé dans le département de l’Atlantique. Parallèlement à cette activité, marie vend du maïs et du fromage au soja. Marie s’approvisionne au marché de Houègbo dans le département de l'Atlantique. C’est la première fois que Marie et son groupe sollicite de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en: The Semassa Group is composed of 13 individuals living in the same area. The group’s representative, by the name of Marie, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Marie is married to Norbert, a farmer. They have five children, all of whom are in school and three of whom are still in their care. Marie provides for the household needs on her own. In order to do so, she sells soy beans in Agbamé, in the Atlantic Department. In addition, Marie also sells corn and soy cheese. Marie stocks up at the Houègbo market in the Atlantic Department. It is is the first time that Marie and her group are seeking a loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to strengthen their business in order to better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy three bags of corn and three bags of soy beans

loans.name: Mehrac

texts.en: Mehrac is 60 years old and married man. He is a farmer from the Bilasuvar and has been farming for many years. Mehrac's greatest goal is to improve his economic situation and provide a better life for his children. He has two sons and three daughters. Mehrac sells meat and dairy produced in his cattle-breeding business at the Bilasuvar bazaar. He applied for 1000 AZN loan to purchase three more calves for his breeding business. After repaying this loan he plans to apply for another loan from Aqroinvest to buy more cows.

loans.use: to purchase three calves.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: El Señor Juan Bautista tiene 56 años. Su actividad económica es  brindar el servicio de transporte. Su actividad empieza a las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, el lugar se llama la reynaga, Juan es quien se encarga de transportar a todos sus clientes a las diferentes comarcas. Tiene más de 12 años de tener este negocio, ha sido poco a poco que ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de él y su familia. El financiamiento que actualmente solicita es para la compra de llantas, mantenimiento de su camión, focos, caja de cambios entre otros. su deseo es expandir su negocio para salir adelante.
texts.en: Sr. Juan Bautista, 56, drives a taxi for a living.  He works from 7 in the morning until 8 at night.  The business is called La Reynaga.  Juan is responsible for ferrying customers around from place to place.  His income from driving a taxi has supported him for more than 12 years now and he's slowly managed to improve his life and the lives of his family.  He will use this loan to buy tires, pay for vehicle maintenance, new headlights and a new gearbox, etc.  He wants to expand his business so that he can get ahead in the world.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance for his taxi business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 44-year-old married man and a father to four children. Mohamad has worked in transportation since 2008,when he came back to Lebanon from Sweden. Mohamad likes his business a lot; he is well known in the region. Mohamad is a man with a good reputation, and is devoted to his work and customers' needs. He is recommended by most of his clients, who are neighbors, relatives and foreigners.

Mohamad is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to do necessary maintenance to his car, so he can be in a good situation for this summer's high season since tourists are his major source of living.

Mohamad hopes to stay satisfying to his customers' needs and in good health to be capable of doing all his family's requests.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance to his car.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto  nos cuenta que nació en la comunidad del Tambo Real (provincia de Anta, departamento Cusco, Perú), tiene 32 años de edad y tiene su pareja y junto con ella tiene seis hijos. Actualmente, Rigoberto  vive en la misma comunidad de donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Rigoberto trabaja en la municipalidad del distrito de Zurite en el área de construcción civil. Ya son varios años que trabaja como albañil y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él y su esposa se dedican a la ganadería. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar ganado como por ejemplo vacas lecheras.

Rigoberto  es una persona trabajadora y responsable que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Solidaridad de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Rigoberto tells us that he was born in the community of Tambo Real (in the Anta province of the Cusco department, Peru). He is 32 years old and has a partner with whom he has 6 children. Currently Rigoberto lives in the same community where he was born and there he is developing his economic endeavors. 

Rigoberto works at the municipality of the Zurite district in civil construction. He has worked for several years now as a builder and he has done very well thanks to the effort he has put into his work. He and his wife also make their living in animal husbandry. Given this opportunity they need this loan to buy livestock like dairy cows for example. 

Rigoberto is a hard worker and responsible which is why his friends invited him to participate in the “Solidaridad de Tambo Real” comunal bank of the Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy livestock like dairy cows for example.

loans.name: Sotera

texts.en: Sotera, a 67-year-old married mother of 10, lives in the Philippines where she has owned and operated a retail shop selling sliced fruits such as mangoes and guavas for five years. A new member of HSPFI, Sotera has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fruits to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell.

loans.name: Segundo Nicolas

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 50 años vive en Machachi cerca de Latacunga junto con su esposa y sus tres hijos que tienen 17,15,12 años, se considera una persona de caracter fuerte y recto.

Trabala lustrando zapatos (limpiando zapatos) con sus esposa en el parque de Machachi tuvo su puesto en la asociación hace 2 años.

Es la primera vez que trabaja con FIDEMI, solicita el crédito para la compra de un puesto e la asociación para que ahí trabaje su mujer, gracias a este puesto tendrían un ingreso mas en su familia y mejoraría su calidad de vida.

Su sueño es incrementar su clientela para que le genere más ingresos y poder terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Segundo is 50 years old and lives in Machachi, which is near Latacunga, with his wife and three children (ages 17, 15, and 12). He is considered to be a person of strong and upright character.

He and his wife shine shoes at the park in Machachi. They have a post from the association where they have worked for two years.

This is the first time Segundo has worked with FODEMI. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy a location from the association so that he and his wife can continue to work. By having this location, they will be able to generate more income for their family and improve their quality of life.

Segundo dreams of attracting more customers so that he can generate more income and finish the construction of his house.

loans.use: to acquire a location for his shoeshine business.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 45 years old and lives in Austin Heights, Kolambugan, Lanao Del Norte.  She is married and has 3 children. 

To earn a living, Maria Teresa has a business selling cassava cakes. She earns about PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. Maria Teresa has requested a loan to purchase another oven and ingeredients to be used for cassava making.

Maria Teresa has been a member of PMPC for 1 month.  In the future, she would like to improve her living condition and to make her business become successful.

loans.use: purchase an oven and ingredients to make cassava cakes

loans.name: Nury Tatiana

texts.es:
Nury de 23 años es madre soltera, tiene un niño pequeño. Ella cuenta con su negocio de venta de ropa. Vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, zona regenerada actualmente, pero que no deja de ser insegura, aunque hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultades  para  vender su mercadería.
Para crecer en sus ganancias ella está requiriendo de un préstamo para poder realizar un mejoramiento de la vivienda, además está pensando invertir en más mercadería y podrá cristalizar sin problemas las actividades que tiene planeadas.
El hecho de ser madre soltera la hace ser más fuerte en el dia a dia para poder mantener a su hijo. En el futuro espera que su niño tenga una  buena educación y tener una casa construida totalmente de cemento.
texts.en:
23-year-old Nury is a single mother and has a young son.  She owns a clothing business.  Nury lives in the suburb of Guayaquil, an area which is undergoing regeneration but is still unsafe.  However, so far she hasn't had difficulties selling her merchandise.

Nury hopes to grow her profits.  She is requesting a loan so that she can improve her home.  She is also planning to invest in more merchandise.  This will enable her to carry out the projects that she has planned without problems.

Being a single mother makes Nury stronger in her daily life so that she is able to support her son.  Her hopes for the future are for her son to receive a good education and for them to own a house made entirely from cement.

loans.use: to buy stones, sand and cement

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells bags of charcoal in Abura. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. She responsibly assists her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to pay for the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is 25 years old and married with six sons and four daughters. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with decent salary. Hasan also has a grocery store that provides another source of income for his family.

Hasan is requesting a loan from FATEN to purchase more groceries to expand and improve his inventory. He will repay his loan on a monthly basis and will also use his profit to purchase more groceries to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions. Hasan is a conservative man, so his father Omar is photographed instead.

About this loan:

FATEN offers loans that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit this cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Badamtsetseg

texts.en: Badamtsetseg is 48 years old and lives with her two sons in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband died five years ago, and two kids are in college. She used to be a clerk, but then she built a small grocery shop in her yard, which is beside the main road, in 2009. She is good with numbers and she is very experienced in her business. Her shop has a good location and has good potential. She is a strong and diligent woman who says, "It has been [a] difficult past few years due to my late husband, however I've never given up and never will." She is requesting a 2,150,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase more grocery items to broaden the range of products in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items.

loans.name: Yolanda Antonia

texts.es: Yolanda Antonia, de cincuenta y dos años de edad, reside al Occidente del país en una colonia que se encuentra en zona urbana, son más de seis años los de vivir ahí, junto a ella vive un hijo mayor de edad y la esposa de él, Yolanda les ha dado apoyo para que inicien su vida como pareja. Yolanda cuenta principalmente con la ayuda económica que brinda su hija que se halla en el extranjero, gracias a esos aportes, inteligentemente Yolanda estableció desde hace más de un año en su misma casa, una tienda donde provee productos de primera necesidad a vecinos y personas que transitan, aprovechando que se encuentra ubicada sobre calle principal de la colonia que ha resultado ser un sitio muy estratégico y excelente para vender, así lo cuenta Yolanda. Ella es muy atenta, ordenada y  Alegre, y es lo que probablemente ha marcado la diferencia frente a los demás negocios cercanos y para que la prefieran sus clientes;  en el poco tiempo que tiene de funcionar el negocio se ha vuelto uno de los mas surtidos de la zona. En atención a contar con productos que demandan más sus clientes o no posee actualmente es que Yolanda se encuentra solicitando financiamiento a INTEGRAL y poder comprar sardinas enlatadas, cereal para bebé, agua y jugos embotellados, pañales desechables, medicinas, jabones y detergentes.
