Espera con las ganancias que obtenga ir haciendo un fondo de ahorro que le sirva para cuando ya no pueda trabajar
texts.en:
Yolanda Antonia, age 52, lives in an urban zone in the western region of the country. She has lived there for more than six years, along with her son and his wife. She is helping to support the young couple as they begin married life. Yolanda is financially dependent on her daughter, who lives abroad. 

More than a year ago, Yolanda wisely decided to open a small store in her home. She sells basic necessities to her neighbors and people passing through the neighborhood, taking advantage of her location on the main street through town. She is very attentive, organized and happy, which makes her business stand out from the other stores nearby. In the short time she has been running her business, Yolanda's store has already become known as one of the best-stocked stores in the area.
 
In order to maintain stock of products in high demand and to fulfill requests by her customers, Yolanda is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL. She plans to buy tins of sardines, baby food, bottled water and juice, disposable diapers, medicine, soap and detergent. With the income from her business, Yolanda hopes to continue saving so she can support herself after she is no longer able to work.

loans.use: To buy tins of sardines, baby food, bottled water and juice, disposable diapers, medicine, soap and detergent.

loans.name: Boris

texts.fr:
Boris est  un homme âgé  de 32 ans. Il est marié å une infirmière. Il a 02 enfants. Le premier a 04 ans et le dernier a 02 ans.  
Boris travaille comme couturier depuis 1999. Il coud les habits des clients dans un atelier.
Boris a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tissus jeans pour confection de tenues. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Boris voudrait agrandir son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Boris is a 32-year-old man.  He is married to a nurse and has two children.  His eldest child is 4 years old and his youngest is 2.

Boris has been working as a tailor since 1999.  He sews clothes for his customers in a workshop.

Boris has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy denim for making clothing.  He would like to re-invest in his business.

Over the coming years, Boris would like to expand his business.  He says that he plans to use his profits to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy denim for making clothing

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and three children in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Loan has managed her general store for over five years. Her husband helps her to deliver goods when they are ordered. Loan sells many kinds of beverages and basic household items. She intends to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of goods in bulk to sell to her customers during the coming holiday season.

She hopes that through the loan she can earn more money and can save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of goods in bulk to sell from her general store.

loans.name: Urjinsuren

texts.en:
Urjinsuren is 48 years old and lives with her husband in a ger (a Mongolian yurt or tent) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is a sick old man who stays at home.

She started her business journey in 2003 by renting a counter in a market to sell groceries.  Now she has built a small shop in her own yard. She extended her shop this year. However, due to the building cost, her resources are not enough to fill the extended part of the shop.

She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy supplies. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says,"I have to do everything to cover my husband's medical costs."

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Lucio Juan

texts.es: El señor Lucio es un cliente antiguo, que demostró buen comportamiento de pago de sus anteriores créditos, vive en la zona de Brasil, al norte de la ciudad de el alto,  el señor Lucio se dedica a la venta de cocoa (chocolate en polvo),  en las distintas ciudades de Bolivia como Sucre, Potosí y Cochabamba entre otros, este tipo de actividad es de forma ambulante y de venta por libra, la cocoa proviene de los yungas (lugar cálido de Bolivia y conocido por la producción de fruta, coca, cacao y otros). El mayor sueño del señor Lucio es el llegar a tener una fabrica de chocolates y exportarlo a otros países del mundo, pero sabe que esto solo lo podrá logran con esfuerzo y el financiamiento de terceros, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en el pago de la ultima cuota de su vivienda, el sr. lucio se siente agradecido y feliz por la oportunidad que se le brindaron.
texts.en: Señor Lucio is an old client who has a very good history of payment in his previous loans. He lives in the Brasil zone in the north of the El Alto city. He sells cocoa (powdered chocolate) in various Bolivian cities such as Sucre, Potosí, and Cochabamba. He sells on the street, by the pound. His cocoa comes from Los Yungas (a hot region of Bolivia known for the production of products such as fruit, coca and cocoa). Lucio's greatest dream is to have a chocolate factory and to export to other countries, but he knows that he can only achieve this through hard work and financing. He will use the money from this loan to make the final payment on his home. Lucio is grateful and happy for this opportunity.

loans.use: to make the final payment on his home.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora nació en la ciudad de Urubamba pero vive en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja. Este pueblo se localiza en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco, Perú. 

Teodora tiene 67 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene nueve hijos, ella tiene diferentes actividades económicas como por ejemplo se dedica a la agricultura, a la preparación de chicha de jora, a la crianza de animales menores y en otras oportunidades ayuda a otras personas en sus chacras. Teodora desde muy joven se dedico a este tipo de actividades pues sus padres también se dedicaban a dichas actividades y por lo tanto estas actividades se trasmiten de generación en generación. Teodora es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que a su edad sigue trabajando pues es admirada y respetada por todos sus compañeros del banco comunal. En  esta oportunidad Teodora requiere el préstamo para comprar  maíz para preparar jora que sirve para la elaboración de la rica chicha de maíz. 

Teodora es integrante del grupo “Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja” lo conforman 19 socios que viven en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Teodora was born in the city of Urubamba but now lives in the village of Rumichaca Baja.  This town is located in Urubamba District, Urubamba Province and Cusco Department, Perú.

Teodora is 67 years old, married and has had nine children.  She has a variety of different economic activities.   For example: she’s a farmer, she makes “chicha de jora” [corn-based beverage], raises small farm animals and sometimes helps others in their fields.

Teodora started doing these activities while still very young since her parents also did them so they have been passed down from generation to generation.  

Teodora is an enterprising, hardworking woman who continues to work at her age because she’s admired and respected by all of her fellow communal bank members.  On this occasion, Teodora needs the loan to buy corn to make jora which is needed to make the delicious corn chicha.

Teodora is a member of the “Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja” (Rumichaca Baja Sunflowers) that has 19 members from the town of Rumichaca Baja and which is where they carry out their economic activities.

loans.use: to buy corn to make "jora" [corn-based beverage].

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith de 22 años, hace 8 años comparte su vida con Adán, con quien tiene 3 hijos de 7, 5 y 2 años de edad. Está feliz familia vive en la comunidad nativa Alto San Pablo de Shaoriato, distrito de Pichanaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Edith creció en el campo. Vio a sus padres trabajar la tierra y por eso aprendió a desenvolverse con facilidad en sus propios terrenos. Ahora ella cuenta con 2 parcelas de terrenos cultivables, ahí siembra café y kión. Cada uno de estos productos es muy bien cuidado por ella y Adán. Ambos distribuyen su tiempo para dedicarse a la limpieza, abonamiento, y cosecha de sus cultivos.
Cuando es época de cosecha el trabajo es más intenso y tiene que contratar personal para apresurarlo. Una vez cosechado, traslada sus productos hacia la ciudad de Pichanaki y los ofrece por kilos, latas o cajones. Ahí los compradores ya la conocen.
“Al año el kión vota 1000 kilos y lo vendo a 2 soles el kilo, si es rentable, solo hay que limpiarlo siempre”, comenta. Ella está contenta ya que se preocupa por la producción orgánica, y espera multiplicar su producción, para ello deberá alquilar o comprar terrenos. Esas son metas más próximas. Sería la primera vez que Edith  obtendría un préstamo de MFP, por eso manifiesta ser responsable con el pago de las cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Norionkis de alto San Pablo”, del que siente contenta y esperanzada. Invertirá el dinero en el pago de jornaleros para que limpien sus cultivos de café y kión. Además comprará los alimentos para atenderlos en las jornadas.
texts.en:
Edith, 22, has been sharing her life with Adán for the last 8 years; they have three children who are 7, 5, and 2 years old.  This happy family lives in the indigenous community of Alto San Pablo de Shaoriato in Pichanaki Province in Chanchamayo.  

Edith grew up in the countryside.  She watched her parents work the land and that’s how she learned to develop easily in her own land.  She now has two parcels of farmable land where she grows coffee and ginger.  Each of these products is very well cared for by her and by Adán.  They both divide their time up between weeding, fertilizing and harvesting their crops.

When it is harvest time and work is more intense she has to hire staff to make it go more quickly.  Once harvested, she transports her products to the city of Pichanaki to be sold by the kilo, can or case.  Buyers there already know her.

“In a year, 1000 kilos of ginger is produced and I sell it for 2 soles a kilo; it is profitable but one has to clean it always,” she comments.  She’s happy because she’s concerned about organic production and she hopes to multiply production.  To do so, she must lease or buy more land.  Those are her immediate goals.

This will be the first time Edith will get an MFP loan and she states that she will be responsible with her installment payments.  She’s a member of the “Los Norionkis de Alto San Pablo” communal bank that she feels happy and hopeful about.

She will use the money to pay day laborers to clean her coffee and ginger crops; in addition she’ll buy food to feed them.

loans.use: to hire day laborers and to buy food for them.

loans.name: Ladislaa

texts.es:
La Señora Ladislaa, de 44 años de edad, está casada, ella cuenta que es Artesana, realiza bordados de todas las variedades, confecciona manteles de Aopo”i y lienzo, blusas, chombas, camisas, individuales y otros  para su posterior comercialización.
Cuenta que la profesión la aprendió de su difunta madre, con mucho sacrificio logra solventar día a día los gastos familiares con la venta de sus artesanías. Comenta que le gustaría que algún día sus artesanías puedan ir al exterior y sean muy conocidas.
Ladislaa acude a  Fundación Paraguaya para  acceder a una pequeña ayuda que quiere para la compra de Telas (Ao poi y Lienzo, lo cual es muy útil para lo que hace. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan, pues el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Ladislaa is 44 years old, and she is married. She says that she is an artisan. She embroiders all variety of things. She makes AoPoi and lienzo (loose weave cotton) cloth-- blouses, shirts, place mats, and other items for later sale. 

She says that she learned the trade from her late mother. With much sacrifice she’s been able to pay the family bills day to day with the sale of her crafts. She notes that she would like for her crafts to one day go abroad and be well known. 

Ladislaa comes to Fundación Paraguaya to get a little help to buy fabrics (AoPoi and Lienzo) which is the most useful for what she does. She thanks the foundation and Kiva for the opportunity that they’ve given her, since the loan will be a great help.

loans.use: Comprar telas de ao poi y lienzos.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en: Amie 39, is married  with  five  children. She has been working hard  to meet with her family's  needs, and for  the past sixteen years, she has been selling donuts in her community. Her children are currently in school and are between the ages  of 8  to  22  years. They  all live at Gardnersville. She  likes to do  this kind of business  because  she  make a profit  every day. She uses the profit to improve the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more  flour, sugar,  and cooking oil to prepare  more donuts. Her  plans   are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more  flour, sugar,  and cooking oil to prepare  more donuts.

loans.name: Lawe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LAWE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même maison. Agnès, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 31  ans ne vit plus avec son mari.  Agnès est mère de deux enfants, tous  scolarisés et à la  charge du couple. Agnès vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Agnès et son mari. Pour cette raison, Agnès vend des oignons depuis six ans. Agnès s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Agnès sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe LAWE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des oignons.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es: Doña Maria se encuentra motivada y agradecida ya que gracias al crédito que solicito la temporada pasada compro los diferentes fertilizantes, abonos entre otros para asistir la plantación de café con la cual obtuvo una cosecha exitosa. Ella se encuentra muy agradecida pues gracias a ese apoyo económico sus cultivos mejoraron en producción y calidad vendiendo el mismo a muy buen precio en el mercado y cancelando su crédito de forma responsable pues ella considera es la única forma de agradecer la confianza depositada en ella a los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva y a la cooperativa COMIXMUL. Nuevamente Doña Maria solicita su segundo crédito para destinarlo en el mismo rubro y mantener la plantación sana para esta próxima temporada de la cual espera que cada una sea mejor agradeciendo nuevamente el apoyo brindado de antemano por los inversionistas en KIVA y COMIXMUL.

loans.use: Para compra de abono, fertilizantes, foliares entre otros para asistir la plantilla de café

loans.name: Sulton

texts.ru: Султон верный муж, ответственный отец, надежный друг и брат. Султону 33 года. Он вместе с семьей проживает в городке Куляб, Хатлонской области. Султон трудится и работает ради семьи, детей.  Он занимается продажей одежды вместе с женой. Они бок обок трудятся вместе, чтобы обеспечить детей и дать им достойное образование. Султон обратился за кредитом, чтобы привезти новый товар сезонной одежды и расширить деятельность. Он надеется, что таким образом привлечет к новому товару больше покупателей и увеличит доход и расширить деятельность. Султон заранее благодарит Вас за поддержку.
texts.en: Sulton is a faithful husband, a responsible father, and a reliable friend and brother.  He is 33 years old and lives with his family in the city of Kulob, in the Khatlon province of Tajikistan.  He works hard for the sake of his family and his children.  He and his wife sell clothes.  They work side by side in order to support their children and give them a decent education.  Sulton is taking a loan to bring in a new inventory of seasonal clothes and expand his activity.  With the purchase of this new inventory, Sulton hopes to attract more customers, increase his income and expand his activity.  He thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad was born in 1982 and he is married, he lives with his wife in the south of Jordan in a city called Aqaba, which ‎lies on the coast of the Red Sea, Mohammad has a diploma in English but he did not find a good work to suit with him ‎therefore he decided to start a business.‎

The nature of the city where he lives has given him an experience to work in boats field, so he buy a glass boat, then he ‎decided to develop his business to increase his income so he exchange his glass boat to speedboat and he rented to one ‎of the companies which work in the water games field. ‎
Now Mohammad requested a loan, to pay for maintenance of his speedboat and to continue his business with a high quality of ‎work, since it is his only source of income.‎

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of his speedboat and to continue his business with a high quality of ‎work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy 3 more steers

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame is 37 years old and married with 5 children. Her education ended at basic level. She supports the family income with profits from her 'gari/beans' food joint.

Maame has operated this joint for well over 6 years now. Her desire is to improve the eating environment of her customers. Thus she seeks to use the KIVA loan to construct a shed and fill it with plastic tables and chairs for the convenience of her patrons.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Adilenix

texts.en:
My name is Adilenix B., and I have dedicated myself to making and selling tortillas for the past three years. My clientele is good since tortillas are a common food in my country that is eaten at lunch and dinner. My goal is increase my production, and with the earning I'll be able to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Adilenix B. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que las tortillas es un alimento comun en nuestro pais que se acompaña con el almuerzo y la cena, mi meta es tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias sque obtenga poder alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase cornmeal, lime, salt, water and firewood.

loans.name: Joseph Fru

texts.en:
Born in 1965, Joseph is married to Nguti Grace and is the father of three children. His electrical workshop was burnt during a political uproar which forced him to go to the village to start cultivating crops. This was not lucrative for him to provide education for his children because of lack of investment capital so he was motivated to become a member of GHAPE. Before receiving his first loan, he was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, he has been able to invest in cultivating crops and repay all his loans with which he raised money to buy good food for his household, pay school fees, buy medications and increase his business.

Given a loan of $1200, he plans to do motor bike transport business. This is a lucrative business in this area as many now transport themselves on motor bike since it is faster and he has experience in that field. His repayment will commence in the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Joseph would like to purchase a motor bike to provide transportation.

loans.name: Rugiyya

texts.en: Rugiyya is a 38-year-old widow with 2 children. She lives in Yenikand village, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. She has her own vineyard and 10 years of experience in this business. She would like a loan of $1200 so that she can buy pesticides and enjoy a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy pesticides

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy M. is married with nine children. She is 55 years of age and hails from Ajanmgbadi in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs and has been in this business since 1999. She requests a loan of $250 to buy more foodstuffs for sale. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: To buy more food stuff for sale

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: Matalena is 29 married with 4 children. Cocoa and vegetable were the only source of income for the family. Matalena heard of SPBD through the women in her village so she decided to join so she could develop her business into a better one. Through years of trying and sacrificing they have managed to become where they are now. Through her loan it helps motivate her to  become more develop and to earn for a better future.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her Samoan cocoa business and plantation

loans.name: Umaraly

texts.ru:
Umaraly Ishankullv was born in 1982, he is single and has completed high school. During the past two years, he has been selling fabrics. He sells them in a market place called "Korvon" that is located in Dushanbe, Tajikistan.

Umaraly found out about microcredit organization "MicroInvest" from a credit expert, and he registered with our organization on July 6, 2007. He successfully paid off his first loan, which helped him expand his assortment of fabrics and receive a good profit.

When he heard about Kiva's microcredit program, he decided to participate in order to receive a loan to purchase more fabrics.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Умарали Ишанкулов 1982 года рождения, не семейный, образование среднее. Занимается продажей тканей на протяжении 2 лет. Он торгует на рынке "Корвон"в городе Душанбе, Таджикистан. О Микроинвесте услышал от кредитного эксперта и зарегистрировался в нашей организации 07.06.2007году. Успешно погасил свой первый займ который помог ему расширить ассортимент тканей и получить хорошую прибыль. Услышав о программе Кива захотел участвовать с целью получения паралельного займа на покупку 2-х рулонов велюра,1-го рулона шерстянных тканей новинок и 4-х рулонов рисунчатых тканей.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana, is a very hardworking woman that is always aware of the wishes of her family; many years of hard work and effort have allowed her and her husband to manage their own businesses and be able to finance the dreams of their children. Ana wants to be able to keep her family together and at the same time has a deep sorrow knowing that her mother has pancreatic cancer. For this reason, she wants to take advantage of every moment to spend time with her mother and her family and wishes to forge ahead despite all the sad moments in her life that she won't let defeat her. As part of her improvement projects, she wishes to increase her income through increasing her inventory of wood. To bring this to fruition, she asks for a loan so she can improve her dear mother's quality of life if only for a few months. Support this woman of great valor and strength.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Ana, es una dama muy trabajadora que siempre está pendiente D. los deseos D. su familia, muchos años D. trabajo y esfuerzo han logrado que ella y su esposo en la actualidad manejen sus propios negocios y ambos son parte importante del financiamiento D. los sueños que sus hijos albergan. Ana tiene los enormes deseos D. mantener unida a su familia y a la vez tiene una pena muy profunda al saber que su anciana madre tiene cáncer D. páncreas por esa razón quiere aprovechar cada momento al lado D. su querida madre y D. los suyos y quiere seguir adelante a pesar D. los momentos tristes D. su vida y ya que manifiesta no se dejará vencer por las adversidades. Como parte D. sus proyectos está la mejora D. sus ingresos económicos por ello incrementará su capital en la compra D. madera y para iniciar este hecho solicita un préstamo, convencida D. mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su querida madre aunque sea por pocos meses.Apoya a esta mujer D. gran valor y fortaleza.

loans.use: Influx of capital to acquire a larger quantity of wood.

loans.name: Balahnina

texts.ru:
L. Balahnina who is 45 years old, is married and is a mother of four children. She has secondary education. Her husband is now working in the Russian Federation and her children go to school. L. started selling fish about four years ago. When she heard about MicroInvest she decided to apply for a loan to increase her inventory sales. After receiving her loan, she acquired additional inventory, expanded her vendor space and also got new customers. Right now her assets have doubled. She plans to start selling wholesale in the future and export goods into other cities.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Балахнина Лиля –45лет. Замужем, мать четверых детей, образование среднее. Муж находится в РФ на заработках а дети учатся в школе. Начала заниматься торговлей рыбами 4 года назад. Узнав о программе МЗФ «Микроинвест» она решила получить займ и увеличить товарооборот. После получения займа она увеличила товар, расширила место, приобрела много новых клиентов. Сейчас её активы увеличились в два раза. В будущем планирует перейти на оптовую продажу и поставлять товар в другие города.

loans.use: To start selling wholesale

loans.name: Emilia Domitila

texts.es:
Ms. Emilia Gonzáles is worthy of of being emulated, as she spends her days elaborating meals for sale at her home. She lives in the Somotillo community and has characterized herself for being an excellent cook, who makes her own dishes, consumed by her costumers with great delight.

It is important to point out that the responsibility of securing the wellbeing of her household lies on her. For that reason she has sought Ceprodel’s support, in the form of loans which have allowed her to purchase the ingredients needed to prepare her meals and improve her business. She presently counts a total of two credits with Ceprodel, standing out as a loyal customer of the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Emilia Gonzáles es una persona digna de imitar, ya que todos los días y a todo momento se dedica a la elaboración de alimentos para venderlos en su casa de habitación. Ella es habitante de la comunidad de Somotillo y se ha caracterizado por ser excelente cocinera, elaborando sus propios platillos que con mucho gusto sus clientes consumen.

Es necesario destacar que ella es una dama con la obligación de velar por el bienestar de su núcleo familiar. Para ello ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan adquirir la materia prima para preparar los alimentos y así salir adelante en su negocio. Hoy en día ella tiene un total de dos créditos en Ceprodel destacándose como fiel cliente de la institución.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. prepares a native food called ‘banku’, which is made from maize. Banku is popular with the natives of her area. Mrs. A. is married and has 4 dependants. Business is going very well, so she wishes to increase production and sales. But she is running out of ingredients.

She is asking for a loan to buy more food items for her food production business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for food production and sale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi C., now 43 years old, has joined TYM since 2003. In her first loan, she borrowed 2 million VND to invest in breeding pigs and poultry and profit almost 1.2 millions VND. After searching around, she realized that putting money into producing wine also make big profit so that were the focus of later loan cycles. Apart from selling wine to local area, the left over ingredient (after making the wine) can be used as food-stuff for their breeding pigs. Hard work evidently paid off as her family's total earning monthly is about 3 millions VND. She hope, with this next loan cycle of 10 millions VND, she could buy seed-rice for a cheap price to produce more wine.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Cường năm nay 43 tuổi, chị tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2003. Vòng vốn đầu chị vay 2.000.000 đ sử dụng vào việc chăn nuôi lợn, gà cho thu nhập 1.200.000đ. Sau một thời gian tham gia vào Quỹ được vay vốn và nhận thấy việc nấu rượu có khả năng cho thu nhập cao hơn chị đã bàn với chồng vay thêm vốn để đầu tư vào việc mua bán lúa để nấu rượu và bán lại cho các đại lý trong vùng. Ngoài ra vợ chồng chị còn sử dụng nguồn lương thực từ công việc nấu rượu như bã rượu để nuôi lợn tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Nhờ chăm chỉ làm ăn thu nhập của gia đình chị đã ngày càng tăng lên. Tổng thu nhập của gia đình chị hàng tháng là 3.000.000đ. Chị mong muốn được vay mức vốn 10 triệu đồng để mua thêm lúa giá rẻ trong vụ mùa về dự trữ để nấu rượu bán.

loans.use: Agriculture

loans.name: Grâce

texts.fr:
Born around 1978 in Cotonou, Ms. Grâce Y. is a mother of four children, three of whom are in school. These children are all in the care of their parents. Her husband is employed at SOBEBRA (Société Béninoise de Brasseries ). She sells various commonly consumed goods and vegetable oil. She has a shop in her home located in the Gankpodo district, not far from one of the branch offices of ALIDE. For her first loan, she is requesting the amount of 100,000 francs CFA enabling her to buy five drums of peanut oil. This loan will help her start her business and make it more competitive.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1978 à Cotonou, dame Y. Grâce est mère de quatre enfants dont trois sont scolarisés. Ces enfants sont tous à la charge de leurs parents . Son mari est employé à la SOBEBRA (Société Béninoise de Brasseries ). Elle est vendeuse de divers produits de consommation courantes et d'huile végétale. Elle possède sa boutique en son domicile sis au quartier Gankpodo non loin de l'une des agences de ALIDé. Pour son premier crédit elle sollicite un montant de 100 000F CFA qui lui permettra d'acheter cinq bidons d'huile d'arachide. Ce prêt participera à l'émergence de son activité et la rendra beaucoup plus compétitive.

loans.use: To buy five drums of peanut oil

loans.name: Yanina

texts.en:
Yanina is married. She has one son, Maxim. Yanina started a small business motivated by sheer necessity to have a means to live. Today she runs a kiosk selling household items and other small necessities. She has been in business for 12 years. She has about $2400 invested in her business.

Yanina is very sociable and lively. Her efforts, dedication and rich experience of work in the sphere of market trade have helped her keep and expand this business. Her natural talent to get a wide assortment of practical items for sale helps Yanina find her market and be successful in her business. Yanina is requesting a loan to invest in increasing her inventory. She wants to purchase a range of practical items that always sell well. The loan in combination with constant hard work and willingness to serve clients' needs will promote growth of her business and increase of her earnings.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Gloriela Idalia

texts.es:
Gloriela inicio este negocio para ayudar en los gastos económicos de su hogar. Empezó comprando poco a poco ropa en los tianguis de esta ciudad, a un precio más económico del modo que tuviera ganancias. Inicio el negocio en su domicilio, vendiéndole a sus vecinas, amistades y al publico en general, le ha dejado buenas ganancias gracias a ello a podido solventar gastos en su hogar. Ahora tiene el deseo de invertir en ropa nueva, calzado, bolsas para dama y pues tener de todo un poco al igual que desea comprar unas pacas de ropa a precio de mayoreo.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara a 6 meses para poder tener variedad de mercancía, ella confía que con tu apoyo podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
Gloriela began this business in order to help with her home expenses. Gradually, she began buying clothing in the markets of this city, at a cheaper price so that she could make profit.

She began her business in her home, selling to her neighbors, friends and to the general public. It has brought her good income and she has been able to pay off her bills. Now, she would like to invest in new clothes, shoes, and bags for ladies, and therefore have a little of everything. At the same time, she wishes to buy clothing in bulk at wholesale prices.

Gloriela is requesting loan of US $300, which she will repay in six months, in order to have product variety. She trusts that, with your help, she will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Phon P., 38, is a motorcycle taxi driver. He has been driving a taxi since 2004 and can earn approximately $2.33 per day. His wife, Mrs. Eoeun Met, 37, buys raw materials and makes Khmer traditional baskets to sell from her house. Phon has four children, all of whom go to school and also help with their mother's business. Phon faces difficulty with his old motorcycle, which is often broken, depriving him of customers and thus affecting his income. He needs a new motorcycle to improve his income, but he lacks the money to carry out this plan. Hence, he has requested a loan of $200 to purchase a secondhand motorcycle to replace the old one. Phon was chosen as the leader of a five-member loan group. The other members are:

1.Mrs. Phai T., 52, who sells wooden cutting boards used for chopping meat. T. requested a loan of $300 to buy a secondhand motorcycle for transportation.

2.Mrs. Hing P., 46, sells desserts and Khmer noodles in front of her house. Hing needs a loan of $300 to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for easier transportation.

3.Mrs. Tan T., 64, a Khmer noodle seller. Tan requests a loan of $200 to purchase piglets to breed.

4.Mr. Man M., 27, a motorcycle taxi driver. Man needs a loan of $250 to replace his motorcycle.

These five people all live in Leangdaiy Commune, Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Nneka

texts.en: Nneka A. lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 40 years old and married with 6 children. Her husband is a security guard. She sells pure water and drinks. Nneka also sells foodstuffs in her store. She needs the loan amount of N41,000 to purchase more drinks and pure water to sell. She says this loan will enable her to stock her store with more drinks. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pure water to  sell

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en: Maria Luz is a member of the Nobleza (“Nobility”) Village Bank.  Maria Luz is 38 years old and separated with two children. Maria Luz sells bricks and other construction materials. She sells from her home and also makes home deliveries in a rented vehicle. She often fires the bricks herself in a rented oven. Maria Luz is requesting a loan to buy sand and bricks.  Maria Luz’s dreams are to educate her children and improve her businesses.

loans.use: To buy sand and bricks

loans.name: Rosario Isabel

texts.es:
Rosario inició el negocio en Marzo de 2004, porqué deseaba obtener un ingreso propio para no tener que depender totalmente de su esposo en el aspecto económico y además quería contribuir ayudando con los estudios de sus hijos. Empezó  gracias a una persona que le ofreció  productos naturistas para uso persona, pero al notar los resultados que le dieron empecé a ofrecerlos entre familiares y amigos
Ella siente que ha ido progresando porque desde hace un año también se dedico a vender joyería de plata la cual también logro vender entres sus clientes de los productos naturistas y gracias a su negocio puede costear la carrera universitaria de su hija.
Ahora necesita de un préstamo por MXN $5,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para comprar mercancía que le permitirá comprar mas productos para poder cubrir pedidos de sus clientes y también para comprar joyería de plata aprovechando esta temporada navideña que se acerca y en la que la gente compra más para hacer regalos
texts.en:
Rosario started the business in March of 2004. She wanted to have her own income and not totally depend on her husband economically. She also wanted to help pay for her children's education. She started thanks to a person who offered her natural products for personal use. When she noticed the results, she began offering them to family and friends.

She feels her business has improved because she began selling silver jewelry a year ago. She was able to sell the jewelry to her customers who buy the natural products. Thanks to her business she can pay for her daughter's university education.

Now she needs a loan for MXN $5,000 to buy merchandise which she will pay back in 10 bi-monthly installments. This will allow her to buy more products to cover her customers' orders and also buy silver jewelry, taking advantage of the upcoming Christmas season when people buy more to give as presents.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Adisa

texts.en:
Adisa I. sells fresh yams in the local market square. She buys tubers of yams in Kintampo in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana and sometimes from surrounding villages. Adisa has been in business for over ten years. She also distributes the yams to food vendors in her community. 

She is sixty–two years old, married with seven children: four girls and three boys. Her last born is in junior high school. The rest have completed school. Some of her children are working and living independently. She lives with her family in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Adisa works hard to support her husband and take care of the family. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops.

With the loan, she wants to purchase tubers of yams on a larger scale so she can cut down on cost, such as less trips to procure yams. Adisa hopes to improve her income and give more support to her child in school.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yams.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy Yomekpe is 33 years old and is a married woman with two children. One of her children is in school whilst the last born is still breastfeeding. Mercy has been selling frozen foods like chicken, pork, mutton, fish, etc. in the local market of Accra for six years. She does not have adequate funds to support her business. Meanwhile, demand for her product is on the higher side. This has affected her operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, pork, and sausages to enable her to raise enough income to expand her sales. She belongs to a village bank called "Yayra" which means Blessing. She hopes to receive GHS 500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, pork, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Srei

texts.en: Mrs. Srei O. lives in Ta Daul Pi village in the Kandal province. She is a laborer who is a hard-working woman. She is a 46-year-old widow with five children, three of whom have different businesses while the others are attending the local school. Although they try to work hard, they still do not earn enough income to support their family. They also live in an old house which is flooded during the rainy season. In order to make the house better for living, Mrs. Srei O. decided to ask for a loan to buy soil to fill in her deep land.

loans.use: To buy soil to fill in her deep land that floods

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: La familia de Dña. Aurelia esta compuesta 6 miembros. Dña. Aurelia que tiene 63 años su conyugue que no se encuentra con ellos a la fecha y dos de sus hijos trabajan en España y dos que están con ella uno de 14 años que estudia y otro de 16 años que se encuentra trabajando como moto taxista. Negocio: Dña. Aurelia tiene su pensión de venta de comidas y gaseosas el negocio se encuentra en un local que se encuentra junto a su casa de Dña. Aurelia, la preparación de las comidas lo realiza Dña. Aurelia personalmente y tiene una ayudante que le colabora a diario y uno de sus hijos medio día. Competencia: la competencia del negocio de Dña. Aurelia es media ya que es la única pensión que existe en el lugar don de a diario frecuentan los trabajadores de la empresa UNAGRO, si existe competencia es bajo ya que los negocios que existen son venta de refrigerios  y no de comidas. Destino del crédito: con este crédito solicitado la clienta ampliara su negocio, comprara más sillas, algunas mesas y un freezer para el equipamiento del negocio según informaciones obtenidas de Dña. Aurelia.                                                                                                                                                                      Antecedentes: Dña. Aurelia es cliente antigua en nuestra institución, con cinco operaciones crediticias todas ellas con buen comportamiento en sus cuotas en cada una de las operaciones que tiene Dña. Aurelia según el historial crediticio de la misma.
texts.en:
Doña Aurelia's family has 6 members; doña Aurelia who is 63 years old, her husband who is not living with them at the moment, two of her children working in Spain, and two who are with her, a 14-year-old who studies and a 16-year-old who is working as a motorcycle taxi driver. Business: Doña Aurelia has a guesthouse where she sells food and pops. The business is located next to her house. She personally cooks and he has an assistant who works with her on a daily basis and one of her children helps out half-a-day. Competition: There is little competition to doña Aurelia's line of business as it is the only guesthouse frequented on a daily basis by the workers from UNAGRO enterprise. If there is any competition, it is unimportant as the other businesses in the area only sell snacks not meals. With the loan, the client will expand her business, she will buy more chairs, some tables and a freezer for the business, as informed by doña Aurelia.

History: Doña Aurelia is an old client of our institution with five previous loans all with a good repayment record.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Kahramonchon

texts.ru:
Кахрамончон Марипов уже около 8 лет занимается откормом скота. Дома у него есть 7 голов крупнорогатого скота. Животноводство приносит в его семью основной доход, за счет которого он содержит жену и детей. Жена Кахрамочона Манзура Муротова помогает ему в выращивании сельхозкультур, которые приносят в его семью дополнительный доход. Кроме животноводства и сельского хозяйства Кахрамончон работает в дехканском хозяйстве "Эхсан".
 Клиент запрашивает займ 1000 сомони, на 6 месяцев, хочет увеличить количество своего скота.
texts.en:
Kahramonchon M. has raised cattle for eight years, and he has seven head of large-horned cattle at home. Raising livestock is his family's main source of income, the means by which he supports his wife and children. Kahramonchon's wife, Manzura Murotova, helps him cultivate the crops that bring additional income into the family. In addition to raising livestock and farming, Kahramonchon works on the Ehsan farm. The client is requesting a six-month loan of 1000 somoni, as he wants to increase the size of his herd.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is a 31-year-old mother of seven children. She is married, but is the sole bread-winner for the family right now. She lives in Nyalenda slum here in Kisumu. She runs a vegetable kiosk that is located next to a beauty salon (pronounced saloon in Kenya). The challenges she faces are fluctuations in the purchasing power of her customers. She hopes to use half the loan for personal use (we were told off camera: school fees) and the other half for increasing her food stocks for her kiosk. She asked that K-MET increase the amount of business training that they give borrowers.

In this video, you can hear me greet Rose saying "Idhi Nade" -- which is Luo for "How are you?" Rose responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "Thank you" and Erokamano, which in Luo, means "thank you." The voices you hear in the background are coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post: http://fellowsblog.kiva.org/2009/05/14/m-banking/

loans.use: Vegetables, Fruits for resale

loans.name: Dương Thị

texts.en:
Q. Dương Thị (1044061357) is a 44 year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To making a living, Q. owns & operates a restaurant.  She serves a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Q. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Q. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help in improving her living situation and engaging in business activities.  Q. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant.  Q. is now requesting another loan of 12,000,000 VND. This time she will invest in renovating the restaurant.  This will be the 5th loan taken out by Q. from TYM Fund.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her restaurant business.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal Luz Divina.
Gregoria es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Gregoria junto a su esposo tienen una distribuidora de insumos de panadería y pastelería, que reparten a domicilio. Además Gregoria prepara tortas, queques, bocaditos, sus productos los vende en los cafetines y tiendas.
Gregoria necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar.
Los sueños de Gregoria son tener una pastelería y una tienda estable de insumos.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the community bank “Luz Divina”. She is 34 years old and has 2 children. She started a Bakery distribution business with her husband which has a home delivery service. Gregoria makes cakes, desserts, sandwiches that she sells coffee shops and stores.

She is asking for a loan of $500 that will be invested in the purchase of sugar. Gregoria’s dream is to have a pastry shop.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Asaase Wura Group

texts.en:
Theresa is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to two children. She is a petty trader. She sells jewelry. She hawks her wares in her community and treks to other towns to sell as well. Theresa is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Asaase Wura’ which literally means 'land owner'. She is seated first from the right in the group photograph.

Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. They work to help their spouses provide for their families. They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell them at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Maria Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Agustina es socia del Banco Comunal Rocafuerte, un grupo de 21 mujeres que residen en el pueblo de Rocafuerte, aproximadamente media hora de la ciudad de Portoviejo. La ciudad es muy conocida por los dulces que vende. El grupo Rocafuerte es muy unido, y las señoras se llevan muy bien entre ellas. El día de nuestra entrevista con Sra. Agustina era el cumpleaños de una de las socias, por eso sirvieron unos bocaditos y cada socia aportó un poco de dinero para regalarla. 

Sra. Agustina tiene 46 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja, con quien tiene 2 hijas pequeñas de 8 y 5 años. Ella tiene un comedor estilo cafetín en su casa, un negocio que abrió hace unos meses atrás. Vende tortillas y pan de almidón todas las tardes entre las 2pm y las 7pm, además sirve almuerzos los días domingo. Antes criaba pollos, pero decidió cambiar de negocios y hasta ahora le está yendo muy bien, algunos días hasta se le agota todo lo que puede producir. Ella vive en un lugar bastante transitado cerca de un paradero de buses, y desde que sacó sus hornos a la calle empezaron a venir mayor clientela, atraída por los olores y lo que veía. Ella dice que aprendió a cocinar adivinando no más, nadie le enseño formalmente.

Sra. Agustina está pidiendo un crédito a la Fundación ESPOIR para comprar mesas y sillas para así incrementar a su negocio. También está pensando comprar otro horno para poder producir más, el cual le sale $140 al contado o $180 a plazos. 

Dice que tiene muchos sueños para el futuro, pero el mayor de ellos es hacer su propia casa (actualmente ella y su familia están viviendo en la casa de su suegra). Sus hijas ya están creciendo y ellas quieren una casa propia, ya le están hablando de comprar los muebles.
texts.en:
Señora Agustina is a client of the Community Bank Rocafuerte, a group of 21 women who live in the town of Rocafuerte, approximately half an hour from the city of Portoviejo. The city is well known for the sweets sold there. The Rocafuerte group is very united, and the women get along very well with each other. The day we interviewed Sra. Agustina it was the birthday of one of the members, so some snacks were served, and each woman chipped in some money for a gift.

Sra. Agustina is 46 years old and lives with her two small children (8 and 5 years) and their father. She has a cafe style dining room in her home, a business she opened two months ago. She sells cakes and starch bread each afternoon between 2pm and 7pm, in addition to serving lunch on Sundays. Agustina previously raised chickens,but decided to change businesses, and so far this has been going very well. Some days she sells everything she can produce. Agustina lives in a well-travelled area near a bus stop, and since she moved her ovens outside she has had many more customers, brought in by the smells and sights. She says she learned to cook by guessing, as no one every formally taught her.

Sra. Agustina is asking for a loan from the Fundación ESPOIR to buy tables and chairs to expand her business. She is also thinking of buying another oven in order to produce more, and this costs $140 cash or $180 in payments.

Sra. Agustina says that she has many dreams for the future, but the greatest is to have her own home (currently she and her family live in the home of her mother-in-law). Her children are growing, and they want their own home. They are already talking about buying the furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables and chairs to increase business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is forty-three years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. All of her children are still in school. As a single parent, she says she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the central region of Ghana.

Cecilia is a petty trader. She sells vegetables such as onions and tomatoes, and other items like soap, salt, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi. She sells on a table top at the market square. Cecilia has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Mak

texts.en:
Mak N. is 45-year-old married woman and mother. She lives with other family members in her own small family home in Siem Reap Province.

Mak N. owns a piece of land on which she grows different kinds of crops and raises a few pigs as well. She will sell to buyers every two or three months when her produce or her pigs have matured.

Mak N. is married with four children, one of whom is married and the others are single. Her husband works in construction to earn a living.

Mak N. requests a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed, as well as to hire a laborer to help her on the farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed, as well as to hire a laborer to help her on the farm

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Luz Maria tiene su negocio de taxi, que su esposo lo maneja. Ella es enfermera técnica, trabaja en un Centro Médico de Villa Maria al Sur de Lima, por las noches estudió podología por un año y este mes de setiembre se estará graduando como Podóloga. 
Los préstamos que recibe le permiten invertirlo en sus carros, Luz María necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para el arreglo técnico de sus carros.
El sueño de Maria es ahora ejercer su nueva carrera con eficacia

loans.use: arreglo técnico de sus carros

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José es un joven emprendedor de 24 años, vive con sus padres y sus 6 hermanos menores en una modesta, pero bien construida casa de un populoso barrio al sur de la ciudad de Lima.
Este muchacho, a pesar de su corta edad, no le huye a las responsabilidades y le sobran ganas de salir adelante. Se levanta muy temprano para trabajar y pensando en tener una mejor vida que se hará realidad en un futuro no muy lejano. Aunque su familia tuvo que pasar muchas dificultades José nunca perdió las esperanzas de sobresalir y ya lo esta logrando. Él es carpintero de oficio y trabaja en el taller de un familiar; adicionalmente, tiene en su casa una bodega donde vende diferentes productos comestibles que es atendida amablemente por su madre, quien la ostentaba al principio, pero después él se hizo cargo de la mercadería.
Su  negocio le es rentable porque le genera buenas ganancias económicas que le permiten ayudar a su familia, sobretodo a sus hermanos menores. Él tiene muchos sueños por cumplir y es por eso que trabaja incansablemente a pesar de su corta edad. Una de las tantas metas que tiene en la vida por cumplir es tener su propia carpintería, además de ampliar su tienda y surtirla con más y mejores productos de calidad.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y ya piensa en sacar otros créditos que le permitan crecer y mejorar cada día, también manifiesta que siempre es muy cumplido con sus pagos, y que el dinero del crédito lo invertirá en surtir la tienda de comestibles que administra con su madre.
texts.en:
José is a young 24-year-old entrepreneur who lives with his parents and 6 younger siblings in a modest but well-built house in a lower-income neighborhood in south Lima. This young man, in spite of his youth, does not avoid his responsibilities and has a lot of drive to get ahead. He gets up very early to work and thinks about having a better life in the future. Although his family went through many difficulties, José never lost hope that he would excel and now he is succeeding. He is a carpenter by trade and works in a relative´s workshop. In addition, he has a home-based convenience store where he sells a variety of groceries and which is run by his mother, who showed it off at first, but later he took over. His business is profitable and generates earnings which allows him to help his family, most of all his younger siblings. He has many dreams to fulfill and that is why he works tirelessly despite his young age. One of his many goals is to have his own carpentry workshop, in addition to expanding his store and stocking it with more and better-quality goods. This is his first loan with MFP and he plans to take out other loans which will allow him to grow. He also says that he always meets his payments on time and his will use his loan to stock the grocery store he runs with his mother.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Mrs. Prak T. is 42 years old and a resident of Kampong Chhnang province. Prak T. currently works sewing clothes for a garment factory and gets a specific salary of $90 per month. She is married with two children. Her husband’s name is Mr. Nhem Sitha, age 52, and he is a retired soldier (he is pictured here). He is a disabled person from the civil war. Because Prak T.’s husband doesn’t have a job, Prak T. would like to borrow the money from Kiva through HKL which she will use to buy piglets for her husband to raise and buy charcoal to sell and earn extra profit.

loans.use: To buy piglets for her husband to raise and buy charcoal to sell for extra profits

loans.name: Fibie

texts.en:
Fibie D. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Fibie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Fibie owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, milk, soap, toothpaste, and canned goods. Fibie has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Fibie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fibie successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Fibie is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fibie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en: Cristine G. is from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 28 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Cristine owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Cristine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Cristine is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina T. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years-old and married with five adult children. Avelina owns and operates a service-based business providing manicures and pedicures to local community members. Avelina has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Avelina joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Avelina is requesting a first loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide the service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is 31 years old. She is married and has four children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading. Felicia works very hard to help her husband provide for their family. 

Felicia sells groceries by the roadside in her community. Felicia buys her goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy groceries in bulk to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Jesus Nelson

texts.es:
El Señor Jesus es cliente antiguo en la institucion, esta casado y tiene hijos mayores y otros que se encuentran en edad escolar, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora se dedica al servicio de transporte urbano tiene su auto trabajando en un radio taxi, todos los dias sale muy temprano hasta las 18:00, a partir de esa hora el retorna a su domicilio para poder ayudar a su esposa y a sus hijos.

Su sueño es poder comprar dos vehiculos más para entregarles a sus hijos mayores para que tambien puedan trabajar y asi puedan pagar sus estudios e independisarse. 

El Sr. Jesus necesita el credito para poder cambiar llantas y hacer algunos arreglos a la movilidad para seguir ofreciendo un excelente servicio a sus clientes.

Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Jesus is an established client with the institution. He is married and has adult children and others who are school aged. He is a very responsible and hardworking person who works in city transportation. His car is part of the radio taxi pool. He leaves early every day and works until 6pm. Then he returns home to help his wife and his children. His dream is to be able to purchase two more cars and give them to his eldest sons so that can also work and be able to pay for their schooling and become independent. Jesus needs a loan to be able to change his tires and make some repairs to his car in order to be able to continue offering excellent services to his customers. He is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for their trust they put in him by extending him the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 42 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a retired civil servant. Her children are excelling in school and this gives her joy. 

She is a trader who sells fruits and foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She uses her experience in business to attract and retain her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more fruits and foodstuffs to sell. She has a good relationship with LAPO, a Kiva partner. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Khen S. H. works as a farmer, earning US $2 per day. She is 33 years old, married and lives with her six-year-old child in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Her husband operates a cart and horse to provide transportation service to people in their village, earning US $7 per day. By doing so, he is able to cover the family's expenses, especially the children’s education. He has been with this job since 2001. 

H. is requesting a loan of US $1200 to purchase a plot of farmland to expand into agricultural products. This is her second loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Auxiliadora M., tiene un negocio de venta de embaces vacios como bidones, barriles, y sacos vacios el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa frente al mercado y a la parada de buses de Cosiguina, y sectores aledaños a esta.
Tiene 17 años de trabajar con este tipo de negocio se esfuerza bastante para tener el sustento en su hogar abre su negocio de lunes a domingo de ocho de la mañana a cinco y media de la tarde  tiene bastante demanda por la ubicación ya que ahí se centraliza la gente que agarra los buses que van para fincas y comarcas, su negocio lo inicio con un capital de C$ 2,000.00 ahorro decidio poner su negocio para ser independiente antes ella trabajaba como secretaria, es madre de dos hijos pero ninguno depende de ella, el financiamiento lo solicito para comprar barriles de unos grandes que le vendian a precio favorable.
La señora M. es clienta de ceprodel desde hace cinco años en los cuales ella se siente muy agradecida con la institución y con los créditos adquiridos ya que ha superado su negocio y su vida familiar tambien.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora M. has a business selling empty containers like cans, barrels, and empty bags. The business is located in her house, in front of the market, at the Cosiguina bus stop, and in surrounding areas. She has done this type of work for 17 years. She puts forth so much effort in order to support her household. The business is open from Monday to Sunday from eight in the morning until five-thirty in the afternoon. There is plenty of demand because of the location. That is where people gather to take the buses that go to the farms and other regions. She started her business with C$ 2,000.00 of savings. She decided to set up her business in order to be independent. Before that she worked as a secretary. She has two children, but they are not dependent upon her. The loan she is requesting is to buy large barrels that are being sold at a good price. Mrs. M. has been a client of Ceprodel for five years. She is very grateful to the institution. With the loans she has improved her business and her family life as well.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy large barrels

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia, a sus 55 años es madre D. 10 hijos, pero solo vive con uno D. ellos, puesto que los demás ya tienen sus propias familias. Ella vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad D. vida.

Trabajando arduamente ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus papas, alverjas y maíz, los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad D. Tarma, ya que es ahí donD. obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es que pueD. disfrutar D. la libertad D. laborar en sus campos, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra, ya que su esposo falleció hace 10 años y ella tiene que realizar el sembrado y cosechado sola. Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para el sembrado D. alverja, ya que por estas fechas es el producto que mejor se venD..

Este es el octavo préstamo D. Felicia con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo D. su negocio, es por eso que está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida.

Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más semillas D. papa y alverja, para sembrar en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Felicia, at 55 is the mother of 10 children, but she only lives with one of them, as the others already have their own families. She lives in her own house and what she wants most is to improve her quality of life. She has managed to get out her crops by working hard. Early every morning she gets up to water and care for the potatoes, peas and corn which are sold in the city of Tarma, where she gets the best prices for her products. What she likes best about her work is that she can enjoy the freedom of working in the fields. She has been doing this work for 25 years and considers working the land alone to be the hardest part since the death of her husband 10 years ago. Over time, she hopes to prepare the land for planting more peas, since they are the best selling product at this time. This is the eighth loan for Felicia with MFP. She knows that this loan will help tremendously in advancing and developing her business, that's why she will pay all loan dues on time. She is a very responsible member of her community bank and well liked. With the twenty-five hundred new soles she will buy more seed for potatoes and peas, to plant this season.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Wiliam Jesus

texts.es:
El socio Wiliam, pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco; situado a 1 hora desde la ciudad de Cusco.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Nuestro socio tiene 53 años de edad, el socio es conviviente y tiene 3 hijas mujeres de 25, 21, 10 años de edad; Nuestro socio se dedica a  compra y venta de palos y madera en general, está a su vez lo vende a carpinterías y a todo público, nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio de compra y venta de palos y madera. 

Nuestro socio valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The partner Wiliam belongs to the group "Las Amistosas" [The Friendly Group]. He is from the district of Urcos in the Quispicanchis province and the department of Cusco, located about an hour from the city fo Cusco. Wiliam is 53 years old, he lives with his three daughters, women at the ages of 25, 21 and 10 years old. He buys and sells sticks and wood for general use. He sells to carpenters and to the public, and he is seeking the loan to reinvest in his business to buy sticks and wood. Wiliam values the loan he will obtain through this method and he is committed to complete the repayments of the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He is seeking this loan to reinvest in his business of buying and selling sticks and wood

loans.name: Bisi

texts.en:
Bisi sells oranges wholesale to her customers. She buys her goods from traders who come from the village to sell in the city. She sometimes buys a lorry load of oranges to sell. She has been in the business for the past 16 years. She is very happy with the nature of her business because it gives her the opportunity to take care of her children's financial needs. 
She hopes for a loan of NGN80, 000 to purchase more oranges to sell to her numerous custumers and improve her profit.
Bisi is 58 years, married with 6 children. Her husband is an army officer and all of them live in Lagos.  She thanks all Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more oranges to sell.

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto J. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 60 years old. To make a living, Loreto owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Loreto has been engaged in his business for over 10 years already.

Loreto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Loreto has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Loreto is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Loreto from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa Y. is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Elsa is widowed and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling peanut brittle in the local community member. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Elsa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
44-year-old John R. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is married and has two children. His older child is now aged twenty. John's business is rice farming. He tills his own land where he plants and harvests rice crops. He also owns a sari-sari store that his wife runs. He has been farming for eleven years now and hopes to have a stable income for his family.

John joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. John has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. John is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and piglets. This will be the third loan taken out by John from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and piglets

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Mrs. Chhun K., age 42, is a local vegetable grower. As another source of family income, Chhun K.’s husband works as a vehicle trader and also works on the farm with her. He also goes to buy vehicles from people who live in rural areas and sells to other people to gain a profit. Chhun K. currently plants morning glory and cabbage, but it is difficult to irrigate her crop because her farm is located far from the water system. Therefore, she would like to ask for a loan to buy a machine that she will use to pump water for her crops. Chhun K. was busy at her farming work when the photo was taken so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy a machine that she will use to pump water for her crops.

loans.name: Oldemar

texts.es:
Oldemar H. Briseño   es un señor de 37    años de edad el  cual vive con su esposa y dos hijos   en una comunidad llamada Coquital  localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos y  naranja. 

Don Oldemar  y su familia siempre se han  dedicado a la ganadería de doble propósito aprovechando tanto la carne como la producción de leche.  Comenta que es muy buen negocio ya que la demanda es bastante grande alta en la comunidad, y hoy  sus productos se venden a buen precio en especial la Leche.

Actualmente don Oldemar    desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢618.000 (seiscientos dieciocho    mil colones), para comprar  2  vacas que ya conocen muy bien, ellas están aumentadas por lo que podrá sacar provecho para vender su leche a buen precio.

El forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Rapicrédito Progreso Futuro Coquital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su  primer crédito  y con  espera  mejorar su negocio cada día.
texts.en:
Oldemar H. Briseño is a 37 year-old man who lives with his wife and 2 children in a community called Coquital, which is located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela province. This community is in a mountainous area very close to the northern border of the country. The main economic activities here are livestock and agriculture, particularly the cultivation of staple grains and oranges. Oldemar and his family have always worked in livestock production, with the dual objective of producing meat and milk. He comments that it is a very good business, since the demand is sufficiently high in his community, and today his products sell at a good price, particularly the milk. Now Oldemar wants to take out a micro-loan of 618,000 Costa Rican colones, to buy 2 cows that he knows well. These cows are pregnant, and this will allow him to profit by selling their milk at a good price. Oldemar is part of the communal bank "Rapicrédito Progreso Futuro Coquital," one of the 100 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan, and with it he hopes to improve his business every day.
