Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
El señor Richard S. tiene 22 años se encuentra casado con la señora María del Carmen Almanza no cuentan con hijos, viven por la zona de Montenegro, a 23 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  una zona rural de la provincia Quillacollo del departamento de Cochabamba.

El señor Richard S. trabaja en su propia empresa como productor de material de construcción (yeso), y su esposa aun estudia y colabora en la comercialización de su producto, ambos esposos son personas muy dedicadas al trabajo. El Sr. S. se levanta muy temprano para el inicio de sus actividades durante el día, el horno para el quemado de la piedra caliza de la cual se extrae el material de construcción (yeso), lo tiene instalado en casa de sus señores padres, tiene ingresos mensuales que le permiten costear los gastos de alimentación y estudio. El Sr. Richard tiene las apiraciones de poder comprar su propia casa, o un terreno propio, por esa razon se esfuerza tanto.

El Sr. Richard S. solicita el presente crédito para el incremento de materia prima (piedra caliza), de esta manera aumentar la producción y así mejorar sus ingresos y en el futuro poder adquirir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Richard is 22 years old and married to Maria del Carmen. They don't have any children and live in the Montenegro area, a rural area located 23km from Cochabamba in the Quillacollo Province of the Cochabamba department. Richard has his own business manufacturing construction material (plaster). His wife is still in school and helps him sell his product. Both spouses are very hard working people. Richard wakes up very early to start his daily activities. The oven in which he burns limestone to extract plaster is located in his parents' home. He has a monthly income which allows him to pay for his food and schooling. Richard aspires to buy his own home or a lot of land and this is why he works hard. Richard requests the loan to purchase more raw materials (limestone) to increase his production and his income so that he can buy his house in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Julia Balbina

texts.es:
La Señora. Julia Balvina A. es socia del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre  en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es conocida por su la belleza natural, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, los jóvenes salen a la ciudad en busca de un mejores oportunidadades de trabajo y muchos han migrado a diferentes partes del mundo para mejorar la economía de sus hogares.

Doña Julia tiene 61 años, es divorciada hace 25 años y tiene 3 hijos, todos son mayores de edad y casados; Doña Julia vive en compania de 12 nietos, 6 son de una hija que vive fuera del país y los 6 son de otra hija quien vive en su casa, gracias a su sacrificio y trabajo diario ha logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora Julia para mejorar la economía de su hogar se dedica a la cría de pollos, es negociante de chanchos y también se dedica a la venta de hortalizas y granos tiernos los días miércoles y sábados en la feria libre.

Es nuestra socia hace ocho años y medio,  los créditos le han beneficiado mucho en su negocio, el nuevo crédito que realiza en la fundación lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos y también en víveres para reiniciar con su tienda la que ha cerrado por falta de capital,  su meta es sacar adelante su tienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia Balvina A. is a member of the Los Talvos communal bank. She lives in a community of the same name located in Valle parish, a parish knows for its natural beauty. Its residents are mostly farmers and cattlemen. The young people leave and go to the city in search of better employment opportunities. Many have emigrated to various parts of the world looking for better economic conditions for their homes. Julia, 61, was divorced 25 years ago. She has three adult, married children. She lives with 12 of her grandchildren six of whom are children of one of her daughter who lives abroad and six of another daughter who also lives with her. Thanks to her sacrifice and daily work she has managed to build her own house. To improve her home’s economy she raises chickens. She also is a pig merchant. On Wednesdays and Saturdays she sells vegetables and tender grains in the farmer’s market. She has been our partner for eight and a half years. The loans have been of great use to her business. The new loan she is negotiating with the Fundación will be used to buy pigs and groceries in order to reopen her store that has been closed due to lack of capital. Her goal is for her store to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and groceries.

loans.name: God Will Provide Group

texts.en:
Korto F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Will Provide.  She is 28 years old, married, and has three children whose ages are between two weeks and ten years. She was only able to attend school through tenth grade due to a lack of financial support. 

For three years, she has been selling cold water and soft drinks in “Red Light Market” on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 12,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 60,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more crates of soft drinks and sacks of water. 

She describes herself as a determined woman whose dream is to improve her business and to continue to pursue her education so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and sacks of water for sale

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo F. is from the village of Caraniogan. He is 47 years old. Edgardo is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Edgardo owns and operates a business venture in the transportation sector, providing motorcycle transport services. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Edgardo has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Edgardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edgardo is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair the vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edgardo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair the vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Ашуров Рустам житель города Турсунзаде. Возраст, 51 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование высшее, фермер. По профессии работает уже 20 лет. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот у себя дома. В этом ему помогает жена. Кредит берет для закупа бычка и дойной коровы.
texts.en: Rustam A. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  He is 51 years old, married and has 4 children.  He has a higher education, as a farmer.  He has been working in his field for 20 years.  Besides that, he is involved in animal husbandry.  Rustam breeds livestock at home.  His wife helps him with this business.  He is requesting this loan in order to purchase a bull and a dairy cow.

loans.use: Purchase of a bull and a dairy cow

loans.name: Salina Jeruto

texts.en:
Salina is a 49 year old mother of five who is happily married to Paul G.. She runs a retail shop in the town center that has been in operation for 18 years. 

Salina got to know about KADET through an existing client who is a member of her group. This is her second loan and she plans to buy additional stock for her store to ensure consistent supply to her customers. Since her business is located at the center of town she has a good number of customers who are happy with her services.

Salina’s future plan is to ensure that her business is stable so that she can use her profits to educate all her children and have a car to use for transport.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es: La señora Imelda A. A., tiene la edad de 53 años es madre soltera habitante del Barrio Laureles Norte, tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad que trabajan y sobreviven bajo sus propios esfuerzos, ella se dedica a cuidar a una señora de edad desde hace 3 años, tiempo atrás laboraba como domestica, pero a raíz del padecimiento de la dueña de la casa comenzó a ayudarle en su enfermedad. Ella habita en una humilde casa y es para su hogar que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar la infraestructura de un cuarto en el patio de su hogar,  con la compra de materiales de cosntruccion, para la edificacion de una pared que la proteja, es para ella una necesidad el terminar de edificar su hogar, puesto que habita en un espacio bastante humilde con limitaciones que afectan su diario vivir, y el de su familia.
texts.en: Mrs Imelda A. A. is 53 years old.  She is a single mother and lives in Laureles Norte neighborhood.  She has 4 grown-up children who work and support themselves.  She has been working looking after an elderly lady for 3 years.  She used to work as a domestic but as a result of the suffering of the lady of the house, she began to help her in her illness.  She lives in a humble house and it is for her house that she is requesting this loan.  She would like to buy building materials to improve the infrastructure of a room in the open space outside her house by building a wall which will protect her.  It is necessary for her to finish building her house since she lives in quite a humble space with limitations which affect her daily life and that of her family.

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena L. is a married woman who lives in Purok Santol, Brgy. Paraiso, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She operates two (2) business ventures:  a general store and a fish vending business. Her husband, Julius L., who is 33 years old, works as a driver and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 2 children aged 8 and 9. 

Rowena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rowena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,200, lifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000, which she intends to use to buy stock for her store and fish to sell. She can then continue to save for the future expansion of her business. Rowena L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid tiene 25 años, es una joven muy trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres, junto con sus  2 hermanos menores. Por ser la mayor de los hermanos, se siente en la responsabilidad de atender a sus hermanos, que por el momento se encuentran desempleados. Es por ello, que por las mañanas trabaja como profesora en un colegio y por la tarde se desempeña de cajera en un mega mercado, a una hora de su casa. Gracias a este trabajo, pudo comprarse un motocarro, vehículo que su hermano lo utiliza para ofrecer el servicio de transporte público, desde entonces le va muy bien. Ahora los dos pactaron en ayudar al último de los hermanos, y le han propuesto un trabajo, vendiendo ropa. En adelante piensa sacar su titulo de profesora. Es su segundo crédito con MFP y sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para emprender nuevos horizontes en el negocio, por lo que se compromete a pagar todas las cuotas a tiempo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará prenda de vestir casual, para que su hermano se dedique en la venta.
texts.en:
Ingrid, 25, is a hard working young woman.  She lives with her parents and two younger brothers.  Because she’s the oldest she feels responsible for taking care of them; they are currently unemployed.

Because of this she works as a Teacher in a school during the mornings and in the afternoons she’s employed as a Cashier at a supermarket an hour away from home.

Thanks to the work she was able to buy herself a moto car, a vehicle that her brother uses to provide public transportation services.  Since then he does quite well.

Now the two of them have made a pact to help the remaining brother and they proposed a job for him: selling clothes.

She hopes to get a Teaching degree in the future. 

This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she knows that the contribution will be very beneficial to open up new business horizons so she pledges to repay on time.

She will use the requested loan to buy casual clothes that her brother can work at selling.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Juana Virginia

texts.es:
Doña Juana, tiene 56 años de edad, posee una tienda de artículos de primera necesidad, reside en Puerto el Triunfo departamento de Usulután, tiene casa propia y vive con su esposo; este negocio lo inicio hace 17 años  siendo una pequeña tienda pero que poco a poco fue aumentando.
Ella quiere invertir al negocio y para esto solicita un préstamo para comprar artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, pollo y detergentes, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar su inventario y ofrecer a los clientes lo necesario para el hogar.
El objetivo de doña Juana es cancelar el préstamo puntualmente y tener un negocio prospero que garantice ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Juana is 56 years old.  She owns a store where she sells household essentials.  She lives in her own home, with her husband, in Puerto el Triunfo, in Usulután department.  Juana started this business 17 years ago.  Back then it was a small store but she has gradually made it bigger and bigger.

Juana would like to invest in her business and for this reason she is requesting a loan to buy essentials such as rice, sugar, beans, chicken and detergents.  This loan will help her to improve her inventory and offer her clients the basics they need for their homes.  Juana's goal is to pay this loan off punctually and to have a prosperous business that guarantees income for her household.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, beans, chicken and detergents

loans.name: Doris Emilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANDENES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Doris Emilia; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de venta de artesanía, ella vende en forma ambulatoria e independiente en las calles de la ciudad de Urubamba, ella vende diferentes artesanías como chompas, collares, aretes y mantas, la socia quiere tener una tienda de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor.         

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Los Andenes” which is located in the District of Cuzco, in the Province and Department of Cuzco.

The member’s name is Doris Emilia; she is 42 years old and is married with 2 children. The member works selling handicrafts as an independent street vendor in the streets of the City of Urubamba; she sells various handcrafts such as sweaters, necklaces, earrings, and blankets. The member would like to open a handicraft store.

The member requests this loan to purchase wholesale handicrafts.

The member is happy to receive this loan, and commits to making her loan payments.

loans.use: The member requests this loan to purchase wholesale handicrafts.

loans.name: Ramona De La Concepcion

texts.es: Ramona de la Concepción se dedica a venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 22 años, que tiene este negocio. Por iniciativa propia fue que inicio este medio de vida. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamiento pues ha sido muy productivo. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de calzado, ropa, cosméticos entre otros productos y así decide dedicarse a este negocio. Ella es una persona muy dinámica que siempre está la pendiente de lo que sus clientes le piden y así poder complacerlos y satisfacer la demanda.
texts.en: Ramona de la Concepción operates a business selling general merchandise.  She has owned the business for more than 22 years, a business she started on her own initiative.  This isn't her first loan and past loans have helped her become more productive.  She will use this loan to buy footwear, clothing, and cosmetics, among other products.  Ramona is a very dynamc person who always has an eye out for what her customers might order so that she can be in a position to meet demand.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen C. is a married woman who lives in Carmen, Cebu. Her husband, Policarpio, who is 45 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 5 and 11 years old.

Carmen earns her living by operating two business ventures: ready-to-wear clothes sales and a rice business. 

Carmen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Carmen has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, with which she intends to purchase ready-to-wear products to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future improvement of her business. 

Carmen is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase cloth, thread, etc.

loans.name: Mudusu

texts.en:
Mudusu N. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Mudusu  has a retail shop which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Mudusu has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mudusu hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for the family.  In the future, Mudusu hopes to live a good life.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: For the past six years, Afia B. has been sewing for people. She is married and currently taking care of two children. She has been through junior high school. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband to take care of the home. A loan from kiva will help to buy more sewing materials to sew to attract customers. Her business objective is to open a boutique where she can display some of the things she sews.

loans.use: A loan from kiva will help to buy more sewing materials to sew to attract customers.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
Luciana nació en la comunidad de Vallecito Suaray de la ciudad de Anta, ella tiene 42 años de edad y vive en la la misma comunidad donde nació, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos. 

Luciana se dedica a la venta de verduras, ella lleva sus productos a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado dos veces a la semana donde distribuye a las revendedoras de diferentes mercados de esa ciudad, ella también se dedica a la venta de madera y la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y otros animales. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracia al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Luciana requiere el microcrédito para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo cebollas, papa, repollo y otras cosas más. 

Luciana es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco se encuentra ubicada la ciudadela de los Incas de Machupicchu, Perú. La palabra “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” proviene de la lengua Quechua que traducido al Castellano significa “Mujeres que Trabajamos”.
texts.en:
Luciana was born in the community of Vallecito Suaray in the city of Anta. She is 42 years old and lives in the same community where she was born. She is married and has four children from this marriage.

Luciana sells vegetables. Twice a week, she brings her products to the city of Puerto Maldonado, where she distributes them to resellers at different markets in that city. She also sells wood and raises young animals like guinea pigs and other animals. She has been doing this work for several years and it is going very well thanks to the commitment she puts into her work. At this time, Luciana needs a microloan to buy more merchandise, such as onions, potatoes, cabbage, and more.

Luciana is a responsible person who belongs to Asociación Arariwa's “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru. Cusco is where you will find the Inca citadel of Machu Picchu, Peru. The name “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” comes from the Quechua language and translates into Spanish as “Mujeres que Trabajamos" ["Women who Work"].

loans.use: to buy merchandise like onions, potatoes, cabbage, and more

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
To make a living, Erlinda is engaged in selling "tuba" a native wine in her local community. She has been operating her business for more than 30 years, earning a monthly net income of Php 2500. Erlinda lives in Napilan, Sapang Dalaga together with her husband. Her six adult children already have their own families and live independently. 

In 2006, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php 14,900. She is requesting a new loan of Php 17,000 as her 7th loan which will be used for house repair.

 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to cover house repair costs

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en: Samoeun M. is 27 years old, married, and has two children. They live in a suburb approximately 25 kilometers outside of Phnom Penh. Samoeun stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband’s salary. He has full-time employment in Phnom Penh.  Samoeun hopes to run beauty salon. She is requesting a loan for $1,000 to build a beauty salon.

loans.use: To build a beauty salon.

loans.name: Marina Natividad

texts.es:
Doña Marina Natividad, es casada, tiene 32 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educacion primaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la confección de tejidos, especificamente a la confeccion de delantales típicos, lleva 10 años de experiencia en este trabajo, inició siendo operaria y ahora hace sus propios trabajos en la casa, cuenta con el apoyo economico de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería.

Decide acercarse a ASDIR para solictar un prestamos que le servirá para compra de telas tipicas y adornos, para que esta forma pueda seguir con el trabajo que realiza actualmente. Espera ver su negocio superado y con mejores ganancias
texts.en:
Marina Natividad is married and 32 years old.  She completed 6 years of primary education.  She has 3 children who are in school.  She makes fabric items, specifically, traditional aprons.  She has been doing this for 10 years.  She began as a machine operator, and now she does her own work at home.  She counts on the financial support of her husband, who is a bricklayer.  

She decided to approach ASDIR to ask for a loan that will help her buy typical cloth and decorations, so that she can continue with the work she is doing now.  She hopes to see her business succeed and bring in better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and decorations

loans.name: Solangel

texts.es: Solangel vive con su hija de 24 años  en la capital de Colombia, Bogotá y desde allí trabaja con jóvenes especiales en el aprendizaje de manualidades, la venta de artículos en papel ecológico y teniendo en cuenta las solicitudes de las madres de estos, últimamente  introdujo refrigerios, además de generar otros ingresos por la venta de productos  cosméticos, accesorios y otras mercancías, mediante guías especializadas. Solangel está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace 7 años, a través de financiamientos; de la mano de esta organización ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo, aprender a evaluar las oportunidades comerciales para tomar las mejores y oportunas decisiones; su sueño más adelante es tener un local y organizar su página web,  para hacer su  oferta de servicios virtual  y dar a conocer sus productos artesanales, por un medio masivo como el internet. Con su credikiva que es su sexto financiamiento  comprará materías primas, porque tiene encargos de batolas en tela de toallas y de tarjetería en general, igualmente invertirá en refrigerios como gaseosas ye insumos para la preparación de refrigerios como embutidos, crispetas, plátano verde etc. Su mayor desafío es la fluctuación de precios que se le presenta y la disminución del poder adquisitivo de sus clientes, razón por la cual debe estar atenta a la oferta que hace y sobre todo buscando proveedores que le ofrezcan precios especiales por volumen de compra, para poder disminuir el costo de producción y vender sus productos a precios que los clientes puedan comprar.
texts.en:
Solangel lives with her daughter, aged 24, in the capital of Colombia, Bogota. She works with young special-needs children, teaching manual skills, and selling articles made of ecological paper, and taking into account the requests of their mothers, finally, she produces cold snacks and generates other income from selling cosmetic products, accessories, and other merchandise from special catalogs.

Solangel has received loans through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo for some 7 years. Through this organization, she has been able to increase her working capital, learn to evaluate commercial opportunities, and to make the most opportune decisions. Her dream for the future is to have her own stand and organize a web page, offering her services virtually, and to make known her artisan products in a massive medium like the internet.

With this Kiva loan, which is her 6th, she will buy primary materials to fulfill her orders for decorated towels and for cards generally, and to buy cold snacks like soft drinks, and supplies for preparing snacks like sausages, popcorn, green plantains, etc. 

Solangel's biggest challenge is the fluctuation of prices and her customers' diminishing buying power. That's why she has to remain attentive to the prices she charges and, above all, to seek out providers who offer special prices for volume purchases, to be able to diminish costs of production, and sell her products at prices her customers can afford.

loans.use: to buy primary materials to use fulfilling orders for designs on towel cloth and other items, and to invest in cold snacks like soft drinks and supplies for preparing snacks like sausages, popcorn, and green plantain to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a decorations business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her decorations to sell for her arts business.

Ma. Elena has been in this business for three years. Ma. Elena earns more income from trisikad (three-wheeled) transport.

Ma. Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her decorations.

loans.name: Tusitukire Wamu Womens Group Buikwe

texts.en:
Rehema, 38, has been a retail business woman for the past decade in Lugazi. The happily married mother of six says she was encouraged into this business by her husband, who was in business himself. 

At her shop, she sells a variety of commodities such as rice, beans, millet, soap, cooking oil, etc. Previously she was a hawker. 

She says this business generates profits to the tune of  200,000 UGX monthly. With this Kiva loan, she says she is going to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar, bread, plastics, etc., to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.name: Tegemeo Group

texts.en:
Saleh, who is in his mid-30s, is married with 4 children who are still going to school.  He has been selling bread for 8 years now.  He works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to sell different types of bread, and he has paid back his loan successfully.  He hopes for a loan to buy a permanent place for his business (he is tired of renting). His dream is to own a bakery one day. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "Tegemeo", which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy a permanent place for his business.

loans.name: Nouen

texts.en:
Nouen, 56 years old, is a basket maker. She has been selling baskets for about five years now, and she can make good income to support the family, but now she is getting old and she wants to buy grocery goods to sell at her house instead of making baskets to sell.
 
Her husband is a security guard. Their income is $3 per day. 

She has three children. Two are studying. 

Every month she has to spend around $80 for all the expenses of the family. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a motorbike for her children to use when traveling to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to use for traveling to work.

loans.name: Arturo David

texts.es:
Arturo es un hombre de 36 años nacido en "El empalme" una parroquia perteneciente a la Región costa del Ecuador. Actualmente vive en la parroquia "Río Verde" en la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas junto a su esposa Lourdes y sus tres hijos de 9, 7 y 5 años. El menor de sus hijos sufre de una enfermedad congénita la cual no permite que sus órganos se desarrollen, esto ha golpeado duramente a toda la familia, a nivel económico y emocional.

Hace 3 años Arturo inició su negocio de venta de comida. El tiene su propio carrito y se ubica en una popular calle del barrio donde reside para vender sus productos. El vende "corviches", "emborrajados" y "plátanos maduros con queso", bocadillos típicos de esta zona. Este oficio lo aprendió de su madre quien se dedica a la misma actividad. Él desea hacer reparaciones a su casa y comprar comida para venderla en su carrito, para ello solicitó a Fundación Alternativa un crédito el cual le permitirá mejorar su vida.

Trabaja 10 horas al día, todo por el bienestar de su familia, pero su gran sueño es que su hijo menor se cure.
texts.en:
Arturo is a 36-year-old gentleman who was born in El Empalme parish, which is located in the coastal region of Ecuador.  He currently lives in Río Verde parish in the province of Santo Domingo de Los Tsáchilas with his wife Lourdes and their three children (ages 9, 7, and 5).  His youngest child suffers from a congenital disease that prevented his organs from developing properly.  This situation has taken its toll on the entire family, both financially and emotionally.  

Three years ago, Arturo started a business selling food.  He has his own cart that he parks along a popular street in the neighborhood where he sells his products.  Arturo sells fish fritters, fried pastries, and ripe plantains with cheese.  All of these are traditional snacks of the region.  Arturo learned this trade from his mother, who also engaged in the same line of work.  

He hopes to make repairs to his house and buy food to sell from his cart.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan Fundación Alternativa in order to improve his life.  Arturo works 10 hours a day so that he can provide for the welfare of his family, but his greatest wish is to see his young son cured.

loans.use: to buy food to sell from his cart and to make repairs to his house.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a mother of a 10 year old and has been farming in her matrimonial home of Kitale which is located in Western Kenya.  She is 34 years old and her farm produces milk which she sells to Kenya Co-operative Creameries.  Her farm also produces eggs and poultry birds which go to the local market.

Florence has made a loan request of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, and this is her second loan request with them.  She says she will use the loan to buy more poultry chicks and expand her poultry unit so that it will house more birds.  This will build a good foundation for better business.  It will help her to have a continual cash flow for improved management of her businesses.

She laments the stiff competition and airborne diseases as these are the major challenges in farming, especially of poultry.

loans.use: To purchase poultry chicks and expand her poultry unit

loans.name: Maria Irma

texts.es:
María, administra un comedor, vive con un hijo D. 31 años, estudia y depenD. D. ella, prendió desD. joven en la venta D. comida, luego decidió instalar su negocio completo, lo atienD. desD. las 6:30 am hasta las 5:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. aceite, condimentos, arroz, frijoles, pollo, utensilios D. cocina, todo para el comedor, con la compra espera tener mayor capacidad para atender a la clientela.
La aspiración D. ella es ayudar a su hijo y verlo graduado D. médico, ya que  será un triunfo tanto para ella como para su joven hijo.
texts.en:
María runs an eatery.  She lives with her 31-year-old son who is studying and depends on her.  She learned food sales while still young and then decided to set up a full-service business.  She’s open from 6:30am until 5pm.

At present, she’s asking for a loan to buy oil, condiments, rice, beans, chicken and kitchen utensils for the eatery.  She hopes with this purchase to be able to have the capacity to take care of an increased number of customers.  Her hope is to help her son and to see him graduate as a doctor since that would mean a triumph both for her and for her young son.

loans.use: to buy oil, condiments, rice, beans and chicken for the eatery.

loans.name: Salem

texts.en:
Salem is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and lives with his wife and three children.

Salem has been an owner of a food market since 2008, selling meat, fish, soft drinks, juices, and cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is located in an area where they are in need for foodstuffs. He has a good reputation and is well known in his surroundings.

He decided to apply for $2100 loan in order to make an outdoor ceiling and two showcases for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make an outdoor ceiling and two showcases for his market

loans.name: Anait

texts.ru:
Анаит 30 лет, она проживает в городе Иджеване (Ijevan) со своим мужем, двумя детьми и родителями мужа. Дочь Анаит учится в школе, сыну 5 лет, а муж и свекор работают водителями. 
Анаит работает в городской администрации, а после работы дома шьет занавески на заказ. Свекровь Анаит помигает ей с шитьем и вместе они выполняют не только заказы частных лиц, но и заказы небольших гостиниц и ресторанов. Анаит говорит, что у них всегда очень много заказов и очень часто они работают до поздней ночи. Благодаря бизнесу Анаит и ее свекровь обеспечивают основные потребности своей семьи, так как зарплаты водителя недостаточно для содержания семьи. 
Анаит необходим кредит на сумму 850.000 драм для покупки материала и разнообразных аксессуаров для выполнения своих заказов.
texts.en: Anait is 30 years old.  She lives in the town of Ijevan together with her husband, two children and her parents-in-law.  Anait's daughter attends a school, her son is 5 years old, and her husband and father-in-law work as drivers.  Anait works at the town administrative office and makes window drapes to-order at home after work.  Her mother-in-law helps her with the sewing, and together they fill not only individual orders, but orders from small hotels and restaurants.  Anait says that they always have many orders, and they often work nights.  Thanks to this business, Anait and her mother-in-law are able to provide for the family's basic needs because a driver's salary is not enough to support the family.  Anait needs a loan in the sum of 850,000 dram for the purchase of materials and various accessories for filling her orders.

loans.use: to buy materials and various accessories for her business

loans.name: Tein

texts.en: Tein, 59 years old, is a fortune teller who earns $2.5 per day. She is a single mother living with one daughter and three grandsons, two of whom are studying and one who is too young to be in school. Her daughter is working at the factory earning $2.6 per day. Every month, Tein has to spend $50 on food, $6 on electricity and $10 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $500 for her daughter to buy cosmetic products to sell in front of her house when she rests from work. Tein doesn’t wants to change her career but she wants to help her daughter to have a better cosmetic shop so that she can attract customers.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alicia; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche,fideos y detergentes, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia quiere terminar de construir su casa y también quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como yeso y arena para terminar de hacer el piso de su casa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alicia belongs to the SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, a part of the province and department of Cusco.

Alicia is 32 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery shop business. She sells staples such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and detergents. Alicia works from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. Working this way she hopes to enlarge her grocery shop.

Alicia wants to finish the construction of her house and also enlarge her shop. She is applying for the loan in order to purchase construction materials such as plaster and sand in order to finish building another floor on her house. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as plaster and sand in order to finish building another floor on her house.

loans.name: Wafa'a

texts.en:
Wafa'a is a 23-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Wafa'a is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

Wafa'a is looking to improve her business and open a shop for selling clothes.

Due to culturA. issues, the man in the photo is Wafa'a husband.

loans.use: to puchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Rasmieh

texts.en:
Rasmieh is a 49-year-old married woman from Idon, Irbid, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Rasmieh is selling clothes and blankets from her home. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase clothes and blankets for trading purposes.

Rasmieh is looking to increase her family's living income.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and blankets to sell

loans.name: Anhzaya

texts.en:
Anhzaya is 23 years old and lives with her parents in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her father is disabled and her mother is unemployed. 

Anhzaya started her beauty salon business in 2007 by completing her training that same year. She has one employee. She has many customers; however, she is starting to lose customers due to powerful competitors. She needs to act aggressively in order to run her business succesfully. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I am the only one in the family with an income, and if I lose my business I won't be able to forgive myself."

She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy equipment for her salon.

loans.use: to buy equipment.

loans.name: Sylvestre

texts.en:
Sylvestre is 24 years old and married. He has two children between the ages two and three years old. Sylvestre owns a business selling shoes. His business is well organized. The hours of this business are from 7 am until 6 pm every day and he has three years of experience. 

Sylvestre has requested a loan from Kiva lender, via Vision Finance Company, in order to increase his business by buying more shoes to sell. With this profits, he will be able to build a house for his business and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Daniel Marcos

texts.es: El Sr. Daniel, se dedica al servicio de fotocopias,  vive en casa familiar, de los papás del Sr. Daniel, no tienen hijos, y tienen su fotocopiadora cerca de una universidad, comparten ambientes con el centro de estudiantes de Sociología.  El crédito es para la compra de una  fotocopiadora ya que habiendo gran demanda de estudiantes que necesitan realizar fotocopias y ampliaciones, esta fotocopiadora le permitirá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, el Sr. Daniel es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por el apoyo brindado, ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia, es emprendedor desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Daniel has a photocopying business.  He lives in a house belonging to family members (his parents' house).  Daniel does not have any children.  He has his photocopying business in a location near a university.  He has his business in a location shared with students of sociology.  Daniel will use his loan to buy a photocopier as he has a great demand from students who need to make photocopies and enlargements.  This photocopier will allow him to provide his customers with a better service.  Daniel is a very hard-working person and feels happy with the support he is being given.  This is his only source of income for supporting his family.  He is an entrepreneur and would like to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a computer and spare parts for his photocopier

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María de 43 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de alegre y sociable, está casada con Remigio quien es maestro de obras, vive en compañía de su esposo, sus hijos de 19 y 12 años de edad, habitando cómodamente su propia casa. El negocio que tiene María es el alquiler de habitaciones, los cuales ha habilitado en su propia casa, iniciándose con un total de 04 habitaciones hace 03 años con un préstamo de MFP, ya que viendo la necesidad económica y por idea de su esposo decidieron iniciarse en su negocio dedicándose ella sola al cuidado y cobranza de sus inquilinos. Le gusta su negocio ya que no le ocupa mucho tiempo y lo restante que lo puede emplear en otras actividades además que viendo la demanda que tiene sus habitaciones por los jóvenes estudiantes y personas solteras comenta que siempre paran ocupadas y tiene un ingreso constante de dinero. Viendo ésta demanda, tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y construir al menos 03 habitaciones adicionales para así tener más ingresos económicos y pasar necesidades en su ancianidad. Este será el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de madera y listones para habilitar por lo menos unas 03 habitaciones adicionales.
texts.en: Maria, 43, is a hard-working and earnest woman, in addition to being happy and sociable. She is married to Remigio who is a master builder. She lives in the company of her husband and their 19 and 12 year old children living comfortably in their own house. Maria's business is renting out rooms, which she has built in her own house, starting with a total of 4 rooms three years ago with a loan from MFP. They saw the economic need and, based on an idea of her husband's, they decided to start their business with only her dedicated to the care and collection of the rent. She likes her business since it doesn't take up too much time and the rest she can use for other activities as well as for the demand her rooms have by young students and single people so they are always occupied and she has a constant stream of income. Seeing this demand, she has plans to expand her business and build at least 3 additional rooms so she can earn more and maintain her spending needs for her old age. This will be her tenth loan with the MFP institution and she hope to continue with her objectives with this collaboration. She also notes that she feels good with her community bank since she considers the members to be good people. With the loan requested of 1500 new "soles" she will invest in the purchase of wood and strips to build at least 3 additional rooms.

loans.use: to purchase wood and strips of wood for the building of more rooms.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo ya que en la actualidad no tiene la suficiente solvencia económica para surtir al negocio, ella comprará insumos para la panadería como harina, aceite, manteca, azúcar, levadura, latas para hacer pan y clavijero, espera que esta nueva compra le ayude a mantener su negocio con un buen nivel de producción.
Ella considera haber tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, ya que la buena administración le permite haber mejorado su condición de vida y realizarle una mejora a su vivienda.
texts.en: Susana has decided on a new loan because she currently lacks economic solvency to stock her business.  She will buy bakery ingredients and supplies like flour, oil, shortening, yeast, bread pans and racks.  She hopes this new purchase will help her keep her business with a good production level.  She believes that she had a positive result with the previous loan because her good management of it helped her improve her living condition and to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy bakery ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Renovación Group

texts.es:
El grupo renovación lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas Jenny quien se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace 8 años. Esta señora de 52 años es casada y tiene dos hijos de 14 y 8 años por los cuales trabaja arduamente. Ella el crédito anterior pudo invertir en la temporada navideña.

Las otras integrantes son Leyla Janeth de 30 años quien vende ropa y cosméticos desde hace 1 ½ año y Martha Rosa quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Renovación" is comprised of three hard-working women.  One of them is Jenny who has been selling clothing for eight years.  She is 52, married and has two children, ages 14 and 8, for whom she works very hard.  She used her previous loan to invest in goods for the Christmas season.

The other two members are Leyla Janeth, 30, who has been selling clothing and cosmetics for a year and a half, and Martha Rosa who has been in the grocery store business for two years.

loans.use: To sell clothing.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Djiguiya est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Darsalam II de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 47 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 1 enfant.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les céréales, du poisson, de la mangue, des condiments alimentaires  et du savon. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur dixième et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Aïchata est le membre du groupe en shale rouge, qui fait la fabrication de savon.   
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de l’huile, du bois de chauffe et de la potasse, des ingrédients indispensables pour faire du savon traditionnels pouvant être utilisé pour la lessive et pour la toilette.  Elle se procure de ces produits au marché de Koutiala. Elle vend son savon en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse et variée, elle est très sollicitée et appréciée à Koutiala et environs. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djiguiya comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 55 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Aïchata   compte réaliser  65 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter leurs fond de commerce.

loans.use: Achat  d’ingrédients pour fabriquer le savon traditionnel

loans.name: Benkelema   1 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BENKELEMA 1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  38 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KALAKAN, commune de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz, l’arachide et le mais avec SOUKOURADIE la 2ème personne sur la photo de la gauche à la droite position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 4,5 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 270 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et frais de labours pour la campagne agricole.

loans.name: Nada's Group

texts.en: Nada and Husam a young couple, Nada is 26 years old, and Hussam is 29 years old. Hussam is working in decoration for ‎houses; and Nada is a housewife, but because of the high standards of living she started her own business which is selling ‎winter clothes and blankets to help Hussam in the household expenses. Then Hussam decided to help Nada because he ‎believed in her business, so to improve their business and to buy more products to sell they applied for a group loan to buy ‎more blankets and clothes to sell and increase their incomes.                     ‎

loans.use: to buy ‎more blankets and clothes to sell and increase their incomes.                     ‎

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her grain business and start farming

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth M. is married and has 2 sons, ages 9 and 11. Her husband, Anselmo, is a bricklayer in Monterrey in Nuevo León state, where both come from. Ruth took a course offered by one of the government's programs, and she was granted a scholarship. With the knowledge she obtained, she started to make and sell tamales, tacos and home-made food a year ago. She sells her products to the stores that are near her house.

There has been an increase in her number of clients and they have started to ask for more variety, thus Ruth needs a $200 loan. She will repay it within 3 to 6 months. Now is the moment to help, you can contribute to this family's growth! Ruth is sincerely grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Ruth M. es casada y tiene dos hijos de 9 y 11 años, su esposo Anselmo es albañil en la ciudad de Monterrey, en el estado de Nuevo León de donde ambos son originarios. Ruth tomó un curso en uno de los programas que realiza el gobierno del Estado, donde le otorgaron una beca, con estos conocimientos ella inició con la elaboración y venta de tamales, tacos y comidas caseras, desde hace un año, ofreciendo sus comidas en los negocios que se ubican cerca de su casa.

Ahora sus clientes se han incrementado y le han pedido más variedad en sus alimentos, para lo que Ruth requiere de un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que utilizará con este fin, ella se compromete a retornar esta cantidad en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Ahora es momento de ayudar, tú puedes colaborar a mejorar la vida de esta familia, Ruth agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Compra de insumos

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
My name is Maria N. and I am dedicated to the sale of vegetables, and have been working in this kind of business for the past 3 years. My clients are very good since I am located in the market in the center of our community. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to have greater sales and with the earnings that I obtain I would be able to provide better food for my family and cover the costs in my home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maria N. me dedico a la venta de verduras actividad que realizo desde hace 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicada en el mercado del centro de nuestra comunidad, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y cubrir con los gastos de mi hogar

loans.use: purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is one of the wives of Anye Samuel and has four children. As a maid to other wives, she has faced problems of misunderstanding with her maids with the husband always showing favor to the younger maids. Also with the little commitment of her husband towards her and her children, she was forced to fend for them. In her search for a capital to start a business she was motivated by other GHAPE members to join them. She became a member and has been able to pay school fees for her children and feed them with the profit made.

loans.use: Rachel would like to purchase a motor bike, documents to raise money to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Khalig

texts.en: Khalig is 43 years old and lives in Gardili village, in the Salyan region. He is married and has two children. Khalig breeds calves. He supports his family with this business. Now he needs a loan of $950 to buy baling presses. He wants to improve his business and income. He has run this business for 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase baling presses

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria lives with her son in a rental at 1422 Feliciano Kantuta Avenue in Ciudad de la Paz. Her job is the preparation of food that is sold in a booth at the Uruguary market. She is part of those clients that have requested loans from Kiva in the past. Her previous loan was paid off in it's entirety. She is now requesting a new loan to buy prime materials that she uses in her business and to continue increasing her capital. Because of her prior loan, Ana Maria is able to have access to a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Ana Maria vive en alquiler con su hijo, en la Av. Feliciano Kantuta Nº 1422 de la Ciudad de La Paz; ella se dedica a la elaboración de comida la cual vende en un puesto dentro el mercado Uruguay. Ella es parte de los clientes que solicitaron crédito vía Kiva; el crédito anterior ha sido cancelado en su totalidad. Ahora solicita uno nuevo para la compra de las materias primas que usa en su negocio y seguir aumentando su capital. Por su antecedente crediticio Ana Maria puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To purchase materials to produce food.

loans.name: Elmar

texts.en:
Mr. Elmar is 29 years old and married with one child.  He and his family live in the suburb of  Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.
Elmar has a shop and has been repairing cars since 1990. He has a number of clients and in order to retain these clients he wants to renovate his shop to make it more attractive and modern. He has applied for a loan of $500 for this purpose.

loans.use: For the renovation

loans.name: Mwantumu's Ngeta B Group

texts.en:
Mwantumu, age 35, is married with 2 children (9 and 4). She and her husband also take care of 2 other relatives. Mwantumu owns a small farm which she has had for 5 years now. She works there from 8am to 4pm daily and makes a monthly profit of about $135 from her crop sales.

In the past, she and her subgroup have received a loan and were able to repay it successfully. They now hope for a new loan to help their businesses. Zubeda and Mwamvita sell clothes for a living.

loans.use: To expand businesses

loans.name: Melahet

texts.en: Melahet B. operates a dairy product stand in the bazaar, located in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. She sells different kinds of cheeses as well as milk. Melahet has been working in this business for the last 5 years. She is married with three children and is currently looking for funding so she can expand and diversify her inventory.

loans.use: To expand and diversify her inventory

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama S. is a 38-year-old mother of 5 children. She has been the owner of a firewood operation for 8 years. In Ghana the price of cooking gas is high, and consequently firewood and charcoal are common cooking fuels. Her firewood is sourced from around Ghana and is sold to the local marketplace as fuel for food.

Ama is hoping that by expanding her inventory, she can increase her sales and her family's income. All 5 of her children are currently attending school, and she hopes her income can help support them throughout their educational years.

Ama is a member of the trust group called God Is One. The trust group works on the principle of peer pressure, where each member of the group exerts pressure on the other to pay her share of the group loan.

Ama is pictured in the white shirt, proudly holding some of her firewood.

loans.use: To further expand her inventory of firewood

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
In the beginning, Mariela had a very small scale business compared to today. Her stall was in a state of disrepair, covered with plastic and wood. Improvements have now been made to the stall and to her business. Mariela has six credits with the Fundación Leon 2000 institution.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Al inicio tenia el negocio en una escala muy baja comparado con la actualidad era un negocio pequeñito y el tramo en mal estado cerrado con plastico y madera, actualmente a realizado mejoras al tramo y a su negocio tiene seis creditos con nuestra institución.

loans.use: Purchase of products for daily use in the household

loans.name: Indalecia's Group

texts.es:
Teodosia, Candelaria and Indalecia are partners from the communal bank "Renacer."

Teodosia is a 57-year-old widow with one daughter. She runs a general store out of her house where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meat. She also sells meals in the evenings.

Candelaria is married, 52 years old, and has four children. She runs an Internet cafe, and also provides photocopy services and sells cookies. In the afternoon, she sells pan-fried sausage and potatoes (salchipapas) in the doorway of her home.

Indalicea is 63 years old and married, and has 11 children. Indalicia devotes herself to growing alfalfa in the lands around Ñahuimpuquio.

Teodosia, Candelaria and Indalicea need loans for $1100 total (1000 soles each), money which will be invested in purchasing rice, noodles, oil, soap, paper, soda, and cookies.

The women dream of stocking their businesses, improving their homes, and of their children growing up to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Teodosia, candelaria e Indalecia son socias del Banco Comunal Renacer.

Teodosia es viuda, tiene 57 años y 1 hija, Teodosia tiene una bodega en su casa donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, carme, además Teodosia venD. comida por las noches.

Por otro lado Candelaria es casada, tiene 52 años y 4 hijos, Candelaria tiene cabinas D. Internet, además hace servicio D. fotocopiado y venD. golosinas. También por las tardes venD. salchipapas en la puerta D. su casa.

Mientras que Indalicea es casada, tiene 63 años y 11 hijos, Indalicia se dedica a las agricultura D. alfalfa en sus terrenos D. Ñahuimpuquio.

Teodosia, candelaria e Indalicea necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, fideos, aceite, jabón, papeles, gaseosas, galletas.

Los sueños D. Teodosia, candelaria e Indalicea son surtir su negocio, hijos sean profesionales y construir su casa.

loans.use: Purchasing assorted goods to stock and supply their various businesses, including a general store, food services, a farm, and a photocopy provider.

loans.name: Thai Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thai Thi S., 36 years old, has 2 children who are still going to school. After the local manufacturing plant had been closed, she talked to her husband and borrowed money from the TYM Fund to buy machines and do the traditional activity of her area. In 2006, she joined the Fund and at first borrowed 200 USD to buy machines to make shovels, hoes…to sell to local people. She earned 400 USD as profit. With the help of developed technology, her business is going very well. This time, she wants to borrow 550 USD to buy more metal and cutting machines. Her average income is 225 USD/ month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Thái Thị S. năm nay 36 tuổi, gia đình chị có 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Trước đây tại địa bàn nơi chị ở có hợp tác xã cơ khí sau đó đã giải thể, vì thế chị đã bàn với chồng tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vay vốn để đầu tư vào mua máy móc tiếp tục làm nghề truyền thống của địa phương. Năm 2006 chị tham gia vào Quỹ và vay vòng vốn đầu tiên là 3.000.000đ, gia đình chị đã sử dụng mua máy móc đầu tư vào xưởng sản xuất các loại dụng cụ lao động như cuốc, xẻng…bán cho bà con nông dân thu được 6.000.000đ tiền lãi. Nhờ có tay nghề sẵn có và máy móc phục vụ cho việc sản xuất nên công việc làm ăn của vợ chồng chị ngày càng ổn định. Vòng vốn tiếp theo chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm sắt và mua máy cắt hàn phục vụ sản xuất nhằm tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: buy metals and cutting machine

loans.name: Félicité

texts.fr:
Born on July 10, 1972 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ms. Félicité V. is married and the mother of three. She sells basic provisions, namely pasta, beverages, milk, rice, etc. She also sells food and has a small phone center, too. She buys goods in Tokpa, and sometimes in Lomé in TOGO, then markets them in a shop located in her home in the Sènadé district. She is on her third loan with ALIDE and is one of the best recipients of our institution.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née le 10 Juillet 1972 à Cotonou, la capitale économique du BENIN, dame V. Félicité est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vend des produits de première nécessité à savoir les pâtes alimentaires,les boissons,du lait, du riz, etc. Elle vend aussi de la nourriture et possède également un petit télé-centre. Elle achète ses marchandises à Tokpa et quelques fois à Lomé au TOGO puis les commercialise dans une boutique sise à son domicile au quartier Sènadé. Elle est à son troisième prêt à ALIDé et fait partie des meilleures bénéficiaires de notre institution.

loans.use: To buy four 50-kg sacks of ordinary rice, two sacks of perfumed rice, some sacks of beans, and various types of liqueurs

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es:
Gilda is a single mother, she is 51 years old, and has 4 children, who are now adults and work and live with her.
She works selling candy and sodas beverages, in the morning she sells from her home, in the afternoons she sells on different zones of Pucallpa. She has been working on this since she was 16 years old. She likes her job very much because thanks to it, she raised her kids and it keeps her active. She works all day and business is good.
With the money she is requesting, she wants to acquire more candy and build a portable kiosk that would be easier to move from place to place.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Gilda es madre soltera, tiene 51 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, los mismos que ya son adultos, trabajan y viven con ella. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y bebidas heladas (gaseosas), por las mañanas vende en su domicilio, y por las tardes los lleva a vender por las diferentes zonas de Pucallpa. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 16 años. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque gracias al mismo, sacó adelante a sus hijos y sobre todo porque la mantiene activa. Ella trabaja todo el día y le va bien en su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita, quiere adquirir más golosinas y mandar a construir un kiosco que pueda ser fácil de trasladar de un lugar a otro.

loans.use: Increase the quantity of products she sells and buy a portable kiosk / Incrementar la cantidad de los productos que vende y comprar un kiosco.

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en: Houssam R. lives in a small Lebanese village close to Baalback, in the valley of the Bekaa. Houssam owns a small cafe where he makes a wide array of sandwiches and platters for his loyal customers. Nearly anything his customers desire, Houssam can make. Though he is only 25, he has been an Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) client for the past 2 years, during which time he has been able to slowly improve his cafe's selection and presentation. Houssam has recently asked Al Majmoua for a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase new equipment and paint his popular eatery.

loans.use: To purchase new appliances and paint his cafe

loans.name: Komitse

texts.fr: Komitse A. est âgé de 36 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il habite à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Komitse est un excellent coiffeur depuis plus de 2 ans et tire ses revenus de cette activité. Il désire par ce crédit acheter des tondeuses et aussi aménager son atelier. Komitse souhaite améliorer ses conditions de vie par les revenus qui seront issus de son activité.
texts.en:
Komitse A. is 36 years old, married and the father of two children. He lives in Danyi, a village about 175 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Komitse has been an excellent barber for over two years and makes his income from this activity. He wants to use this loan to buy hair clippers and also refit his barber shop. Komitse hopes to improve his living conditions through the income from his business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair clippers and refit his barber shop

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene O. is 27 years old and is single. He sells motorcycle spare parts at forestry road in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. He is a client of LAPO and is the leader of a lending group. 

Eugene buys the motorcycle parts from Onitsha main market and sells them in Benin City. The demand for his product is high. He needs the loan amount of N70,000, US$600, to buy more spare parts to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.en: Olga is a member of the Kusirituy Village Bank; “Kusirikuy” means “get happy” in Quechua. Olga is 24 years old and is married with five children. She and her husband have a store in a rented space. They sell bicycles, bike parts, and accessories, which they buy in the city of Ayacucho. Her husband also repairs bikes. The couple also owns a mototaxi, which her husband drives in Ayacucho. She is requesting a loan to buy replacement bike parts. Olga’s dreams are to open a larger, wholesale store and for her children to graduate from college with professional degrees.

loans.use: To buy replacement bicycle parts

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres D. Villa del Lago II” del distrito, provincia y departamento D. Puno. Tiene 68 años D. edad, es viuda y madre D. 5 hijos mayores y vive con una hija y dos nietos. 
Con el primer préstamo D. S/ 300, compró ajo, choclo y rocoto para vender en el mercado D. Yunguyo. Tiene casi 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que ha trabajado siempre en el mercado D. Yunguyo y posteriormente se mudó a Puno para acompañar a su hija y a sus nietos quienes estudian en esta ciudad.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor cantidad D. ajo, choclo y rocoto para seguir vendiendo en el mercado.
Francisca desea continuar trabajando para aumentar sus ganancias para dejar herencia a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Ms. Petrona R. is a member of the “Mujeres D. Villa del Lago II” microfinance institute in the district, province and department of Puno. She is a 68-year-old widowed mother with 5 grown up children. She lives with one of her daughters and two grandchildren.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased garlic, corn and hot peppers to sell at the market in Yunguyo. She has been working with the microfinance institute for almost 5 years, and she states that she has always worked at the Yunguyo market. She later moved to Puno to join her daughter and grandchildren, who study in this city.

With this 1,200.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase a greater quantity of garlic, corn and hot peppers to keep selling at the market. Francisca wishes to continue working in order to increase her earnings and leave an inheritance for her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase garlic, corn and hot peppers

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate I. sells yams. She is 46 years old, married with 2 children. Her husband is a civil servant. Kate plans to increase her profit margin so she can take care of her children in school. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN ($675) to purchase more yams to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Reyna  Graciela

texts.es:
Reyna es casada y tiene 7 hijos, inició el negocio  porque necesitaba una entrada de dinero para sostener a sus hijos, porque  tiene que sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que todos estudian y quiere darles lo mejor. Comenzó el negocio en Octubre de 1998, por invitación de una de sus primas que la llevó a una demostración de cosméticos y así se inicio vendiendo entre sus vecinas y amistades, ya que además trabaja como empleada doméstica y los fines de semana vende comida y novedades y regalos en los mercados rodantes.  Además sus hijos le ayudan en las labores de cobranza y entrega de mercancía.
le ha ido muy bien, ya que con los cosméticos cada vez tiene mas clientas y así mejores ganancias que puede invertir en otros productos que vende como son novedades y regalos y así es como ha ido creciendo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $3000 que pagara en 6 catorcrenas para invertir en cosméticos, regalos y novedades y así tener una mejor variedad de productos que pueda ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Reyna is married and has 7 children. She started her business because she needed a source of income to support her children, wanting to send them all to school and give them all the best there is. She started out in October 1998 through an invitation from a cousin who brought her a cosmetics demonstration and that's how she started selling to her neighbours and friends. She also works cleaning homes on the weekends and selling foods, souvenirs and gifts in the area markets. She also has her children helping her by collecting payments and delivering merchandise.

It has gone very well for her with the cosmetics because each time she has more clients and better earnings that she can invest in other products for sale, such as souvenirs and gift items, which is how she has been expaning the business.

She requires a loan of $3000 MXN that will be repaid in 6 biweekly terms to invest in her cosmetics, gift items and souvenirs. She will have a better variety of products to offer her clients.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in merchandise.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L. raises pigs. She said she likes having a pig business very much because she enjoys the work and earns a reasonable profit from it. She is 45 years old and single but still looking for a lucky guy to be her husband.

For 20 years, she worked as a purchaser in one of the restaurants in Davao that was owned by Chinese nationals. She was not happy about her job because she didn't receive enough compensation, so she went back to her village to manage the farm.

Jocelyn is asking a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy piglets and pig feed. The loan will truly help her expand the business. It will also help her get started with a new business as she is interested in venturing into another line to augment her income.

CEVI provides their clients with credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage and has helped Jocelyn grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Nancy,

texts.es:
Hasta hace dos años, Nancy y su esposo manejaban una cebichería exitosa cuando aun vivían en una casa que quedaba en el centro de su localidad. No obstante, cuando decidieron comprarse un terreno para construir su casa propia, tuvieron que dejar el restaurante y mudarse a su nuevo hogar.
Una vez ahí ambos decidieron dedicarse a sus otros negocios. El esposo de Nancy es “curandero”,  ofrece servicios de medicina natural y ceremonias de curanterismo a domicilio. Mientras que Nancy Ha empezado a vender en mayor cantidad productos de belleza por catalogo, negocio que ya tiene alrededor de cuatro años.

Para más adelante, ambos piensan retomar el negocio de la cebicheria, cuando construyan su casa con material noble y tengan pista asfaltada en la calle de su casa.
texts.en:
Until two years ago, Nancy and her husband ran a successful "Cebichería", a restaurant serving the typical Latin American seafood dish "ceviche". However, when they decided to buy some land and build their own house, they had to leave the restaurant and the house they were living in the centre of town so that they could move into their new home. Once they had moved, they both decided to start up new businesses. Nancy's husband is now a "witch doctor" offering treatments using herbal medicines and carrying out home ceremonies to cure illnesses. Meanwhile, Nancy has started to sell large quantities of cosmetics by catalogue, a business that she's been running for around four years now. They both intend to start up another "Cebicheria" in the future, once they have built a sturdy enough house and their road is asphalted.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and herbal medicines.

loans.name: Chu Thi

texts.en:
L. Chu (640991086) is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyen. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, L. owns & operates a restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. L. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $226) a month from these activities.

In 1999, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. L. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 Dong which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. The loan will be the 9th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Purchase of food and drinks for her restaurant

loans.name: Penh

texts.en:
