Penh M., 35, is a modest women who lives in Kompong Tom Province in Cambodia. Here she earns a living breeding many pigs in her own stall behind her house. She sells all her pigs to the slaughterer when they are mature. She is married with two children; both of them are minor and under her care.

To help provide the family's meals, her husband sells firewood and charcoal in the family home. To make transportation easier in that business, Penh M. is looking for a loan to buy buffalo that she can connect to her existing trailer-cart so she can use it to transport firewood and charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To buy buffalo to pull her cart

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Virgen de los Angeles VIllage Bank, which meets once a month in the town of Huayllacocha, where she lives. Julia is thirty-seven years old and married with three children who are nine, seven and three years old. Julia and her husband have a farm where they grow barley, potatoes, wheat and broad beans (“habas”). The potato harvest just ended, and they will soon harvest barley in June. 

Julia is requesting a loan to buy piglets and lambs. She isn’t quite sure how many of each she will buy yet, but the money is enough to buy about four small pigs. She will fatten the animals up for several months and then sell them in the market in the town of Izcuchaca, the nearby transportation/commerce hub. For example, if she buys a pig for $65, Julia says, she will be able to sell the same pig two months later for $85. She has been working with livestock for many years now, she says, and has also been a member of Asociacion Arariwa for many years, though she can’t think of exactly how long it’s been. 

Julia has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time. Her goal is to be able to take out larger loans in the future. She is grateful for the loans offered by Asociacion Arariwa, since it is the only financial institution that offers services in her town.

loans.use: Buy piglets and lambs

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion 1 Group

texts.en:
Janeta (pictured on the far left) is of Haitian decent. She has eight grown children and has been receiving loans from Esperanza for six years now. She lives in Eusrarduna, a batay of Consuelo. A batay is a sugar cane plantation site that is mostly inhabited by Haitian migrant workers. Most batays still do not have latrines, potable water is rare, and electricity is non-existent. There are narrow dirt roads that surround the batay where motoconchos (motorcycle taxi’s) swoosh through. 

Janeta is an experienced retail clothes sales-women. She says she has been in this line of work as far back as she can remember. She primarily sells to people in her community. They have known her and her business for some time now. She also sells on the streets. When asked how these loans have changed her business, she responded, “They help my business grow and bring in more profits.” 

Please continue to support Janeta. Thank you.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes to resell to people in her community

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 36 years old. She is married with five children. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk etc. She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for the children’s education. She lives in a cocoa farming community in the western region of Ghana. It is her utmost desire to increase her sales to expand her shop also. She belongs to the village bank ‘Nyadaye’ which means God never sleep.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Erick Miguel

texts.es: El señor Erick Miguel B. C. , tiene la edad de 35 años , habita en el Barrio Medardo Andino , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene un hijo a su cargo , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace un año trabaja para la empresa CLARO como agente de venta , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que su salario no le ajusta para comprar materiales de construcción , lo cual opto por un financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción y poder hacer las mejoras a su vivienda para poder estar en mejores condiciones. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con lo prestamos ya que podrá hacer sus proyecciones.
texts.en:
Mr. Erick Miguel B. C. is 35 years old. He lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood which is in the municipality of Ticuantepe, with his wife, who is employed and contributes to household expenses. They have a son. Their plans are to improve their family's living conditions and the greatest obstacle to overcome is that their salaries are not enough to allow for the purchase of building materials to improve their home thus the need for this loan. He thanks the institution for the help it gives through these loans in that they will allow him to complete his projects.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials for home improvement.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene A., age 49, raises pigs. She also manages a small sari-sari (variety) store in her neighborhood. She runs multiple businesses to meet the growing expenses in their home. She is now cleaning the barn. She intends to buy new piglets and start a piggery.

After learning about CEVI services, she would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 to buy pig feed and 2 piglets. She hopes that someday she won't have to apply for a loan to expand her business and that someday she will be able to achieve all her dreams for her children.

CEVI aims to help small businesses grow. Like Arlene, CEVI is reaching out communities to start businesses for their own families.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and 2 piglets

loans.name: Aleyda Del Socorro

texts.es: a Joven Aleyda  está solictando su primer crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construccion de una habitación), trabaja como admisitradora del hotel Nueva Guinea desde hace 2 años, no tiene hijos pero ayuda a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, vive en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea en la zona # 1, esta joven  tiene alto espiritu de superación personal y laboral,  es una persona responsable,  que ama su trabajo,  su sueño  es estudiar es seguir estudiando,  tener estabilidad, salud  y una vivienda  bonita para sus padres y para sus futuros hijos.
texts.en:
The young Aleyda is seeking her first loan to be able to invest in home improvements (the building of a bedroom). She has worked as an administrator in the Nueva Guinea hotel for the past two years. She doesn't have children, but she helps her parents with household expenses. She lives in the Nueva Guinea urban area in zone #1. This young woman has a strong desire to improve herself personally and at her job. She is a responsible person, who loves her job. Her dream is to continue her studies and to have financial stability, good health, and a lovely home for her parents and future children.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a new bedroom

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
40-year-old Vilma F. is a mother of three children who range in age from 13 to 18 years. Her fisherman husband is her partner in the business and in raising their children. Vilma’s fish selling business started to grow six years ago. Initially, loans she requests from ASHI when she became a member in 1996 were used to grow her husband’s fishing business.  In 2003, she used her loan in buying fish from other fishermen in their village in addition to her husband’s fish for selling. Since then, she continuously finances the said business. She realized big profit she makes out of it thus, she would like to requests for a larger amount of loan this time to be able to grow her business further. She likes to purchase bigger volume of fish to sell in her stall in the market.
Once her business had grown through loans she requests from ASHI, she will be able to generate bigger profit making her able to send her three children to school until they graduate from college. Vilma also wished to renovate their house for the security of her entire family especially her children.

loans.use: Will be used as an additional capital to grow her fish selling business.

loans.name: Luchando Por El Progreso 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Lucrecia is the coordinator of her group: Luchando por el Progreso (Fighting for Progress). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian (many of whom recently emigrated from Haiti to the Dominican Republic) and Dominican clients. Her group is based in the outskirts of La Romana. Here she makes her home with her children in a structure of plywood with a tin roof which she owns but does not have title too.

Lucrecia originally came to Esperanza with the goal of starting a business and she has been with Esperanza for four loan cycles now, successfully repaying each time. With this new loan she continues to invest in her business of running a "san". A san is an operation in which several neighbors come together and put money into a collective each week for a predetermined amount of time and at the end of that time one member of the group receives a packet of goods. This is repeated until each member has had a turn receiving the packet. Thus it is a setup in which neighbors pool resources. In this case our associate is purchasing the goods to be given to each one of the members of her groups at the end of the cycle. She will collect a fee for providing the goods.

With the profits from this enterprise Lucrecia intends to invest in adding a concrete floor to her house (something which will greatly improve her living conditions and reduce exposure to disease) and to purchase glasses for her daughter to enable her to see. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy a sack of rice, a gallon of cooking oil, a large can of salsa and boxes of soup

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Night B. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at the resturant  and is requesting a loan to purchase more beans and pulses.  Night is 37 years old and is Married with a husband that is prison officer. She has 1 child and her child does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase a motor bike for carrying bread, rice etct to her resturant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more pulses and beans

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda I. is from the village of Villaverde, Iligan City. She is 47 years old. Rosalinda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of fruits in the local market and to the local community members as well. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosalinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosalinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Villaverde, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Chhom

texts.en:
Chhom S., 36, is married with five children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. She is a housewife. To make a living, her husband operates his own business as an electronics repairman. He repairs some electronic devices such as speakers and microphones, earning an income of US $8 per day to help cover the family expenses.

This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Mrs. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $400 to purchase a qualified loud speaker to rent for any special ceremony in the province.

loans.use: To buy speakers to rent

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita J. is from the village of Baclay, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 59 years old, is married, and has four adult children.

Florita owns and operates a business selling charcoal to local community members for housing and business purposes. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 9,600 PHP a month.

In 2008, Florita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC.

Florita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory to use as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie V. is from the village of Dabubu Grande, a part of San Agustin municipality in the province of Isabela on Luzon. She is 37 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Melanie raises pigs to sell. She has been in business for over eight years and earns approximately 2500 PHP whenever she sells her pigs.

In 2009, Melanie joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first from ASKI, of 4000 PHP to be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. She plans to use all additionally generated revenue to expand her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and –women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda, 27, is a young mother who balances her schedule between her three grade school children and her sideline businesses of direct selling cosmetics, assorted biscuits, and frozen meat foods. Married to Michael F. who is a security guard, she makes it a point to help her husband with their daily expenses by contributing what she earns. 

Esmeralda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than six years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow fifteen times from CCT’s Cooperative. The reason why she was consistent in paying her loans was because she used almost all of the money borrowed as added capital for her business.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 11,000 loan. This amount will be used to expand her business by buying additional cosmetics for her increasing number of clients.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can help with the family’s daily expenses and be able to let their children all finish their studies someday. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microminance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional cosmetics.

loans.name: Aïchatou

texts.fr: Aïchatou W. est une femme de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle fait de l’embauche bovine et souhaiterait augmenter son capital. Ses revenus lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie, de scolarité et de santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aïchatou W. is a 52-year old woman who is married with five children. She has a beef fattening activity and would like to increase her capital. Her income will allow her to improve the living conditions, schooling and health of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To carry out a beef fattening activity

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA JUANA ES UNA CLIENTE BUENA, DINAMICA Y RESPONSABLE, ANTERIORMENTE YA TRABAJO CON LA INSTITUCION EN UN CREDITO EN GRUPO Y RESPONDIO BIEN, EN SU COMPORTAMIENTO ELLA DEMOSTRO PUNTUALIDAD Y RESPONSABILIDAD.

LA SEÑORA JUANA  SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE MANTAS DE VICUÑA SUS MANTAS SON PURAS Y MESCLADAS, ESTAS MANTAS SON ELABORADAS CON LANA DE VICUÑA, LA  VICUÑA ES UN ANIMAL AUTOCTONO DE LA ZONA OCCIDENTAL DEL PAIS QUE TIENE UNA LANA MUY FINA, ESTAS MANTAS SON UTILIZADAS POR LA MUJER DE POLLERA (EN BOLIVIA LA MUJER AUTOCTONA ES LA QUE UTILIZA LAS MANTAS COMO TAMBIEN LA MUJER NORMAL), ESTE PRODUCTO ES MUY FINO DE EXPORTACION QUE SE LE EXPORTA AL EXTERIOR DEL PAIS, LA VENTA DE  MANTAS SE DA MAS EN LA ZONA OCCIDENTAL DEL PAIS Y COMO TAMBIEN EN EL EXTERIOR DEL PAIS, LA VENTA LO REALIZA EN FORMA AMBULANTE, SU ESPOSO SE LLAMA LUCIO EL ES CHOFER PROPIETARIO, LA LABOR DE LA SEÑORA JUANA ES SACRIFICADO PORQUE ELLA TIENE QUE REALIZAR EL REPARTO DE SUS MANTAS AMBULANTEMENTE.

EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA LA COMPRA DE LANA DE VICUÑA PARA PODER REALIZAR LAS MANTAS. 

LA SRA. JUANA ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO
texts.en:
Juana is a good, dynamic, and responsible client. She has previously worked with this institute as part of a group loan, and she responded well. her behavior showed punctuality and responsibility. Juana knits shawls made from vicuña. Her shawls are pure and mixed. These ponchos are made with wool from the vicuña, an animal native to the west of the country and that has a very fine coat. In Bolivia, these shawls are worn by native as well as non-native women. This is a great product to export outside the country. The shawls sell better in the western region of the country and also abroad. Her business is conducted on foot. Her husband, Lucio, is a driver-owner, but Juana must distribute her shawls by traveling on foot. This loan will be used to purchase vicuña wool so she can make her shawls. Juana is grateful for Emprender and Kiva having the confidence to grant this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchse of vicuña wool

loans.name: Petty Trader Group

texts.en:
James K. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Petty Traders. He is married, and has five children who are 16, 18, 19, 21 and 28 years old. 

For over 26 years, James has had a dry goods business at the Rally Town Market. James sells quality goods in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning.  

James plans to use his 4,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 20,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dry goods such as locks, nails and rope.  His goal is to grow his business and to provide a good future for his children.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, James is the one holding the sign. Tamba S. is inset at lower left.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts an emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as locks, nails and ropes.

loans.name: Tsendsuren

texts.en:
Tsendsuren has operated a clothing retail business since 1997. She is 72 years old and lives with her daughter in Tuv province, Mongolia. She and her daughter have lived together, in their own apartment, for 35 years. Tsendsuren's daughter supports the business, and they have been able to repair their home and furniture with their earnings. Additionally, Tsendsuren pays for her grandchildren's university tuition fees every year. 

Originally, Tsendsuren's working capital was 100,000 tugrugs (~$70 US). But now her working capital has increased to 3,500,000 tugrugs (~$2,463 US) through her hard work and determination. She has much business experience gained in previous years. Tsendsuren operates her business year-round, any she has a large and increasing number of regular customers. Tsendsuren is a decent and very hardworking person. She says, “I'm working hard in order to expand my business and to create my own shop.” 

Tsendsuren is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Leybin Javier

texts.es:
El joven Leybin Javier es trabajador de un centro de serigrafía.
Leybin va usar este crédito para gasto universitario tales como pago de matricula y aranceles.
El espera que con el crédito pueda continuar con los estudios ya que esta  cursando el tercer año de ingeniería civil.
Leybin es soltero vive con sus padres. Este es su segundo crédito ha trabajado dos años con Ceprodel. El expreso que sus créditos le han ayudado mucho en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Leybin works in a silk screening center. He will use the money from this loan to pay for university expenses, such as tuition and fees. He hopes that this loan will allow him to continue with his studies, as he is in his third year of his civil engineering studies. He is single and lives with his parents. This is his second loan and he has been working with CEPRODEL for two years. He says that the loans have helped him tremendously with his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tuition

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: JORGE LUIS S. LABORA COMO JARDINERO EN LA UNICA TIEN DOS HIJOS MENORES LOS CUALES DEPENDE DE EL Y SU COMPAÑERA DE VIDA EL ESTA SOLICITANDO UN PRESTAMO POR PRIMERA VEZ PARA ASUNTOS DE SAÑLUD COMPRAR MEDICINA PARA UN FAMILIAR SUYO..
texts.en:
Jorge Luis S. works as a gardener in La Unica. He has two young children who depend on him and his life partner. He is requesting a loan for the first time in order to buy medicine for a relative of his.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For his mother's medical expenses and medicine

loans.name: Lucinda Emilia

texts.es:
Lucinda es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Lucinda es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, vive en Minas CanA., Lucinda tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, además vende salchipapas por las noches.
Lucinda necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Lucinda son comprar una congeladora para su tienda y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucinda is a member of the Virgin Mary Community Bank. She is married, 40 years old, and has three children. She lives in Minas CanA.. Lucinda has a stO. in her house selling general groceries, vegetables, meat, as well as salchipapas (fried potatoes and sausages) in the evenings. She needs a loan of 1750 soles to buy rice and sugar. Lucinda's dreams are to buy a freezer for the stO. and to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Kadykeeva Gulnara Group

texts.en:
K. Gulnara is the leader of her group. She is 30, married and has three daughters. The older one is a pupil and the others are preschool age. Her husband is engaged in fattening cattle and reselling them. He also takes part in cultivation and sowing, Gulnara and her husband have been engaged in this activity for 15 years. As a result, they added a heating system to their house and increased the number of livestock. Now they are involved in agricultural work on the field, so Gulnara wants to get a loan to purchase fuel needed for the cultivation and sowing process. In the future, they're planning to educate their children and purchase a pavilion to sell groceries and manufactured goods.

B. K. Zarema is 20 years old. She's married and has a little daughter. Zarema's husband works as a builder; in order to make more money he also cultivates the neighbors' land on his friend's tractor. Zarema sits at home with their little daughter and is engaged in cattle breeding. So she wants to get a loan to purchase a calf in order to increase the number of livestock. In the near future, as their daughter grows up, Zarema will start to work in a sewing workshop.  

T. Perizat is the treasurer of the group. She's 21, and studies at the university part time. Two years ago, with an initial amount of 2000 soms ($43.60), Perizat and her farther started to cultivate the land. In order to make money, Perizat and her mom also produce national products at home. With the money receive from the loan, they are going to buy fuel, which is necessary for the sowing process. After finishing the university, Perizat wishes to start her own business.

S. Gulzat is 40, and married with three children: two sons and a daughter. The older son and a daughter study at school, the other one is preschool age. Gulzat's husband is engaged in the private transportation of passengers in Bishkek. Two years ago, with 1000 soms ($21.81), Gulzat began to take orders for sewing quilts. As a result of this, she was able to marry her daughter and give a dowry of 30000 soms ($653.87). Now Gulzat wants to get a loan to purchase fuel needed for plowing and sowing the land. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase fuel

loans.name: Dem

texts.en: Dem I., 51, is widowed and resides with her four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She recharges batteries at home for an income of about USD 3 per day. The four children are employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of USD 4 each per day to help cover the family expenses.  I. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase a new generator to charge batteries. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. I. appears in the photograph with one of her children.

loans.use: To buy a new generator to charge batteries

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn M. is from the village of Malasin. She is 44 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Marilyn owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP whenever she sells her harvested vegetables. In 2008, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Moul

texts.en:
Mrs. Moul R. has spent her life cultivating crops. She has a lot of experience in this, having learned fR. her grandparents when she was young. She was married, but divorced her husband, and she has four children. Two of her daughters are employed in the garment factory and provide their little income to help with family expenses.

Recently, Moul R. wants to invest in a new business line of selling various foods for the purpose of earning extra profit for her family. Because she has no capital, Moul R. is seeking a loan to begin this business. With any remaining money fR. the loan, she will plant crops during this coming rainfall season.

loans.use: To begin selling various foods and to plant crops.

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en:
Bayan A. is from the village of Lower Bayao, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 32 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Bayan raises cows for sale. Bayan has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Bayan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bayan is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Bayan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: Lower Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sand, cement and flooring

loans.name: Kostya

texts.en:
Kostya is married and owns a transportation and car wash business in Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. He offers transportation services in his locale.  Moreover, he has two hired employees who work at his car wash. The transportation business is very popular in this region of the Ukraine. The unemployment level is very high and people are forced to find different and innovative ways to feed their families. Kostya has been in this business for 7 years. His monthly income is about 5,000 Grivnyas. 

Kostya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to do major repairs to his car and repaint it. Eventually, Kostya hopes to purchase a newer and better vehicle for his business but can’t afford anything extravagant right now. The business is the main source of income for his family.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle

loans.name: Mrs. Ny Pra Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen members make up this village bank loan and they live in Prey Slaeng village in Takeo province. Mrs. Ny P., who was born in 1977, is the village bank president, having been selected by the other members. Each member will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Ny P. and her husband, Mr. Kam Sort Yun, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) plot of land that they use to cultivate rice, not to sell but to support their family. Mr. Kam Sort Yun is also a construction worker.

Mrs. Ny P.’s problem is that her field has infertile soil but she does not have enough money to support it. So, to improve her production rice, she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer.

Mrs. Ny P. is the mother of five children, one of whom is a construction worker, another three are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest one is only a year old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 49-year-old single mother of four.  It's five years since she started running Mary's Boutique where she sells clothes and shoes.  Most of her customers are women.  She employs one person and she hopes to expand the business.  She has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to add to her stock of clothes and shoes.  For this loan, she has been guaranteed by the Pamoja group of Faulu Kenya, of which she is a member.  In ten years, she wants to operate her business in Nairobi city centre.  She describes herself as hardworking and faithful.

loans.use: To add stock of clothes and shoes

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married and has grown children. She is a small market entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka. Irina sells women’s clothing merchandise in one of the local markets. Irina rents a small facility that serves as a vending outlet. 

She admits that she started this business because it was the only way to survive when her family was going through some challenging financial times. Irina has been in this business for eight years. Irina enjoys her business and has a long-term view of her venture development and is disciplined with all her business plans. 

Irina has used micro-loans in the past and found them very helpful for her business. This time Irina is requesting a 15,000 Grivnya loan to increase the selection of clothing items.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothing items

loans.name: Abydahan's Group

texts.en:
Abydahan E. is the leader of the group. She is 44 years old and married. Her family has 6 children, the older are students, the younger go to school. The head of the family earns money by farming. Abydahan has a profession as a Geography schoolteacher. She makes 4470 soms per month. With money received from this loan she wants to purchase household appliances in order to improve her living conditions. In the future she is planning to give a proper education to her children. 

Kanayuim A., 48, is married. Her spouse raises money by working as a taxi driver. Earlier, he used to work in a village. After having received some profits, he was able to purchase a car. The couple has 4 children. The daughters are married, the elder son works in Russia, the youngest helps his parents in housekeeping. As for Kanayuim, she works at a school. The loan purpose is to obtain a refrigerator. In the future the family wants to provide education to the children, to buy a house and to increase cattle stock.

Aliima S., 50, is married. Her spouse works as a Geography school teacher. The family has 5 sons: the elder work in Russia, the youngest one is a schoolboy. The main way of enriching the family's budget is cattle breeding. During the past 20 years of working hard, the family has managed to increase cattle stock. They now have 2 cows, 2 calves and 22 sheep. The loan purpose is to purchase more cattle (calves). In the future, Aliima is planning to obtain a house.

Shaiyrgul N., 37, is married. Her spouse has a creative profession; he is a musician. His salary has made it possible to purchase 3 goats. The couple brings up 3 children, all of whom go to school. The family’s mother earns money by working as a teacher in a school. Out of total earnings, the family has begun to build a house. The building is almost finished. The loan purpose is to purchase animal livestock. In the future Shaiyrgul wants to make major house repairs.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase household appliances.

loans.name: Rakeri

texts.en:
Rakeri C. is a married older lady with two sons aged twenty-five years old and twenty years old. Her business is located in a residential area called Pipeline and she is served by the Kitengela branch. Her business is well known by the name of Mama Mungai Food Place. She sells food such as stiff porridge, meat stew, rice, tea and other items to the local people. She has been in this business for five years and has one employee.  

She says that the business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy food items which include beans, maize, green grams (lentils) and rice to meet her customers demand. She hopes to be a supplier of food and cereals in Pipeline. She describes herself as hardworking and business-oriented.

loans.use: Beans, maize, green grams, rice

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en:
Ezra has been practicing mixed farming for seven years in Kitale town, western Kenya. His farm produces milk and eggs which he sells to the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater for the needs of his family. He faces the challenges of diseases which affects his production and lack of storage facilities for his animal feeds.

Ezra is 56 years old. He is married with 4 school-aged children who all attend school.

He recently repaid his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 70,000KES and has requested this loan of 71,200KES to purchase a dairy cow and expand his poultry farm. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him provide for the basic needs of his family. In future, he would like to acquire 5 dairy cows and a posho mill to increase his productivity.

loans.use: To purchase and maintain a dairy cow and expand his poultry farm.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena F. is from the town of Surallah. She is 49 years old and is married. She owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She works hard to improve her harvest. She hopes to sell quality rice to her community.

Elena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: César, de 24 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador, que vive en compañía de sus padres y sus 5 hermanos. En unión familiar, ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Ñagazu (selva central peruana). Esté ambicioso joven, hace apenas 3 años que emprendió su propio negocio, y está dichoso de ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Con el terreno que le heredó sus padres, comenzó a sembrar café, el cual abona, cultiva y cuida todos los días, y después de cada cosecha los entrega a la asociación de agricultores de su localidad, los cuales venden el grano a un mayor precio. Pero César, tienen otras aspiraciones, que caminan paralelo a su producción, ya que él estudia Agronomía, en un instituto reconocido del país, él desea más adelante terminar su carrera profesional, para poder asesorar a los pobladores de su comunidad, y así lograr la excelencia que tanto busca. Esté es el quinto crédito con MFP, y agradece a los integrantes de su banco comunal, los que le apoyan y le ayudan a salir adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono orgánico y fertilizantes naturales, para su sembrío de café.
texts.en:
César is 24 years old and is a hardworking single man who lives with his parents and five siblings.  The family lives in their own house located in the native community of Nagazu in the central Peruvian jungle.  

About three years ago, this ambitious young man started his own business and is helping his family get ahead.  With the land he inherited from his parents, he began to cultivate coffee.  He fertilizes, cultivates, and cares for his crop every day.  After each harvest, he brings the coffee to the agricultural association in his town, which sells it at a better price.

César has other dreams that work in parallel with his crops.  Since he studies agriculture at a well-known school, he wants to complete degree and advise the residents of his community and achieve the excellence that he is looking for.  

This is his fifth credit with MFP and he thanks all the members of his community bank because they support each other and help each other get ahead.  With this loan, he wants to purchase compost and natural fertilizers for his coffee crop.

loans.use: Purchase compost and fertilizers for his coffee crop

loans.name: Jose Misael

texts.es:
Don José, tiene 51 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de verduras y granos básicos, él vive junto a su hijo.
Este negocio fue iniciativa propia, tiene más de 10 años de existir, su horario de atención es de 5:00am a 3:00pm, está ubicado en el mercado municipal de EL Transito, por el momento don José desea comprar verduras y granos básicos como frijol, arroz, tomates, papas, esta compra le dará estabilidad al negocio e incrementara la posibilidad de crecer con las ventas y de ser más rentable.
El objetivo de don José es mantener el negocio por largo tiempo, generar ganancias para el hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 51 and lives in El Transito department of San Miguel together with his son. He sells vegetables and basic grains.

He began this business himself more than 10 years ago.  He works from 5:00 am to 3:00 pm in the business that is located in the municipal market of El Transito.  Now he would like to buy vegetables and grains such as beans, rice, tomatoes, and potatoes.  This purchase will stabilize his business and increase the possibility of his being able to improve sales and become more profitable.
José’s goal is to keep the business for a long time and generate enough income for his home and  to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, tomatoes and potatoes

loans.name: Nurjan

texts.en: Nurjan H. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and enclosure. His daughter attends a local secondary school while his wife works as a teacher for the school. Nurjan operates a raw materials trading business, using his own car, buying raw materials locally and selling them in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, for a profit. He started his business in 2001 with working capital of 1,000,000 MNT which soon grew to 9,000,000 MNT. He has gained a lot of experience and knowledge over the years and he hopes to use this experience and knowledge to keep his business growing. Nurjan is a hardworking and modest person and is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more raw materials to sell in Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Elsy Maribel

texts.es:
Doña Elsy, de 44 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a vender tortillas, vive solo con un hijo de 18 años de edad, quien estudia  y depende económicamente de ella, el negocio lo inicio por influencia de una amiga, ella trabaja con dos empleadas con un horario de 9:00am a 2:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de leña, maíz, gas para elaborar tortillas, este préstamo le ayudara a tener materiales para un buen periodo de tiempo, y disponer de lo necesario para realizar sus ventas diarias.
Su objetivo es mantenerse en el negocio, hacerlo cada vez más rentable, para ayudar a su hijo y mejorar la condición de vida de ambos.
texts.en:
Elsy, 44, lives in El Transito department of San Miguel.  She lives alone with her 18 year old son; he is a student and a dependent.  She sells tortillas, a business that she started on the recommendation of a friend.  Elsy works with two employees from 9 am to 2 pm.

She is requesting a loan to buy firewood, corn, and gas to make tortillas.  This loan will help her have supplies for a good while and use them to make her daily sales.

Her objective is to keep her business going and making it more profitable, to help her son, and to improve life for both of them.

loans.use: To buy firewood, corn, and gas

loans.name: Orlando's Group

texts.en:
Orlando B. is from the village of Cabisera 5, Ilagan, Isabela. He is 48 years old. Orlando is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Orlando B.'s Group.

Orlando is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over thirty-one years and earns approximately $117 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Orlando joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Orlando is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be his 2nd loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru: Холманова Хафиза проживает в районе Шахринав. Возраст, 26 лет. Не замужем. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается животноводством.  Она разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже два года. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Hafiza K. lives in the Shahrinav region. She is 26 years old. She is not married. Hafiza has secondary education and does animal husbandry. She breeds large cattle for future resale. She has been in this business for two years. She is taking out the loan to buy cattle and increase their headcount.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Sandro

texts.es: Sandro, de 35 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador que se independizó de su familia; comprando una casa al costado de la vivienda de sus padres, ubicada en Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). La siembra de plátanos y café en sus 3 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas; es su principal actividad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ver madurar los granos que cuida con mucho esmero. Ya tiene 20 años de experiencia en la siembra y venta de sus granos de café, que vende a los mismos intermediarios que visitan sus terrenos anualmente en cada campaña agrícola. Donde tiene que invertir gran cantidad de dinero para obtener una buena ganancia. Asimismo cuenta que los demás meses del año, donde no hay cosecha, trabaja como peón en otros cultivos, obteniendo una ganancia mensual de S/. 500 nuevos soles, que le ayudan a solventar sus gastos personales y los de su cultivo propio. Él pertenece al banco comunal “desarrollando para el progreso de prisma”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente feliz por la oportunidad de progreso que le facilitaron. Sandro, comprará 10 sacos de guano de isla, los cuales esparcirá entre sus plantaciones de café; porque en el mes de abril comenzará la rebusca (extracción de los primeros granos maduros).
texts.en:
Sandro is 35 years old.  He is a single, hard-working man who lives independently from his family, having bought a house next to his parents' home which is located in Unión Palomar (in the central Peruvian jungle).  Sandro grows bananas and coffee on his 3 hectares of farmland.  This is his main business activity. 

What Sandro most enjoys about his work is being able to watch his beans mature as he looks after them very carefully.  He has 20 years experience in growing and selling coffee beans.  He sells his produce to traders who visit his land annually, every harvest season.  He has to invest a large quantity of money in order to obtain good profits.  During the other months of the year, when there is no harvest, Sandro works as a laborer on other people's crops, making a monthly income of 500 Peruvian soles that he uses to cover his personal expenses and those of his own crops.

Sandro is a member of the 'Desarrollando para el Progreso de Prisma' community bank and this is his first loan from MFP.  He feels very happy to have been offered a chance to make progress.  Sandro will buy 10 sacks of guano which he will spread over his coffee plantations because in April he will begin extracting his first mature beans.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of bird guano

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
María de 45 años, es una mujer trabajadora que empezó vendiendo empanadas y su esposo vendiendo maduro con queso para así solventar en los gastos familiares. Está separada  y tienen 4 hijos ya mayores d edad.

En la actualidad trabaja sola vendiendo empanadas y bollos y también está en las ventas de carbón. Con el préstamo desea comprar vitrinas y discos para empanadas. En un futuro quiere adecuar un local para así pone su negocio de comida para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
María, 45, is a hard working woman who started out selling turnovers and her husband selling plantain with cheese to cover family expenses.  She’s separated and has four adult children.

She currently works alone selling turnovers and bread rolls; she also sells charcoal.

She wants to use the loan to buy display cases and turnover rings.  In the future she’d like to equip a locale to set up her food vending business to have better income.

loans.use: to buy display cases and turnover rings.

loans.name: Benia

texts.en:
Benia is 53 years old and has nine children.  She is married and still has two children who are in school.

Benia is in the agricultural business raising livestock (chickens, a cow, a water buffalo, goats, and pigs) in the Philippines. Benia requested a PHP 14,000.00 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and an additional pig to raise and sell.

Benia has been raising livestock for eight years now and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Benia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed, vitamins, and an additional pig to raise.

loans.name: Meu

texts.en:
Mrs. Meu S. (pictured above) and husband, Mr. Khan Seur, live along National Road Number Six, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1982 and have eight children: two sons and six daughters. One is married, three are garment factory workers, one sells soft drinks, two are in school and another one assists the parents in the business.   

Meu and her husband are vegetable farmers. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to help with her daughter’s business by purchasing additional soft drinks for resale.

loans.use: To help with her daughter’s business by purchasing additional soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Jessica Vianey

texts.es:
Jessica de profesión modista, iniciando hace seis años con iniciativa de su suegra el cual trabajan juntas para el bienestar de la familia, luego comienza  a invertir en tela con el fin de vender más ropa, así como reparación y ajuste de los vestidos de los clientes.
También vende zapatos, para ayudarse más, ya que soy muchos los gastos que pagar, en estos últimos meses ha producido más en ropa, a si como la demanda de sus clientes, todo gracias al financiamiento que Afodenic otorgo.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara dos rollos de tela satinada, cien adornos para pegar en los vestidos, treinta yardas para hacer vestido, botones, zipper, hilos. Lo que espera hacer buenas prendas para que se vendan rápido a precios bajos.
texts.en:
Jessica, a seamstress, began sewing with her mother in law six years ago to provide for her family.  Then she began to invest in cloth with the goal of selling more clothing, and also doing repairs and alterations on her clients' garments. She also sells shoes, to further help herself, since there are many expenses to cover. 

In the last few months she has produced more clothes to meet the demand of her clients, thanks to the financing provided by Afodenic. With this new loan she will buy two rolls of satin finish cloth, one hundred adornments to put on the clothing, thirty yards of cloth for dresses and suits, buttons, zippers, and thread. She wants to make good quality items so they sell rapidly at reasonable prices.

loans.use: To buy a variety of cloth to continue making clothing and to sell better quality, resulting in more income.

loans.name: Karol

texts.es: Karol, de 24 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija Alexa de 5 años y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. La tienda de abarrotes de Karol es una de las más concurridas de su barrio, el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera tienda en abrirse y la ultima en cerrarse. Tiene 4 años ejerciendo esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus vecinos, sin embargo se cansa mucho tener que permanecer parada todo el tiempo y a la vez tener que atender a todos sus clientes y complacerlos, pues solo no se da abasto. En adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el almacén principal de su barrio, por ello pide un préstamo para que pueda concretar poco a poco sus objetivos. Este el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará mas productos de primera necesidad para implementar su tienda de abarrotes y así incrementará su stock de productos.
texts.en: Karol is 24 years old and is a nice and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her loving daughter, Alexa who is 5 years old, what she wants most is to keep working hard to improve her quality of life. Karol’s small grocery store is one of the most visited in her neighborhood, her charisma and kindness when dealing with her customers has made her a favorite with her neighbors who don’t think twice about doing their shopping very early since it’s the first store that opens and the last one to close. Karol has been working for about 4 years in this field and what she enjoys most is talking to her neighbors although it’s very tiring standing up all the time and taking care of all of her customers and pleasing them since working alone is not enough. In the future, Karol hopes that her business will grow and that it will turn into the main store in her neighborhood which is why she needs the loan to meet her objectives little by little. This is her fourth loan with MFP and knows that if she pays on time she will be able to get another loan with greater ease and not create problems to her communal bank where she is well liked by the rest of the members. With the thousand nuevos soles Karol will buy supplies for her grocery store which will increase her stock.

loans.use: to purchase food for her general store

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
This humble woman who is sitting under a wooden roof, is Mrs. Keo, a domestic farmer in Baray district. She has owned and operated a farming business since she was single. She learned this skill from her parents. She can use her fertile land to plant rice crop annually. With this work, she can earn a profit of an average of $1.75 per day. She is a single woman and now lives with her sister, her niece and nephew, and she also depends on their incomes. 

Mrs. Keo will be using her loan to buy a used motorbike for her nephew to ride to his work place so he can get to work on time and save the motor taxi costs.

loans.use: to buy a used motorbike for her nephew to ride to his work place.

loans.name: Massa

texts.en:
Massa lives in the West Point area.  She attended school up to second grade.  She’s married and her husband is an office worker. They have 4 children, all of whom have now left home.

For the past eight years, she has been involved in the sale of dried fish. Her main challenge is the large amount of competition, but her business is going well.   Massa has requested this loan to purchase more fish. In the future, she would like to buy some land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA GENERACION III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de pollería, ella vende pollos a la brasa desde las 4:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m, la socia también prepara almuerzos y platos de fondo como milanesas y sopas, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de pollería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar los pollos como papas, condimentos y pollos.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is part of the Communal Bank “Nueva Generación III” (New Generation III), which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 34 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children. The member divides her time between her daily activities and her chicken business. She sells roasted chickens from 4am until 11pm. The member also prepares lunches and hearty dishes such as breaded meats and soups. Through this business, she is able to help her children get ahead. The member wants to expand and improve her chicken business. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for preparing her chicken dishes such as potatoes, condiments, and chickens.

The member is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, condiments, and chickens.

loans.name: Khudoykul

texts.ru: Худойкул проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 55 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а сын находится в Российской Федерации. Сам он имеет высшее экономическое образование. По профессии Худойкул работает уже 10 лет. Кроме того он занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи и сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа топлива и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Khudoykul lives in Shahrituz.  He is 55 years old, married, and has five children.  His wife is a housewife, and his son works in the Russian Federation.  He has a higher education as an economist. Khudoykul has worked in his profession for ten years.  Additionally, he farms.  In front of his home he has a plot of land where he grows vegetables and plants fruit trees.  He's been doing this for six years.  He is taking out a loan to buy fuel and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fuel and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.en:
Juan lives and works in the Santo Domingo canton of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is one of the largest cities in Ecuador, with 500,000 inhabitants. But you'd never guess the size of the city from the tranquil pace of life. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is in a tropical, humid area of Ecuador, renowned for its natural beauty, its huge markets, and its trade in livestock -- the largest in the country.

Juan is 48 years old and has three children. His two oldest, at 24 and 27 years old, no longer live with him. He lives with his 16-year-old son and his 42-year-old girlfriend, Mariana, who works in the house. His relatives have been ill, which has been hard for him, and Juan spends all of his spare time with his family.

This is Juan's first loan with Kiva. Juan is a general mechanic, and he will use it to buy tools and parts for his business. He works 15 hours a day without help, but because he enjoys the work so much, it doesn't feel that hard. 

Juan's ambition for the future is to have a more modernized mechanic's workshop and business and to own his own home. Juan is always working toward his most important dream: to realize a lifestyle than can provide a better life for his family. He hopes to get closer to these goals through his loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy auto-repair tools and parts.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea, 61 years old, and his wife, Khom, 56 years old, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1969 and have seven children - three sons and four daughters. Six are married and one is a garment worker.  

Chea is a motor taxi driver and his wife stays at home and does housework. He is asking for a loan of $500 to build a fence around his house.

loans.use: To build a fence around his house.

loans.name: Viviana Irene

texts.es:
Viviana de 35 años es vendedora de productos por catálogo (AVON, YANBAL), ella vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil (Ecuador). Ella tiene sus clientes fijos que recurrentemente hacen compras de bisuterías, joyas, maquillaje, que es lo que mas se promociona en estas revistas (la mayor parte de personas ofrecen mercadería por catálogos)
Recorre algunos sitios  entregando bajo pedido, pero muchas veces teme ser asaltada ya que la zona en la que vive es insegura.

Está casada con Erick con quien ha procreado un hijo de 13 años que es un buen estudiante de una institución fiscal. En estos momentos desea un crédito para comprar más mercadería como es perfumes, colonias, desodorantes, y también vender otros productos de marca L'EBEL para ver como le va. 

En el futuro y dependiendo como le vaya en sus ganancias con sus ventas, desea mejorar el aspecto de su vivienda para tener mejores condiciones y llegar a ser directora de ventas de las líneas que ofrece.
texts.en:
Viviana is 35 years old and sells catalogue products (AVON, YANBAL). She lives in the suburb of Guayaquil in Ecuador. She has regular customers who regularly buy costume jewelry, jewelry, and make-up. These are the items which are the most advertised in these magazines (the majority of people offer catalogue merchandise). She travels to some places to deliver orders, but often she is afraid of being assaulted since the area where she lives is not very safe.

She is married to Erick, with whom she has a 13-year old son who is a good student at a business school. At this time, she requests a loan to purchase more merchandise such as perfume, cologne, and deodorant, and also to sell other products by L’EBEL to see how it goes.

In the future, and depending on how her sales translate into profits, she hopes to improve her housing situation to be able to live in better conditions and become sales director for the lines she currently offers.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, cologne, and deodorant.

loans.name: Essé Yawa

texts.fr:
Essé est une femme de 29 ans, elle est mariée à un gérant et a 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 1990. Elle achète et revend pour sa clientèle composée de toutes personnes des  produits d’alimentation générale. Elle s’approvisionne dans divers marchés locaux de lomé.
Essé sollicite son quatrième crédit pour l’achat de divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Essé, age 29, is married to a manager and has three children. Since 1990, she's been reselling food products. She gets her supplies in various local markets in Lomé, and resells her products to a very wide clientele.

Essé is seeking her fourth loan in order to buy various food products.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 21-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings. 

In 2009, he started to work as logistic transactions laborer. He works hard since he has a job and simultaneously he is pursuing his education. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for his university education fees. He is studying business administration and this is his second year. 

In the future, he is planning to start his career in a large company to gain experience and be able to help his parents with his income.

loans.use: to pay for his university education fees.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 51 years old and married with one adult-aged child. She has been engaged in the piggery business for six years. She said it is not easy work to take on this occupation. But because of the determination and inspiration that her child provides, she does everything for the benefit of their underprivileged lifestyle.

For that reason, Marites is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to provide for the needs of her hogs by giving them better feed and vitamins. She is patiently growing her business into a bigger venture. She hopes that someday she will achieve her dream and lift her family from poor living.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Ndiaga  Adj Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Ndiaga Adj est créé le 5 octobre 2011, il est composé de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier, elles sont amies, parentes et sont en parfaite entente.


Madame Assy la responsable est âgée de 51 ans, elle est mariée mère de sept enfants; elle s'active dans le commerce d'alimentation; elle possède une boutique à domicile.Elle est debout tout à fait à droite habillée en en rouge.

Elle achète ses produits(riz, sucre, huile, oignons, poivre....) dans la ville et dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour revendre dans son village.

Elle souhaite avec son prêt renforcer son commerce pour pouvoir se faire beaucoup de bénéfices.


Elle compte avec ses bénéfices épargner un montant consistant qui lui permettra de gérer les besoins de ses enfants et pouvoir même acheter des moutons et chèvres pour constituer un cheptel et revendre de temps en temps.
texts.en:
The 'Ndiaga Adj' community bank was formed on October 5th, 2011.  It has fifteen [female] members who live in the same neighborhood.  They are friends and relations and they live in perfect harmony.

Assy, the group's leader, is 51 years old.  She is married and has seven children.  She sells food and has a store in her home.  She is standing on the far right in the photo, dressed in red.

Assy buys her products (rice, sugar, oil, onions, pepper...) in town and in the weekly markets.  She re-sells these products in her village.

Assy hopes to use her loan to strengthen her business so that she can make a lot of profits.

Assy plans to use her profits to save a consistent sum which will allow her to manage her children's needs and be able to buy sheep and goats to have livestock to resell from time to time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is married and has two daughters. One of them studies in a local school. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his passengers. Zarina supports her husband financially by making threads from used clothes. She purchases the used clothes from the market (Landa Bazar) and then gets the thread out of those clothes and sells it in the market for a profit. She is also a very good housewife and performs her daily routine duties very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to repair his auto rickshaw. This will allow him to save his business asset and also to provide better quality transport services to his passengers. He has operated his business for many years and Zarina is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for him.

loans.use: to repair her husband's auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 43 years old and lives in Helen Village, Larena, Siquijor. She is married, has three children and earns a living by selling a variety of foods. She earns about PHP 10,000 a month and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more ingredients and spices. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for seven months and her goals are to send all of her children to school and grow her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and spices for food a vending business

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es: La señora María Josefa a sus 69 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 37 años. La señora María Josefa vivía en un municipio de Antioquia y debido a la situación de violencia presentado en éste, se vio en la necesidad de trasladarse para la ciudad de Medellín hace aproximadamente 15 años. En el año 1996, la señora María Josefa inicia su propio negocio en la ciudad de Medellín de venta de fritos como pasteles y empanadas y además gaseosas, posteriormente las entidades encargadas de manejar el espacio publico le otorgaron a la señora María Josefa un kiosco para que pudiera trabajar, desde ese entonces la señora María Josefa pudo sacar adelante a su hijo luego de haber quedado viuda. La jornada laboral de la señora María Josefa es de 7:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. La señora María Josefa requiere de la compra de surtido para su negocio tal como gaseosas, snacks, galletas, y dulces. Con lo anterior la señora María Josefa podrá incrementar sus ventas y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. El sueño de la señora María Josefa es agrandar su negocio y tenerlo acondicionado con un mejor piso y más sillas.
texts.en: María Josefa is 69 years old.  She is the mother of a 37 year old son.  She lived in the town of Antioquia but because of the violence occurring in the East, she felt it was necessary to relocate to the city of Medellín approximately 15 years ago.  In 1996, she began her own business selling fried foods such as pies and empenadas (stuffed pastries) as well as soft drinks.  Later, the company responsible for managing the public space granted her a kiosk where she could work.  Since then, and after having been widowed, María Josefa was able to get her son ahead in life. Her work day is from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm.  She needs to purchase inventory for her business such as soft drinks, snacks, cookies, and sweets.  With this loan, she will be able to increase sales and, in this way, improve her quality of life.  Her dream is to enlarge her store and have it outfitted with a better floor and additional seating.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her business such as soft drinks, snacks, cookies, and sweets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new clothes.

loans.name: Dios Prospera Group

texts.en:
Julia is the mother of eight children, three of whom live together with her and her long-term partner in their home. The family lives in a Batey near the city of La Romana. A Batey is a rural town built for the sugarcane industry workers.

Julia says her most favorites things to do are to work and to eat. Her most important challenge is to have her own house, built safe and comfortable. Since almost four years ago, Julia started her business with a loan she took. She bought a small amount of merchandise for resale. After eight loans, she has been able to expand her business, with more clients and more products.

Julia is receiving her ninth loan from Esperanza Internacional and will invest this capital to purchase sugar, candies, rice, fruits and vegetables. With her business profits, she will reinvest in her business. She dreams of having a big grocery store. She thanks you for supporting her and her group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: to buy sugar, candies, rice, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Estrella De Luz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Estrella de Luz lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Marlene quien se dedica al comercio de ropa usada y nueva, bisutería, chiverías y comida desde hace aproximadamente 8 años. Ella  invertirá el crédito en cada uno de sus negocios principalmente en ropa ya que tiene muchos encargos.
Las otras integrantes son Ceneida  quien se dedica al comercio de comida desde hace 7 años e Yesenia quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y cajetas.
texts.en:
The group “Estrella de Luz” (Star of Light) consists of three hardworking and enterprising individuals. One of them is Marlene, who has been selling new and used clothing, trinkets, yogurt, and food for approximately eight years. She will invest her loan in each one of her businesses, but primarily in clothing since she already has many orders.

The other members are Ceneida, who has been selling food for seven years, and Yesenia who sells clothing and caramels.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Denny

texts.es: La señora Carmen vende ropa  esta casada con el señor Darío, actualmente se encuentran viviendo por la urbanización Cotoca en casa propia. La Sra. Carmen se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa Brasilera, esta actividad la viene desarrollando desde hace más de un año, ella entrega todo su producto a crédito a un plazo máximo de un mes. La solicitante cuenta con una segunda actividad como fuente de ingreso que el de profesora normalista. Su cónyuge trabaja como auxiliar administrativo en una empresa de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. Carmen comprara material de construccion para terminar de construir su casa y asi brindar mayor comodidad a su familia,  La solicitante agradeció a la institución por la oportunidad brindada y por la rapidez con la que se lo atendió.
texts.en:
Carmen sells clothes.  She is married to Darío, and they currently live in their own house in the Cotoca neighborhood.  Carmen buys and sells Brazilian clothes.  She has been developing this business activity for over a year.  She delivers all of her products for credit for a maximum of one month.

She has a second business activity as a source of income; she is an elementary school teacher.  Her husband works as an administrative assistant for a company in the city of Santa Cruz.
