Carmen will use the loan to buy construction material to finish building her house.  This will make her family more comfortable.  She is grateful to the institution for the opportunity given to her and for the prompt way they took care of it.

loans.use: to finish building her house.

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Odile est une femme de 32 ans, sépartée de son mari et mère d'un enfant de 9 ans. Elle est commerçante et a ouvert une petite parfumerie qu'elle gère elle même depuis quelques années. C'est grâce à elle qu'elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille. grâce à son accueil chaleureux et ses relations de bon voisinage, elle a conquis et fidélisé une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps, et là, elle ne parvient plus à la satisfaire totale d'où la nécessité de ce crédit dans son activité en ce moment parce qu'elle lui permettra d'augmenter son stock de marchandises (mèches et produits cosmétiques). Ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Odile is a 32-year-old woman who is separated from her husband and the mother of one child, aged 9.   She works in retail and has opened a small grocery store which she has been running by herself for a few years.  This business allows her to support her family.

Thanks to her warm welcome and to her good relationships with her neighbors, Odile has managed to attract and retain an increasingly large group of customers.  However, she can no longer meet customer demand and this is the reason why she is requesting this loan to boost her stock of staple goods.  

This loan will allow Odile to increase her sales and consequently her profit margin.  Part of her profits will be reinvested into expanding her activity, while the remaining money will be used to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: Augmenter les mèches et produits cosmétiques

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a dedicated, determined and honest mother of a lovely family. She is based in Kericho, Kenya. The rich soil of this area makes it one of the nation’s biggest tea growing regions, lending it the nickname of “the tea region”. 

For the past 10 years, Caroline has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. These ventures have allowed her to earn a decent income. 

Caroline passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is the lack of funds. However, this challenge has not made her give up. She mobilized other enterprising women like her in her village. 

Caroline is requesting a loan to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farming. Having gone through training on loan management, she is educated on how to utilize the loan and save more money. Through this loan, Caroline will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs and expand her horticulture business to international markets.

If there is someone you should consider lending to this festive season, then that person is Caroline!

loans.use: To buy seeds and expand her horticulture farming

loans.name: Brenda Guadalupe

texts.en:
Mrs. Brenda D. is married and has 5 children of 10, 8, 6, 4 and 2 years of age. They live in the city of Merida in the State of Yucatan. She started selling shoes after her husband was left unemployed and while he looked for a job. With his severance pay they invested it and started to sell among their family and little by little the business started to grow. It's already been two years since Brenda decided to start her business, whose only objective is to support her husband and her family while going through those difficult times.

Persistence, strength and hard hard, and the great love that Brenda feels for her family, is what has made it possible for them to obtain a daily sustenance. Now she needs a loan of $275 that she will put towards the purchase of more merchandise, to increase her sales, and increasing their income. Help Brend and her family. Your generosity will be of great help. Don't wait any longer, they will thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Brenda D. es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 10,8,6 , 4 y 2 años de edad, ellos viven en la comunidad de Mérida, en el estado de Yucatán. Ella inició la venta de zapatos a rías de que su esposo se quedó sin trabajo y mientras encontraba otro empleo, con lo de su liquidación, invirtió y empezó a vender entre sus familiares y poco a poco fue creciendo su negocio. Ya son dos años de que Brenda inició con su proyecto, cuy único objetivo fue el apoyar a su esposo y a su familia en los momentos difíciles por los que atravesaban.

El empeño, la fuerza y el trabajo, aunado el a el gran amor que Brenda le tiene a su familia, es lo que ha hecho posible le obtención de un sustento diario. Ahora ella necesita de un crédito de $ 275 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para la compra de más mercancía y así incrementar sus ventas, obteniendo de esta forma mayores ingresos. Apoya a Brenda y su familia, tu generosidad será de gran ayuda, no lo dudes más, ellos te lo van a agradecer.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucía is married and has two kids, ages 6 and 2. Five years ago, shortly after the birth of her first son, family expenses increased and her husband's salary could not cover them all. So Lucía, who didn't want to neglect her baby, began selling beauty products via catalogue to her neighbors and relatives. It went well for her, since she's a good saleswoman and offered comfortable payment plans. After a little while, she decided to buy clothes with the money she had saved, and began selling that as well. Since that time, she has dedicated herself to the sale of beauty products and clothing.

Lucía currently wishes to increase her sales, which is why she's asking for a loan of $1,200. She will repay it within two to four months, since she plans on investing this money and moving her products quickly. From her experience, she has learned the good seasons to sell her product and how to regain her investment. Lucía awaits your help to allow her business to continue to grow and help her confront the building family expenses as her children get older.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Lucía esta casada y tiene dos hijos, uno de 6 años de edad y el otro de 2 años; hace cinco años atrás luego del nacimiento de su primer hijo, los gastos familiares se incrementaron y con el sueldo de su esposo no era suficiente para cubrir estos gastos, por lo que Lucía para no descuidar a su hijo que era un bebe, empezó ofreciendo productos de belleza por catalogo a sus familiares y vecinos y le fue muy bien, ya que ella también es buena vendedora y los planes de pago eran cómodos para sus clientes, así con el paso del tiempo y con un pequeño capital que logró ahorrar decidió comprar ropa para venderla también y desde entonces se dedica a la venta de ropa y de artículos de belleza.

Lucía actualmente desea incrementar su negocio por lo que requiere de un préstamo por US $ 1,200 los cuales ofrece pagar en un período de 2 a 4 meses, ya que piensa invertir este dinero y darle una rotación bastante rápida a sus productos, por que ella sabe de las temporadas buenas y de cómo recuperar su inversión lo cual lo ha aprendido con la experiencia. Lucía espera su ayuda para continuar creciendo y así poder enfrentar los gastos que se incrementan a medida que sus hijos van creciendo.

loans.use: Buy beauty products and clothing.

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.en:
Blanca Flor is 45 years old, is married and has four children. She and her husband have a small store in their house where they sell thread, needles, ribbons, wools and all types of supplies for decorating dresses. Blanca is part of the “María del Carmen Group 1”, along with Juana Hernandez Dominguez (who raises and sells pigs) and María Lidia Alvarado Constanti (who has a grocery store in her house). With the loan, Blanca Flor wants to invest in merchandise for her store and she also wants to be able to sell to other stores in the community. Juana would like to buy more pigs in order to increase the number of animals she has, and thereby her sales. María Lidia wants to buy non-perishable foods to increase the sales in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

BLANCA FLOR , TIENE 45 AÑOS , CASADA 4 HIJOS, JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO TIENEN UN LOCAL EN SU CASA DONDE VENDEN HILOS , AGUJAS , LISTONES, CINTAS, LANAS Y TODO TIPO DE ARTICULOS PARA ADORNAR LOS VESTIDOS . BLANCA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO MARIA DEL CARMEN 1 , JUNTO CON JUANA HERNANDEZ DOMINGUEZ ( ESTA DEDICADA A LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE PUERCOS ) Y MARIA LIDIA ALVARADO CONSTANTI ( TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA ) CON EL PRESTAMO BLANCA FLOR ESPERA INVERTIR EN MERCADERIA PARA LA MERCERIA Y ADEMAS PODER SALIR A VENDER A LAS TIENDAS DE LA COMUNIDAD . JUANA ESPERA COMPRAR MAS PUERCOS PARA AUMENTAR LA CRIANZA Y LA VENTADE ELLOS POR SU PARTE MARIA LIDIA QUIERE INVERTIR EN ALIMENTOS NO PERECIBLES PARA AUMENTAR LAS VENTAS EN SU TIENDITA.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for sewing store; To buy pigs; To buy merchandise for a small grocery store

loans.name: Namig

texts.en:
Namig A. lives in Beylagan city, situated in southwest Azerbaijan. He is married and he has 2 children. Namig has rented a small café in Beylagan. He prepares different meals at his café and sells beer in the summer.

He wants to repair his café and to buy some tables and chairs. He needs $1200 to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica has a small shop where she sells handicraft clothing exclusively. (specifically skirts, ponchos and footwear) Her husband works as an attendant in a gym. Their home is located in the zone called Alto Chijini, in the city of La Paz, and the shop is located in the zone called El Rosario.

This is the first time she has requested a loan. She will use the money to buy clothing in bulk from her suppliers. Her business makes her eligible for this loan. She has commercial experience and the shop is situated in one of the most commercial and popular areas of the city of La Paz.

Veronica tiene un puesto donde vende exclusivamente ropa para cholita (específicamente polleras, mantas y calzados) y su esposo trabaja atendiendo un gimnasio. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto Chijini de la ciudad de La Paz y su puesto esta ubicado en la zona El Rosario. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de ropa por docena, de sus proveedores. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia de comerciante además que su puesto esta ubicado en una de las zonas más comerciales y populares de la ciudad de La Paz.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy merchandise for their clothing business.

loans.name: Maria Ysabel

texts.es:
Maria Ysabel is 27 years old and has 4 children. They live together in the district called Florencia de Mora in the province of Trujillo. She was only able to study up until her 4th year at secondary school, but today she is a partner in a popular little restaurant in her neighborhood, and she's president of The Mothers Club of Florencia de Mora which is located in the front of her house. She decided to earn her own money washing clothes so she could start her own business.

She began her business buying small quantities of sweets which she could sell after 2pm outside of her house, and with the little bit of money she was earning, she began to also sell meals after 7pm. Along with this, she also has a small cobbler business. Maria Ysabel does whatever she can to cover the costs of her home with these three small businesses, and pay for the education of her children.

She learned about Movimiento Manuela Ramos from a friend, and received her first loan of $100 which she invested in her shoe business. She began making one dozen pairs, and now 5 dozen pairs. On Saturdays and Sundays she sells the shoes around town, and also sends some to her brother to sell in Piura. With this loan which she will repay in 4 months, she would like to purchase materials for her shoe business in greater quantity, as the demand grows with the holiday season. Maria Ysabel's dream is to be able to have her own house, and open up a good restaurant there.

La señora Maria Ysabel tiene 27 años, solo estudio hasta 4º año de Secundaria, tiene 4 hijos que dependen de ella y vive en el Distrito de Florencia de Mora, Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento La Libertad. La Señora María es socia de un comedor popular de su barrio y es Presidenta del Club de Madres de Florencia de Mora situado al frente de su casa, decide ganar su propio dinero lavando ropa de otras personas para ahorrar y poner su propio negocio. Inicia su negocio comprando en pequeñas cantidades todo tipo de golosinas para vender a partir de las 2:00 pm. a fuera de su casa, con lo poco que iba ganando también empezó a vender comida a partir de las 7:00 pm. Paralelamente tiene otro pequeño negocio de confección de zapatos. Ella trata de una u otra manera solventar los gastos de su casa con estos tres pequeños negocios, sobre todo la educación de sus hijos. La señora se entera de la existencia del Movimiento Manuela Ramos por medio de una amiga y forma el Grupo Mientras Tanto “La Pérbola”. Obtuvo su primer crédito de S/.300 ($ 100). el cual invirtió en la confección de zapatos, ella empezó haciendo 1 docena, y ahora hace 5 docenas. Los sábados y domingos se dedica a venderlos como ambulante y otra parte los envía a su hermano a venderlos a Piura. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 800.00 ($ 267) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró materiales para la confección de zapatos en mayor cantidad ya que la demanda será mayor en las fiestas de fin año. El sueño más grande que tiene la señora Maria Ysabel es tener su propia casa y allí colocar un buen restaurante.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS NEEDED FOR HER SHOE BUSINESS AND MEET THE GREATER DEMAND OF THE HOLIDAY SEASON.

loans.name: Phoury

texts.en:
Mrs. T. Phoury, 40, and her husband, Mr. Teav Tean, 43, have been married since 1990. They have no children. Phoury and her family are living on an island of the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Phoury has been a silk weaver since she was 16 years old. It's a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband learned to weave silk from her in 1993 and stared weaving silk in the same year. Now, he is a good silk weaver.

Phoury is requesting her fifth loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $200. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and to pay for the preparation of her husband’s loom.

loans.use: Buy silk materials and prepare loom

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista, age 37, is married and lives with her husband. She owns a clothing business, which she started in 2006. From her sales, she makes a monthly profit of about $80. She works selling the clothes from 5am to 8pm daily.

In the past, Teopista took out a successful loan which she used to buy more clothing stock. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She belongs to a loan group called Tujitume.

loans.use: To buy clothing inventory

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco lives in his father's house in the Ilo Puerto street which is in the Tupac Amaru area, in the city of La Paz. He was educated in hotel services (Escuela Hotelera) and worked on events by providing services, such as lunches to the Ministry of Defense. Later, with their savings, they put up a business in the city of El Alto, which is currently doing very well. This is why he left the ministry and now focuses on his own business. He is requesting a loan to purchase a "spiedera" machine (one of those that shows a chicken in a glass case) and to begin selling fast food at night. His previous credit history is what qualifies him as a good customer able to obtain a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

El señor vive en casa de su padre, en la calle puerto Ilo de la zona Tupac Amaru de la Ciudad de La Paz. Cursó estudios en la Escuela Hotelera, trabajó atendiendo eventos y proveía un servicio de almuerzos al Ministerio de Defensa. Posteriormente, con sus ahorros puso un negocio en la Ciudad de El Alto al cuál le va muy bien, por eso dejó el Ministerio y ahora se dedica a su negocio. Solicita crédito para comprar una maquina spiedera (de esas que exhiben el pollo en una vitrina) y vender comida rápida durante la noche. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To purchase machinery for his business. (ADQUISICIÓN DE MAQUINARIA PARA SU NEGOCIO)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To relocate her soft drink store and buy more drinks.

loans.name: Yanneth Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs Yanneth del Socorro E. runs a beverage store with a lot of dedication. Her store is located in the discrict of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. She does this job since six years in order to support her household and to provide food to her two small children who depend on her.

As she cares a lot for her children and in order to improve her business, she has requested the support from CEPRODEL. She requests a loan that will allow her to purchase fruits to prepare drinks and to buy canned juices and sodas.

She would like to emphasize that the loan will help her as well as her business and her small children.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Yanneth del Socorro E. se dedica al negocio de la venta de refrescos en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Se dedica a esta labor muy esforzadamente desde hace seis años con el fin de brindarle el mantenimiento a su hogar de habitación y llevar el alimento a sus dos pequeños hijos que tanto necesitan de su apoyo. Para ello se esfuerza grandemente y para mejorar la condición de su negocio ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan adquirir las frutas para elaborar sus refrescos y además para la compra de los jugos enlatados y gaseosas.

Por medio del crédito es necesario destacar que se beneficia tanto ella, su negocio y sus pequeños hijos.

loans.use: To purchase fruits to prepare drinks and to buy canned juices and sodas

loans.name: Alicia Antonia

texts.es:
Alicia is a member of the community Bank Renacer (Rebirth)

Alicia lives together with her partner, is 20 years old and has a daughter. Alicia has a grain mill in her home where she processes grains, which she buys in the Nery Garcia market, and processes them into flour and other products which she sells wholesale in the Grau market. Additionally, Alicia farms her land in Ocros.

Alicia needs a loan of 1000 soles (USD $375), money which will be used to purchase corn, wheat and barley.

Alicia’s dreams are for her child to become a professional, to improve her business and have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal Renacer.

Alicia es conviviente, tiene 20 años y 1 hija, Alicia tiene un molino de granos en su casa donde procesa cereales, dichos productos los compra en el mercado Nery García y lo transforma en harina y otros productos que vende en el mercado Grau por mayor. Además Alicia se dedica a la agricultura en sus terrenos de Ocros.

Alicia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz, trigo, cebada.

Los sueños de Alicia son que su hijo sea profesional, mejorar su negocio y tener casa propia.

loans.use: Alicia needs a loan of 1000 soles (USD $375), money which will be used to purchase corn, wheat and barley.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thi Nguyen is 21 years old. She has one child who is 2 years old. When they first started their family, she and her husband did not have stable jobs, so her parents made it possible for them to work at the family’s lumber factory. In 2006, she planned with her husband to join the Fund to borrow money for investment in their family’s factory. Thanks to that initial investment and the couple’s hard work, the parents have shared partnership with the couple. The family’s income has reached 4,000,000 VND per month. In this round of funding she is requesting 9,000,000 VND to buy wood for manufacturing.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thiết năm nay 21 tuổi. Chị đã có 1 con năm nay 2 tuổi. Khi mới lập gia đình vợ chồng chị chưa có công việc ổn định vì thế bố mẹ chị đã tạo điều kiện cho vợ chồng chị làm tại xưởng mộc của gia đình. Năm 2006 chị đã bàn với chồng tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để góp với bố mẹ đầu tư cho xưởng mộc của gia đình, đến nay nhờ có sự góp vốn ban đầu và sự làm ăn chăm chỉ của hai vợ chồng, bố mẹ chị đã chia lợi nhuận cho vợ chồng chị, thu nhập của gia đình đạt 4.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để tiếp tục góp vốn đầu tư mua gỗ để sản xuất tại xưởng mộc.

loans.use: Buy more wood

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya has been running her retail business for four years. She started as a small vendor in a store called “Kashtan” (“Chestnut”). The store is located in the central street of her hometown which is very convenient for customers who shop downtown Ordzhonikidze. Natalya sells household chemicals and little necessities that each family can use at home. Presently, she has about $6000 in turnover capital. Her income is about $900 each month.

Natalya would like to keep her income stable and increase her turnover capital which is why she is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to be repaid in two months. We believe consistent demand, outstanding credit history and entrepreneurial enthusiasm will guarantee loan repayment without any delinquencies.

Note: this is a short term “seasonal” loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Two years ago Carmen was a wandering saleswoman selling clothes; she sold her products from house to house. She started with only a bit of merchandise, mainly women's tops. As time has gone on her sales have increased and with her earnings she has been able to invest more in her business, and a year ago she rented a small stall in the Villa Nueva Market. Now she needs more capital to keep investing in her business and earn more.

Carmen asked for a loan from FAPE to invest in some men's and women's trousers, also in underwear and clothes for all the family. She wants to have a better business, better earnings and to give her kids and her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Carmen hace dos años era una vendedora de ropa ambulante, vendía sus productos de casa en casa, empezó su negocio con poca mercadería principalmente blusas para mujeres. Con el paso del tiempo sus ventas fueron creciendo y con las ganancias pudo invertir mas en su negocio, hace un año tuvo la idea de alquilar un local comercial, el cual esta situado en el Mercado de Villa Nueva. Ahora ella necesita más capital para poder seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y tener más ganancias. Por eso Carmen solicito un préstamo a FAPE, para poder invertir en comprar pantalones para hombre y mujer, también para ropa interior, y ropa para toda la familia... Ella quiere tener un mejor negocio, tener mejores ingresos y así darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas y su familia.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothes for her clothes selling business/Compra de mas variedad de ropa, para su negocio de venta de ropa.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana, socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de juanes el cual es una de las comidas tradicionales de la región. El negocio lo realiza en el frontis de su casa en el Jr. Leoncio Prado Nº 1393, lugar donde acuden los clientes, como también sale a entregar los pedidos que le hacen y lo distribuye a los Snaks de la ciudad.

Con este crédito de S/. 2,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de arroz, en saco, aceite en galón, también quiere implementar el negocio con la venta de salchipapas para lo cual necesita comprar un carrito salchipapero y los insumos para este negocio como las cremas en baldes, (Ketchup, mostaza), gaseosas de diferentes marcas, tamaños y sabores, también comprará los demás productos que a diario necesita para la preparación de sus juanes como gallina, hoja de bijao, aceitunas, etc., para atender a sus clientes y pedidos que le hacen.

Juan tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo, es una mujer responsable, cautelosa  y  trabajadora. Su meta es implementar el negocio con la venta de salchipapas por las noches.
texts.en:
Juana, a member of the communal bank "Las Orquídeas", lives in the region and province of San Martín, in the Tarapoto district. She works selling juanes, a popular local dish of chicken, rice, olives and spices wrapped in a large banana-like leaf. She runs her business from the front wall of her home at 1393 Jr. Leoncio Prado; her clients come to the site to enjoy her food and she prepares her food there before making deliveries to clients and to fast food stores that distribute her products.

With this loan for 2500 Peruvian soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of rice by the sack and cooking oil by the gallon. She also wants to launch a business selling salchipapas, a popular fast food. To do so she needs to buy a cart from which to sell the salchipapas and the ingredients she will need to make the business a success, such as ketchup, mustard, and soft drinks in a variety of brands, sizes and flavors. She will also buy the ingredients she uses daily to prepare her juanes, including chicken, the big bajao leaves she wraps the chicken and rice in, olives, etc., in order to serve her clients and fill her orders.

Juana is 44 years old and lives with her husband. She is a responsible, cautious and hard working woman. Her goal is to launch the new business selling salchipapas at night.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will be invested in the purchase of rice and cooking oil and in the acquisition of a cart from which to sell fast food (salchipapas).

loans.name: Jamilay

texts.ru: Мухиддинова Джамиля жительница района Абдурахмони Джоми. Еи 47 лет, она замужем и имеет четверых детей. Уже 16 лет занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку   на центральном рынке района. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить товар. Это поможет увеличить ассортимент товара и получить прибыль. Кроме того таким образом она сможет привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Jamilay M. lives in the Abdurahmoni Jomi region. She is 47 years old, married and has 4 children. Jamilay has been working in retail for the last 16 years. She manages a market stall at the central market. Jamilay wants to take out this loan in order to purchase more goods wholesale. This will allow her to expand the variety of goods she can offer at her market stall and will improve revenue. This will also help Jamilay to attract new clients. She is planning to pay back the loan in then next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve sales

loans.name: Rogger Kenny

texts.es:
Rogger es socio del Banco Comunal San Gabriel.
Rogger tiene 27 años y es soltero.
Rogger tiene su negocio de alquiler equipo de sonido y luces, empezó con este negocio hace 4 años. Rogger alquila en su mayoría semanalmente, y todos sus instrumentos de trabajo los tiene en su casa.
Rogger necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de luces, reflectores. 
Rogger sueña con tener equipos de sonido para  alquilarlos para eventos y conciertos grandes.  Rogger  También quisiera comprar una consola y poner una discoteca.
texts.en:
Rogger is a member of the San Gabriel Community Bank. He is 27 years old and single. His business, which he started four years ago, rents out sound and lighting equipment. Rogger rents mostly by the week, and all his supplies are kept at his home. He is requesting a loan of $150 to invest in the purchase of lights and spotlights. His dream is to have sound equipment good enough to rent out for large events and concerts. He would also like to purchase a console table and set up a discotheque.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lights and spotlights.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort B. is a 62-year-old married woman and the mother of six kids. Currently all of her children are working in their various professions, such as: teaching, welding, and hairdressing. She is into the sale of fresh fish, the business through which she makes a living. She has been selling fresh fish for thirteen years to support her family. She travels to various fishing communities to buy her stock of fish in order to avoid dealing with middlemen because middlemen buy from the fish farmers and re-sell to her at higher prices. 

She is now seeking a loan to buy fresh fish in bulk to better serve her loyal customers. She hopes to use a portion of her profits to further support her business' expansion and growth. Comfort is a member of a loan group known as the "Abrabopa" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish in bulk

loans.name: Safiétou

texts.fr: Safiétou Mané, 48 ans, mariée  mère de 02 enfants à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Kandé Alassane depuis 8 ans. Elle veut acheter un réfrigérateur, des sacs de pain de singe (fruit du baobab), du sucre pour  préparer et vendre des glaces, des jus et des crèmes glacées. Son souhait est de renforcer son activité afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.  Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Safiétou Mané, age 48, is married and the mother of two children who are in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Kandé Alassane for eight years and wants to buy a refrigerator, sacks of "monkey bread" (the fruit of the baobab tree), and some sugar to make and sell ice, juices, and ice cream. Her wish is to bolster her business to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator, baobab fruit, and sugar to make ice, juices and ice cream

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a market entrepreneur from Mukachevo. She runs a small venture selling footwear in the local market next to a bus station. Eva’s merchandise is always in demand as her footwear comes in good varieties, is affordable, and a decent quality. She has been in business for 5 years. Currently, her turnover capital amounts to 50,000 Grivnas.

Eva believes determination and integrity are the main principles in business and in relations with customers. Her customers have never been upset with the quality of her merchandise. Many come back for another pair of shoes or boots. Eva is seeking a loan of 6,000 Grivnas to increase assorted merchandise. She is hoping to repay the current loan in 8 months.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señorita Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, no tiene hijos y posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01 año, ella se dedica al engorde ganado menor; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual adquirió ganado para poder engordarlo y venderlo como carne en las ferias de Ilave. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 5 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir ganado menor (ovejas y porcinos); con la finalidad seguir realizando la actividad de engorde, ya que le brinda buenas ganancias, su anhelo es implementar una tienda de abarrotes y en el futuro poner una ferretería que le brindaría mas ingresos aún.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the "03 de Mayo" Communal Bank in Llave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 20 years old, in a common law marriage, has no children and has completed her secondary education. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year, fattening small livestock. With her first loan of 500 soles, she acquired livestock to fatten and sell for meat at fairs in Llave. With this loan of 1000 soles, which she promises to pay back in five monthly payments, she will be able to acquire small livestock (sheep and pigs). She will continue fattening these animals because it brings in good earnings, and then she wishes to establish a grocery store and in the future a hardware store that with bring her still more income.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase small livestock (sheep and pigs)

loans.name: En

texts.en:
En S. is 39 years old and resides in the Battambang province with her husband. She sells grocery items, CDs and VCDs. On average, she makes $7 every day, while her husband is a soldier doctor and earns $10 per day. This couple has two young children.

En S. would like to take out a loan to expand her grocery store by adding more products to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store

loans.name: Salmo 23 Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Salmo 23 es originario del municipio de Catarina perteneciente a la Ciudad de Masaya, es uno de los mas cercanos a la capital, este es un lugar turístico, estas mujeres trabajan en diferentes actividades tres de ellas venden tortillas, las elaboran y venden en su casa, entregan a otras personas que ofrecen quesillos a los turistas ya que este es el complemento de este producto; la única que tiene una pulpería es doña Tania del Socorro.
Doña Celia es la coordinadora del grupo, este la eligió porque es muy responsable, ella es una mujer de 43 años, desde joven aprendió este oficio, madre de 4 hijos de los cuales solamente dos viven con ella, sus hijos le ayudan a vender y elaborar las tortillas. Ella afirma que con el crédito ella ha incrementado sus ventas porque ahora tiene mas clientes y le queda un margen de ganancia mayor, después de cada crédito ella ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su taller. Ella ha sido beneficiada con las capacitaciones de Adim, estas le han servido para mejorar en la presentación de su negocio y personal, anima a las integrantes del grupo a quedar bien en sus pagos para seguir adelante, sueña con mejorar su vivienda y dar estudio a sus hijos. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, él trabaja en elaboración de artesanía en el pueblo vecino de Niquinohomo, expresa “pero la dueña de mi negocio soy yo y esto lo mío”
El grupo esta claro de que debe de ser puntual y solidario para seguir siendo beneficiaria de estos créditos porque en otro lugar no les prestan si no tienen garantías y por esto nunca habían trabajado con crédito.
texts.en:
The Salmo 23 group is based in the Catarina municipality in the city of Masaya. Because it is one of the closest cities to the capital, it is a tourist area. These women work in different activities; three sell tortillas which they make and sell from home to others who use them to make desserts which are sold to the tourists and go well with this product. The only one with a store is Ms Tania del Socorro. Celia is the group's coordinator. She was chosen because of her responsibility. She is 43 years old, and has learned her trade since she was young. She is the mother of 4 children, two of whom live with her. Her children assist in selling and in making tortillas. She says that through loans she has increased her sales as she has gained customers and increased her profit margin while improving conditions in her shop. She has benefited from the Adin trainings, which have helped her to improve the appearance of her and of her business. She encourages the members of the group to make their payments and progress. She dreams of improving her home and of providing her children with an education. Her husband helps her with the expenses of home, working as a craftsman in the neighboring town of Niquinohomo. She says "The business, however, is mine."The group understands the need for prompt payment and unity to keep enjoying the benefits of these loans, as no other organization will lend without collateral, the reason for which they have never worked with loans in the past.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina  es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino.
Cristina es conviviente tiene 36 años, dos hijos de 11 y 4 años que están en la escuela estatal.
Cristina ha trabajado limpiando casas, después  por ocho años trabajo con una señora en la venta de comida, en  Pista Nueva, en la zona  también  vendía ropa usada, averiguo como era el negocio y con sus ahorros  decidió independizarse y  se puso a vender ropa usada.   
Cristina necesita una presta, de 1200 soles, para la compra de mercadería,  adornos para el día de la madre, flores  artesanales entre otros.
Desde que esta en Finca, ha sido de mucho apoyo, puede ahorrar  y realizar ahorros voluntarios, las charlas que reciben han sido de ayuda para su negocio.
El sueño de cristina es tener un negocio  propio para la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Cristina is a memeber of the Niño Divino community bank. Cristina is 36, and she has a common law husband. She has two children, 11 and 4, who attend the state school. Cristina has worked cleaning houses. Later, for eight years she worked with another lady selling food on the Pista Nueva (a street). They also sold used clothes in the area. She learned about the business, and she decided to use her savings to become independent. She started selling used clothes. Cristina needs a loan of 1200 PEN to buy merchandise like decorations for Mother’s Day, artificial flowers, and other items. Since she has been with Finca, which has been very supportive, she has savings. The talks she has attended have been helpful for her business. Cristina’s dream is to have her own business of selling clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like decorations for Mother's Day, artificial flowers, and other items.

loans.name: Abiola

texts.en: Abiola sells onions. She has 2 grinding machines that she uses to grind pepper, tomatoes and beans in her shop. Abiola is 46 years old, married, and has 5 children. Abiola is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN 70,000 ($475 US) to purchase more onions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more onions to sell.
